loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Mrs. Leonila L. lives in Dipolog City. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are still studying, and an active member of Paglaum MPC for the past three years.  She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and helps her husband, who operates a vulcanizing shop, in generating income for the household. She has already taken loans several times for her business.  Now she seeks another loan to redeem their coconut land, which was previously pawned due to financial difficulties.

loans.use: Redemption of pawned coconut land

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en: Andrei has been selling perfume oils for over five years. This has been a very successful business.  When Andrei originally intended to start his business he was skeptical because he did not have enough money to launch the business. He had just closed a lucrative soap shop temporarily to move to a new location. After finally signing the lease, not even two weeks before he was to open, the owners of the property told him that he could not sell jewelry there because his shop would be competing with a major new store that was opening soon. Andrei had two choices. He could either back out of the lease or continue with the lease with a different product mix. This was a very viable location and he did not want to let it go. Over the coming days Andrei had to come up with an idea that he could feel comfortable with in order to move forward. He already had the oils because he carried them in his soap shop, so he decided to renegotiate the lease for a small fragrance shop instead. He knows that this would turn out to be one of the best decisions of his life. Andrei borrowed from the Kiva partner, Microinvest, to pay for the original rental of the shop. Andrei is sure that he will succeed in his business and will return the loan in time to Microinvest.

loans.use: To pay rent on the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more trees for making timber

loans.name: Norjinsuren

texts.en:
Norjinsuren T. is a 32-years-old married woman. Her family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She moved to the capital city from Gobi-Altay, one of the western provinces that is located more than 1,000 kilometers away from the capital. Her husband, Ganbat, works as a plumber for a privately held company.

As soon as she moved in, Norjinsuren started running a retail business, selling vegetables through a rental stall at the local food market. She purchases a variety of vegetables including potatoes, carrots and cabbages from the wholesale market and then resells them at retail prices to locals, mostly repeat buyers.

With this loan Norjinsuren is planning to purchase vegetables to increase her business inventory since she has bought a secondhand car for her business using her business income.

Norjinsuren seems quite a shy woman. She says that ''my husband and I are planning to have a baby in near future. Honestly I don't have a very big dream with my business. What I think in life is I want to have many children and grow them healthy and with no hunger.”

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. sells sarongs of various colors within her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 40 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru: Алимурод Джурабеков проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алимурод более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует  мужской одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alimurod D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. Alimurod has been involved in sales for over 6 years. He has a retail store at a market, where he sells men's clothing. He is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is 44 years old and is a married father of three children. He lives with his family in Mikindani, a town in the coastal province of Kenya. Julius runs an electrical and hardware shop in the same area and has been able to serve his customers for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client and this will be his first time borrowing from KADET to finance his business. He plans to buy square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials for the hardware business. His business is centrally located and being the only hardware in the area, Julius has been able to have many customers.

He hopes to open an even bigger hardware and electrical shop and to start supplying the goods wholesale.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying  square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 44 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado  vacuno y ovino para engorD. la señora Juana también se ayuda con las chacras.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde.

loans.name: Apa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une grande expérimentée de la couture. En effet, elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1984 où elle a ouvert son atelier de couture dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à apporter son aide financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle dispose d’une machine surfileuse et de 02 machines à coudre. Elle dispose de 02 apprentis couturières et dispose de nombreuses clientes ; actuellement la machine surfileuse est tombée en panne ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour en acheter une. Elle compte sur ses bonnes affaires pour rembourser son crédit dans les délais exigés.

loans.use: Achat de machine surfileuse

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty, 32 years old and single, has a salon where she sells hair cream and hair extensions. She also creates lovely hair styles for her customers. Beauty hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS COMADRES  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio San Juan,el Banco esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 13 personas, es uno de un grupo dinámico y alegre; dirigido por su PRESIDENTA MARIANA DALCY,la TESORERA CLAUDIA ROSA y la SECRETARIA CAROLA. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de Ropa,Zapatos,Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrotes, Panaderia, Venta de cd`s,herbalife ,Dulces etc. 
La Presidenta del grupo, tiene 6 años de antigüedad en la Venta de cosmeticos y su nueva innovacion en el mercado de herbalife a la cual va ir destinado este credito; le dedica 8 horas al dia, tiene una hija en edad escolar.  
La Tesorera del Banco, tiene 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de abarrotes a la vez este nuevo credito le permitira invertir mas en su negocio, trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es realizado en su propio domicilio,su meta es de seguir Trabajando y ampliar su negocio. Tiene 3 niños que estudian en la escuela del barrio y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en el sustento del hogar.
La Secretaria lleva 2 años en el negocio de Venta de Dulces, Asaditos (lomitos) y Panza rebozada  trabaja de lunes a viernes en el colegio de la Colorada. Sabe interactuar con las socias es  muy creativa y trabajadora,vive en alquiler y tiene 2 hijas bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS COMADRES is located in the neighborhood San Juan. The bank is in its second cycle, made up of 13 people, and is a dynamic and happy group. It is directed by its president, Mariana Dalcy, the treasurer, Claudia Rosa, and the secretary, Carola. In the group there are women that work selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, groceries, CDs, Herbalife, candy, etc. The president of the group has 6 years of seniority in the sale of cosmetics, and her new innovation is in the market of Herbalife, for which this credit will be used. She dedicates 8 hours a day to her job and has a daughter of school age. The treasurer of the bank has 5 years of seniority in the area of grocery sales, and this credit will allow her to invest more in her business. She works 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, and her job is mostly carried out in her own home. Her goal is to continue working and expand her business. She has 3 children that study in the neighborhood school, and the income that she receives helps in the upkeep of her home. The secretary has worked for 2 years in the business of selling candy and grilled meats. She works from Monday to Friday in the school of Colorada. She knows how to interact with the partners and is very creative and hardworking. She lives in a rented home and has 2 daughters under her responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel L., 30 years-old, is a rice farmer in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato Minadanao.  She has  been helping her husband till their farm to be able to have an abundant harvest. From her one hectare farm, she easily earns Php 45,000 worth of grains, which she utilizes to support their daily needs. 
She needs additional capital to grow her business. The loan will help her fund her farm and buy the farming necessities to grow the harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm equipment.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda C. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. She sells a variety of different products and also cell phone loads (prepaid credits) in the local community. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Glenda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is married and has one child. His child is 22 years old. Benson is 58 years old and hopes to lift his family and business above poverty. He sells clothes and shoes at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a boutique in the future. Benson has been in this business for a long time and loves this business. His customers pay cash when they come to purchase shoes and clothes. He would like to borrow a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. He says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Palestinian man living in the city of Nablus. He owns and manages a grocery shop which he has owned for  six years. It is the only source of income for his family which consists of six members. The business is going very well and there is good demand for its products,

Mohammad requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to pay in cash for some products he previously bought on credit as paying in cash will give him a better price and better product quality. The cost of the loan is much less than the cost of buying stuff from the merchants on credit.

Mohammad appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery shop using cash instead of credit

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Alfredo Jose Manzanares C., tiene la edad de 57 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de sus hijos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Jose Manzanares C. is 57 years old and works as custodian of the Oriental de Managua market. He has 3 children, 2 of which are in school. He is married and has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 years. At this point in time, he has invested 5 loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used for payment of manual labor and the purchase of construction materials such as iron sheets, beams, etc., which will be used to change the roof of his house. This will provide better security and quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of home.

loans.name: Priscila Alexandra

texts.es:
La Srta. Alexandra S. es socia del banco comunal San Bartolo, viven en la comunidad La libertad de San Bartolo, que se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un lugar muy hermoso que cuenta con una belleza natural y vegetación exhuberante. Este Bankito esta formado por miembros de un familia que se agruparon en busca de mejores días para sus hijos y también para seguir creciendo con sus negocios.

Alexandra S. es soltera  tiene 20 años y vive en el Sector la Libertad en el  cantón  Sigsig en casa de sus padres  quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Alexandra se dedica a la cría de cuyes, ganado, tambien  elabora quesillo que lo  vende en su comunidad,  con los ingresos que obtiene colabora con los gastos del hogar, este es su tercer ciclo en la Fundación y  nos comenta que los créditos recibidos le han  permitido comprar sus animales, ahora  con el préstamo que le entreguen  va a  comprar  una vaca y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su gran sueño es comprar una casita y un terreno.
texts.en:
Miss Alexandra S. is a member of the San Bartolo Communal Bank, whose members live in the La Libertad community of San Bartolo, about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It’s a very beautiful place with a natural beauty and exuberant vegetation. The community bank is formed by members of a family that joined together in search of better days for their children and also to continue growing their businesses. Alexandra S. is single. She is 20 years old and lives in the sector la Libertad in the canton Sigsig. She lives with her parents who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock. Alexandra raises guinea pigs and cattle. She also makes cheese that she sells in her community. With the income she obtains, she contributes to the household expenses. This is her third cycle with the foundation, and she tells us that the loans she has received have allowed her to buy her animals. Now with the loan that you give her, she’s going to buy a cow and guinea pigs in order to increase her farm. Her biggest dream is to buy a little house and some land.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and guinea pigs

loans.name: Kiné

texts.fr: Kiné G. est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 6 ans. Elle est vendeuse de friperie, elle achète des ballots de friperies par catégorie, habits pour enfants, pour hommes, pour dames etc. et les revend dans son quartier et au marché. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par rapport à la dépense quotidienne et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Kiné G. is married and the mother of four children. She is 30 years old, and has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » loan group of Wango for the past six years. She retails second-hand clothing, by first buying bales of used clothes in different categories (children’s clothes, men’s, women’s, etc.), and then reselling them in her neighbourhood and at the market. Her objective is to assist her husband with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Damaris A. tiene un negocio de venta de carde de cerdo ubicado en el sector chaco frente al sector verdura  es casada con tres hijos en edad escolar.
Sus financiamientos siempre los ocupa para su propio negocio  para comprar chanchos o para remodelar su tramo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  y ella administra el negocio su negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo ya que el le dio la plata para que empezaran a vender en el mercado ya que la familia de él tienen sus tramos de venta de carde de cerdo. Con la ayuda del Dios ha sabido administrar bien su negocio e inculcarles a sus hijos las buenas costumbres sus financiamientos les ha ayudado a salir adelante e ir metiéndole poco a poco a su terreno que con puro esfuerzo lo compro.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris A. has a business selling pork, located in the Chaco market across from the vegetable section. She is married and has three school-aged children. She always uses her loans for her business, buying pigs or remodeling her sales stall. She manages the business and receives help from her husband. She began the busienss with her husband's help; he provided the money so that she could begin selling at the market, since his family members also have stalls selling pork. She says that with God's help she has been able to manage her business well and also teach her children good manners. Her loans have helped her get ahead and also build little by little on the land which she bought through her own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying some pigs in order to sell the meat at a good price

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: A sus 52 años Lidia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, hace muchos años empezó con el negocio de abarrotes que le permitió mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y aportar para la educación de su hijo, ahora nuestra socia se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, además tiene un local que lo alquila para una ferretería Con el préstamo obtenido desea hacer mejoras en su vivienda para emprender un nuevo negocio, Lidia agradece a EDAPROSPO y KIVA por los préstamos recibidos
texts.en:
At 52 years old, Lidia is a hardworking and responsible woman. Many years ago, she started a grocery store that allowed her to better the infrastructure of her home and contribute to the education of her son. Now, our member works renting rooms, in addition, she has a place that she rents out for a hardware store. With this loan, she wishes to make improvements to her house to begin a new business. Lidia is thankful to EDAPROSPO and KIVA for the loans she's received.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a middleman, buying rice from the local farmers to stock for resale for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband grinds rice at home and raises pigs to help his wife.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more rice to stock for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send her children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Serfinaz

texts.en:
Serfinaz M. is 38 years old and married, with 3 children. Serfinaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Kalbadjar region.  She has settled in the Absheron region. 

She has been in the carpet business for 4 years. Her shop is small but very good. She is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 carpets to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy 5 carpets

loans.name: Isabel Ernestina

texts.es:
Isabel de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos. Isabel era vendedora de carnes hace 12 años pero por cargar carnes tuvieron que operarla de la apéndice de urgencia, y tuvo que abandonar esa actividad por lo riesgoso que era. 

Isabel en la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta de pollos fuera de su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, comprar los pollos en criadero y ella se encarga de pelarlos y tenerlos listo para la venta. Cada pollo los vende desde $ 8.00 según la librar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para su negocio también una parte la quiere utilizar para adecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener una avícola (venta al por mayor de pollos).
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old, lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil, and has three children. Isabel has sold meats for 12 years but while loading the meats they had to do an emergency operation on her appendix so she had to abandon this activity because of its riskiness. Currently, Isabel has a chicken stand outside of her house where she works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She buys the chickens from a farm, and she is in charge of plucking them and getting them ready to be sold. Each chicken is sold for a minimum of $8.00, according to their weight. With this loan, Isabel would like to buy chickens for her business. She also wants to use a part of the loan to improve her house. In the future she would like to have her own poultry (sell chickens at wholesale).

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Khun Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Khun Ma O., 45, is a villager who lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Rin Leng, are farmers who own three hectares of land and a threshing machine to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Khun Ma O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. The couple has three children; one is a driver of a threshing machine, one is a farmer and the youngest is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has one child. Sylivia has a business running a retail shop, which specializes in selling coffee. Sylivia has had this business for about two years. To expand her business, Sylivia is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more quantities of coffee that Sylivia can sell to customers in her community. Sylivia hopes to expand her business and possibly sell other products, and gain a greater income for her family. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Buy quantities of coffee to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene 38 años, y toda su vida transcurre alrededor de constante esfuerzo, ella, está casada con Fidmer, de 33 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con uno de ellos, en sus casa propia. Desde muy pequeña trabaja en la chacra, porque sus padres fueron grandes agricultores que le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas que ahora emplea.  De esa manera han transcurrido 15 años, cultivando papa de manera independiente, que junto a su esposo cuidan de sus plantaciones. Ella, ama la tierra que la vio nacer y desde siempre sembró grandes extensiones de papa, porque la zona donde vive es alta, lugar estratégico donde produce mejor este tubérculo. Lo que más le gusta es hacer surcos para dejarlos alineados, técnica que ayuda a desarrollarse libremente y crecer fuertes la papa, sin embargo el tener que cargar los pesados sacos y trasladarlos a los mercados le resulta pesado, por eso busca compradores directos. Con el fin de tener más ingresos económicos, desea instalar un puesto de venta en el mercado de su ciudad, para que pueda comercializar verduras y papa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, además está contenta de trabajar en este grupo comunal, puesto que conoce a todos los integrantes que la conforman. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Rosario is 38 years old and has spent her entire life constantly working. She is married to Fidmer, age 33, and they live in their own home with only one of their three children. From a young age Rosario worked on a farm. Her parents were experienced farmers who taught her all the farming techniques that she now employs. Since then, fifteen years have passed. She now works independently growing potatoes and her husband helps with monitoring their crops. Rosario loves the land where she was born and has always planted large tracts of potatoes because the area where she lives is in high altitude, making it an ideal place for producing the best tubers. What she enjoys most is aligning the rows of potatoes, a technique that has helped her develop freely as a farmer and has resulted in successful crops. However, she has to carry heavy sacks of potatoes and transport them directly to the market where the buyers are located. She does all this in order to have more income. Rosario hopes to open a vending post at the city market where she can sell vegetables and potatoes.

This is the first time she has taken a loan with MFP. Rosario is happy to be working with this Communal Bank because she knows all of the members. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of compost for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Eunice D. is the mother of three children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when still very young and when she finds it difficult to single-handedly pay tuition fees and provide the basic needs for her children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from GHAPE. As she was unable to get investment capital that would help increase her income, she was motivated to request a loan from GHAPE. 

With the loan, she plans to buy three tins of beans seedlings for 195,500FCFA and she will use 30,500FCFA to pay for labor on her farm. She will pay for clearing, hoeing and planting.

She thinks the business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time, she has a plot of land on which to operate and, also, her community will provide a ready market for her beans when they are ready. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees and cover the basic needs of her children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy beans and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 44 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos plásticos, se siente muy contenta por tener la oportunidad  de acceder a financiamientos.  Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo con la ayuda de su Mama logro tener en su propio establecimiento en el mercado, por lo que se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Este crédito es destinado para comprar sillas, bolsas, vasos, cucharas y cubiertos.  Espera seguir ampliando su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 44 years old. She has a business selling plastic products. She feels very pleased to have the opportunity to access a loan. For more than 14 years she sold her products as a street vendor, but over time and with the help of her mother she managed to get her own establishment in the market. She gets up very early at 5 in the morning and works until 6 in the evening each day. This loan will be used to buy chairs, bags, cups, spoons and cutlery. She hopes to continue to expand her business and have higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy plastic products

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el caserío San Carranco del distrito de Túcume, un distrito bastante conocido por sus atractivo arqueológico, en el se encuentra situado un complejo de pirámides cuya construcción data de temporadas preincaicas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar como panadero, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño horno instalado en su domicilio, todos los dias por la noche prepara la masa que horneará al dia siguiente muy temprano para luego distribuirla en los caseríos que se encuetran alrededor del lugar en donde vive e incluso en el distrito de Túcume. Con este negocio el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia.

José Manuel desea ampliar su negocio fabricando mas pan, por ello ha crédito conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y materiales con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

José Manuel es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y preparar mas variedad de productos. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 31 years old. He is single and lives in the community of San Carranco of the Túcume district. It is a district that is very well known for it archeological attractions. A complex of pyramids is found there whose construction dates from pre-Incan times. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years he has worked as a bread baker. Presently he has a small oven installed in his home. Every night he prepares the dough that he will bake very early the next day to distribute in the communities located near the place he lives and even in the Túcume district. He is able to pay his expenses and help his family with the business. José Manuel wants to expand his business by making more bread. For this he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in purchasing ingredients and materials to attain his goal. José Manuel is a hardworking and enterprising person. His greatest wish is to keep growing as a businessman and prepare a wider variety of products. He has worked with our institution before and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and materials to increase production in a bread bakery located in his home.

loans.name: Cinthia Erikca

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia vive en el Municipio de la Guardia distante 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, nacida en el mismo departamento, tiene su domicilio en el barrio el Carmen donde vive aun con sus padres, es de profesión profesora, y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza,  aproximadamente 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo es de profesión abogado, el cual recién esta ejerciendo  la profesión,  el cual alterna su trabajo como chofer de taxi, para ayudar así a su esposa en la economía del hogar, tienen un hijo en edad escolar por lo que tienen que brindarle el mayor apoyo económico, emocional, para que así salga adelante, el destino del crédito es para comprarle llantas a su vehículo, que es su herramienta de trabajo e su esposo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Cinthia lives in the town of La Guardia, which is 20km from the city of Santa Cruz de La Sierra. She was born in the same department and lives at her home in the El Carmen neighborhood with her parents. Cinthia is a teacher by profession and has also been selling beauty products for approximately four years. Her husband is a lawyer and just recently started his profession. He also spends part of his time working as a taxi driver in order to help with the household finances. They have a school age child for whom they provide financial and emotional support so that he can get ahead.

Cinthia will use this loan to buy tires for her husband’s vehicle, since it is the main piece of equipment he uses for work. She is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred M. N. is twenty-seven years old, married to a casual laborer and has one child aged three years old whom he hopes to give a good education to the university level. He describes himself as very hardworking, self-motivated and optimistic.

Wilfred’s business, the AMR shop, is located in a busy market in a residential area called Mukuru Kwa Njenga. Wilfred is served by the Kitengela Branch. He has been selling general items in his shop which include cooking fat, cigarettes, detergents, kerosene and other things. He has been in business for eight months now. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he has is that there are many other people in the area with the same kind of business, so customer loyalty is difficult to maintain. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well.

Wilfred is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more general items which include cooking fat, detergent, flour, etc. to grow his business and be able to cater to all his customers' needs. He hopes to enlarge his shop to a supermarket. He also hopes that some day he will be able to provide employment to the local community, acquire a van and purchase land for building a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more products such as cooking fat, detergents, flour, kerosene, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan C. tiene 28 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor C. es una personas sencilla, con ganas de superarse y trabajadora. El se dedica actualmente a la agricultura y  al transporte como chofer. Hace algunos años atrás el solo se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero ha tenido que buscar otra ocupación porque la producción de alimentos ha disminuido por la falta de agua. 
El desea volver a dedicarse por completo a la agricultura solamente, porque tiene espacio suficiente para cultivar alimentos y piensa que esta actividad le va ayudar a mejorar su vida. Pero para realizar esta actividad necesita tener agua suficiente.

Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita tener agua para regar sus plantas y dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan C., 28, lives in the Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe area of Quillacollo province, Cochabamba department.

He is an unassuming, hard working person who wants to get ahead in life.  He is a farmer and also a driver in transportation.  A few years back he was just a farmer but has had to seek additional employment because the lack of water has decreased farm production.

He wants to go back to being a farmer full time because he has fields sufficient to grow food and feels this activity can help him improve his life.  However, in order to do this he needs to have sufficient water.

He has, therefore, asked for a loan to be a shareholder in a well so that he can have enough water to irrigate his plants and thus be able to be a farmer.

loans.use: To buy a share in a well to have water for irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For plant health maintenance.

loans.name: Leana Bianca

texts.en:
Leana Bianca C. is from the village of Brgy.San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Leana Bianca is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leana Bianca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Leana Bianca has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leana Bianca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leana Bianca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leana Bianca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jesus Joaquin

texts.es: El  Sr. Jesus Joaquin G., es una persona muy emprendedora, que le gusta mucho el comercio, el  ya obruvo un credito con esta institucion, y le parecio que  lo ayudo mucho en lo que el necesitaba invertir, por eso recurre nuevamente a esta institucion, por que este año el se quiere preparar con mas mercancia de electronica, ya que su clientela ha ido en aumento y le solicitan mas reparaciones de aparatos, asi como accesorios que el tambien vende a un precio muy  accsesible, poco a poco ha ido agrandando el negocio, que es el sustento de su familia, ya que de el dependen su esposa y sus 3 hijos a los que mantiene desde  alimentacion, casa y vestido. y  esta muy satisfecho con  el credito que esta institucion le ha brindado.
texts.en: Jesus Joaquin G. is a very enterprising person who likes being in business a lot.  He has already had a loan from this insitutions and it would appear that it helped him a lot with what he needed to invest in.  For this reason, he is turning to the institution again because this year he wants to be prepared with more electronics merchandise since his customer base has grown and his customers are asking him to repair more appliances as well as asking him for accessories which he also sells at very affordable prices.  Little by little, he has managed to expand his business which is his family's source of support since his wife and 3 children depend on it and he relies on it to feed them, house them and dress them.  He is very satisfied with the loan that this institution has offered him.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma G. is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business.  She lives in Nasipit, Brgy. Cabangahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000. Wilma is now borrowing Php 20,000 so that she can purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Wilma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. is divorced and has a child. This picture shows her preparing kenkey, a fermented dough usually made from corn/maize and served with soup or vegetables. Esi works producing and selling kenkey at Abura. She uses her income to provide for the well-being of her family.

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize to produce kenkey on a larger scale. With the profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide the best possible education for her child.

loans.use: the purchase bags of corn

loans.name: Badiru

texts.en:
Badiru R. is 44 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Badiru has a grocery store business, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Badiru has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Badiru hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Badiru hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou D.  est âgée de 44 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants, ses coépouses et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Dangassa, un des villages de la préfecture  de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Oumou D. n’est pas partie à l’école pour des raisons sociales. Très tôt  elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment aux agrégats de construction sable, gravier, moellon, dalles, etc. Elle a appris cette activité (qui reste très dominée par les hommes au Mali) auprès de son  grand frère, qui est un grand commerçant de matériels de construction. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé son premier prêt elle est à son deuxième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 50 m3 de sables et 10 m3 de gravier auprès des GIE qui font les extractions de ces matériaux au fleuve. Elle vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée d’entrepreneurs de Ouelessebougou et Bamako. Elle  reçoit  souvent des  commandes  de fournitures de certaines entreprises en B.T.P. en sables, graviers etc.
Oumou D. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Oumou D. is 44 years old and she lives with her 4 children, her co-wives, and her husband in a traditional extended family in Dangassa. It is a village in the Kati prefecture in the region of Koulikoro. 

Oumou D. did not attend school for social reasons. From a very early age she became interested in revenue generating activities including construction materials such as sand, gravel, rubble, cement slabs, etc. she learned the business (which is highly dominated by men in Mali) from her eldest brother who is a great merchant of construction materials. 

IN order to satisfy an ever growing clientele, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Having successfully repaid her first loan, she is now on her second individual loan.  She will use it to purchase 50 cubic meters of sand, 10 cubic meters of gravel from GIE who extract the materials from the river. She sells essentially in wholesale to a clientele made up of retailers in Ouelessebougou and Bamako. She often receives orders for supplies from certain companies in B.T.P. including sand, gravel, etc.

OUmou D. expects to earn a monthly income of 90.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan and to reinvest the remaining portion in her business.

loans.use: To purchase sand and gravel.

loans.name: Teresa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre D. familia D. 53 años D. edad;  que resiD. en el distrito D. Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial, conocida como la capital del limón; que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta D. alimentos desD. hace siete años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta en el interior del mercado D. Olmos. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida por parte D. sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Teresa se vale D. los ingresos que recibe D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía D. su familia.

Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos y utensilios que le permitan ampliar su producción y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 53 year old mother, residing in the mostly commercial farming district of Olmos - known as the lemon capital - which is part of the Lambayeque province, just over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last 7 years, Teresa has worked preparing food at home and later selling it within the Olmos market. Her business is warmly received by her clients as she has a real flair for cooking. Teresa uses the profits that she receives from this work to help her husband settle their family's living expenses.

Teresa wishes to expand her business with the purchase of supplies and utensils which will allow her to increase her production and sales. Consequently, she thought it best to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a S/2000 (Nuevos Soles) loan.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and utensils

loans.name: Momoh B.a's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the KMDEC Moiwo St I & II in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1960 by the Kallon family in order to improve education in the district. This school is currently staffed with 71 teachers and has an enrollment of 1692 pupils.

This is the first time that teachers of the KMDEC primary school have benefited from a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 13,100,000 to enable them to buy or invest in something that their meager salaries cannot let them do.

Momoh B.A. A. is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Vaahun village in eastern Sierra Leone and has been in the teaching profession for 35 years. Momoh is 51 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have 6 children – 2 in college and 4 adults. With his share of this loan, Momoh will pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's college fees

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Dinorah, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tostadas, su familia le ayuda a la preparación de dicho producto, este negocio lo inicio hace varios años ya que tenia la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para realizar sus  ventas: plátanos verdes, yuca y bolsas.  Esta compra le ayudara a mantener lo necesario para producir y ofrecer a los clientes siempre una buena atención.
Su aspiración es que a través del negocio pueda mejorar la condición económica de su familia y hacer crecer a sus hijos con la educación para que se puedan desempeñar en un trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinorah is 47 years old.  She lives in the El Tránsito area of San Miguel with her husband and two children ages 18 and 12.  She sells tostadas (fried plantain), which her family helps her prepare.  She started this business a number of years ago when she needed to help her husband cover the household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients she needs for her sales:  green plantains, yucca, and bags. This purchase will help her to have sufficient product to always provide her customers with good service. She hopes that with this business she can improve her family's financial conditions and raise her children with an education so they can find work.

loans.use: to purchase green plantains, yucca, and bags.

loans.name: Lady Del Rocio

texts.es:
Lady de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio. Ya que tiene un aproximado de dos años con su papelería. Quiere seguir trabajando surtiendo la mercadería que vende. 

Su negocio lo inicio con ayuda de su padre y un préstamo que obtuvo en la Fundación. En la actualidad trabaja todo el día vendiendo en su papelería pañales, cuadernos, papelería etc. Uno de sus inconvenientes es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive pero eso no le impide trabajar por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar pañales, cuadernos, papelería y otros artículos. En el futuro ella desea tener una papelería grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Lady is 21 years old and is a young entrepreneur that has a lot of hopes for her business. She has had her stationary store for about two years. She would like to continue expanding the goods that she sells.
She began her business with the help of her father and a loan that she received from the Fundación. She spends every day working in her stationary store selling paper goods, diapers, notebooks, etc. One of the inconveniences of her work is that some of her customers are delinquent with their payments. This doesn’t stop her from working. She would like this loan to buy diapers, notebooks, paper goods and other articles. In the future she would like a bigger stationary store that has a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy diapers, notebooks and paper goods

loans.name: Manuel Natividad

texts.es:
Manuel, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica al transporte pesado de carga, vive con su esposa Griselda y su hijo de 12 años llamado Manuel, tienen casa propia.
Manuel trabaja desde joven como ayudante de padre, en el negocio de transporte pesado de materiales de construcción a bordo de camiones, actualmente está encargado de un camión y remolque en el cual transporta madera, cemento y arena. El necesita un préstamo personal, para gastos de viaje en su camión, ya que quiere viajar seguro y no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para cubrir el gasto.
Su principal objetivo es mejorar las ganancias y las condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old and he lives in San Miguel. He works in heavy transportation. He lives with his wife Griselda and their 12-year old son, Manuel. They own their own house.  As a young man, Manuel worked as an assistant to his father in the business of heavy transportation of construction materials about trucks. He is currently in charge of one truck and a tow with which he transports lumber, cement, and sand. He needs a personal loan to cover his expenses. 

His principal objective is to improve his earnings and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of travelling for his transport truck

loans.name: Irma Graciela

texts.es: Irma Graciela C. R. vive con sus dos hijos en la zona de San Emigdio en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Ella tiene un negocio en su misma casa, vende pupusas por las noches y en el día se dedica a vender productos para el cuidado personal de la piel, rostro y manos, sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad y el rico sabor de sus pupusas; también tiene mucha clientela que le compra los otros productos que ofrece pues se los da a un buen precio, además ella se caracteriza por ser muy servicial siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro, sus ganas de salir adelante la motivaron a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para las pupusas como queso, frijoles, harina, y productos para el cuidado personal como cremas, perfumes entre otros. Irma es muy entregada a su trabajo pues con el lleva el sustento a su hogar, y tiene fe que con su labor en un futuro le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma Graciela C. R. lives with her two children in the San Emigdio area in the Cuscatlán department.  She has a business in her home.  She sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] at night, and during the day sells personal care products for the skin, face, and hands.  Her customers prefer the quality and rich taste of her pupusas.  She also has many customers who purchase the other products she offers.  She offers good prices, and she is known to be very helpful and always greets her customers with a smile on her face.  

Her desire to succeed motivated her to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to purchase ingredients to make pupusas like cheese, beans, and flour, as well as personal care products like creams and perfumes.  Irma is very dedicated to her work because it supports her family, and she has faith that her hard work will give her family a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, beans, flour, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE est formé de trois  personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier à Sètovi à Cotonou (la capitale économique du Bénin). La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Philomène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Philomène ne vit plus avec son mari, avec qui elle a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Depuis près de cinq ans, Philomène vit seule à Setovi avec un de ses enfants. Philomène n’est pas allée à l’école. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant, Philomène mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente de divers produits dont le riz, le haricot, les conserves, des savons et de la boisson locale, contrairement aux autres membres qui vendent des bois de chauffage. Philomène achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les vend dans son quartier à Sètovi. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Philomène désire obtenir un autre crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
The WANGNIGNIGBE group is composed of three persons, who all reside in the same neighborhood, Setovi, in Cotonou (Benin's economic capital). The representative of the group, Philomene, is the woman raising her hand in the picture. It is the fifth time that this group is requesting ALIDe's financial support to increase their level of activity.

Philomene doesn't live with her husband anymore; she has three children with him, who all go to school. She has been living in Setovi, alone with one of her children, for five years. Philomene did not attend school.

In order to provide for her own needs and to guarantee that her child gets an education, Philomene has been active for about eight years in the retail of various products including rice, beans, canned food, soap and local beverages (the group's other members sell firewood). Philomene purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and sells them in her neighborhood of Setovi. To build up her product stock and better meet customer demand, Philomene wishes to be granted another loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, canned food, soap, and local beverages

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana   is 36 years old. She has a business with her husband purchasing and re-selling poultry and cattle.  They have 5 children. 

Yegana would like to request a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenues and ultimately greater profit for her family. 

In the future, Yegana would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. They plan to use the increased income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase more cattle and fodder

loans.name: Sop Sën Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de onze femmes issues du même quartier. il est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010. Les principales activités menées par les femmes sont le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Souda est âgée de 30 ans, mariée elle a sept enfants en charge dont un neveu orphelin de père. Elle est debout à droite de la photo habillée en bleu clair, couverte d'un châle bleu et à levé la main gauche. 

Elle Fait de l'embouche mais à côté elle mène un petit commerce de divers produits alimentaires.

Elle achète des moutons sur place dans les marchés hebdomadaires et les revend au même endroit après trois à six mois d'embouche. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter d'autres moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire beaucoup d'argent aux prochaines ventes; car en fin de cycle elle en vend pour rembourser son prêt.

Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne avec les bénéfices obtenus. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille pour soutenir son mari à mieux s'occuper des enfants.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of 11 women who come from the same neighborhood. It was created on May 12, 2010. The primary businesses of these women are the sale of small items and fattening livestock. 

Madame Souda, 30, is married and raising seven children, of whom one is a nephew whose father is deceased. She is standing on the right in this photo, dressed in light blue, with a blue headscarf, raising her left hand. 

She fattens livestock, but also sells a few groceries. She buys her sheep at the weekly markets and sells them in the same place after having fattened them for three to six months. She has a lot of experience in this field. 

With her loan, she wants to buy some new sheep to expand her flock so that she can make a lot of money when she sells them again, since she sells some at the end of her loan period so that she can reimburse the loan. 

She hopes to expand her savings with the profit she makes. She helps to cover some family expenses so that her husband can better care for their children.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell later on.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children: two boys and one girl. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

She operates a food stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mary faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. Her dream is to expand and purchase a plot in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil, baking flour and charcoal for sale. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil, baking flour and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been selling electrical goods for the last two years. He supplements this earning with income from his water vending and motorbike transport business. He is a hard working and an aggressive 25-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child aged one year. He wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mobile phone chargers, sockets and bulbs. 

He wants, in the next five years, to expand his business into wholesale and be able to earn enough to purchase his own piece of land. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been enlightened on how to manage his business well.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone chargers, sockets and bulbs.

loans.name: Union Y Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "UNION Y ESFUERZO" porque para el grupo es estar unidas en todos los momentos de la vida y esforzarse por cumplir sus metas. Esta ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señorita Adriana tiene 19 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es comerciante y no tiene hijos. Ella tiene una taqueria como actividad principal desde hace aproximadamente 2 años como actividad adicional se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo pues le gusta tener varios negocios y buscar opciones de salir adelante para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Quiere este prestamo para invertirlo en mobiliario, insumos, zapatos que le piden sus clientes. Sus clientes la prefieren porque sus tacos son muy ricos y simpre tiene limpio su negocio además de que entrega sus pedidos a tiempo y en pagos flexibles. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada y apoyar a su familia en los gastos familiares, debido a la gran demanda que tiene en su taqueria piensa más adelante ampliar su local, lo cual le permita darle una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is called 'Union and Strength' because this group is focused on remaining united at every moment of their lives and working to meet their goals. They are located in the state of Mexico.  The group has 9 members.  Miss Adriana is 19 years old and studied until high school.  She is a saleswoman and does not have children.  She has run a taco stand as a main job for about two years and as a second job works selling shoes through a catalog.  She likes to have many businesses and look for new ways to get ahead and offer her family a better quality of life.  She wants this loan to invest in furniture, supplies, and shoes that her customers order.  Her customers prefer her stand because her tacos are very tasty and her business is always clean.  She also delivers their orders on time and allows for flexible payments.  She is enthusiastic about asking for this loan to help with her family's expenses.  Thanks to the popularity of her taco stand she plans to expand it in the future in order to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: invest in furniture, supplies, and shoes

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
El señor José Luís y su esposa la señora Ana Laura tiene dos hijos que están estudian.
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción y compra de uniformes para la escuela, ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudian. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe como despachador de una gasolinera, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Don José Luís desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: José Luís and his wife, Ana Laura, have two children going to school.  They are asking for a loan to be able to pay registration fees and buy school uniforms because they lack the necessary money so that their children can continue studying.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns as a gasoline station attendant; this is the family’s source of income.  José Luís wants his children to finish their schooling so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school registration fees.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Dorka is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 (Divine Hope).  Her group is located in the rural, agricultural area surrounding Hato Mayor.   She lives in a simple structure with her three-year-old child. Dorka says that building her house is her biggest challenge.  However, in the meantime, she enjoys to work.

Dorka is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after successfully repaying the previous loans and growing her business. She has had her business for over two years, which she started with some of her own savings and a business plan. She joined Esperanza because she was looking for development and with these loans she has found a way to expand her business.  She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying blouses, skirt, pants, shirts, and shoes. She will invest the profits in her business and save some of the profits to start building her house in the near future. She has been able to save to see her dream come to fruition.

Since her first loan, she has been able to grow as a person. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as blouses, skirt, pants, shirts, and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is single.  He has been farming rice for the past four years, having been taught farming by his cooperative. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and harvesting.

Jean de Dieu wishes to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to pay labor to help him on the rice farm.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a father of 6, all adults. He is aged 62 and has been in farming in Nkubu area, Central Kenya for 30 years, producing and selling milk and bananas to the local market.

Henry has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhidi Kilimo to construct a grazing unit for his dairy cows. He says the unit will protect his cows and ensure his milk yield is improved. This, he adds, will improve his families living standards.

He says animal diseases is the greatest challenge.

loans.use: To construct a grazing unit for his dairy cows

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 34 years old and married with one son. Hong earns a living by selling coffee and beverages, which she has done for 4 years. 

Hong would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages and coffee to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, will help her to improve her family's living conditions, and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín de 33 años de edad, soltero, vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Desde muy joven incursionó en el negocio, es por esta razón que ahora tiene una parcela de plantaciones de cacao, que en estos últimos años esta siendo bien cotizado el producto. Sin embargo sus tierras necesitan ser fertilizadas, para lograr obtener mejores cosechas, pero lamentablemente no existe negocio alguno que pueda proveer de estos materiales, por tanto, montó una tienda de venta de agroquímicos. Él ahora esta contento con este nuevo negocio por que le genera buenos ingresos, y con este dinero desea terminar sus estudios. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Efraín is 33 years old, single and lives in his own home located in the Llochegua district. He has been working from a young age, which is why he now has a plot of cocoa plantations which have been highly valued in the last few years. However, the soil needs fertiliser to produce a better harvest, but unfortunately there was no business which could provide these materials until Efrain set up a store selling agricultural chemicals. He is happy with this new business as it has generated a good source of income for him, which he would like to put towards finishing his studies. 

This will be Efrain's first loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With this loan of 3,000 soles he will buy more fertiliser.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie has 17 years of experience working as a psychotherapist in New York City. Six years ago, she transformed her therapy practitioner experience into a business by creating Trance4mation Games, LLC. Leslie’s primary occupation is counseling but she enjoys creating therapeutic, interactive games that help people. The first game she created, called "Keep It Real Game", cultivates team building for youth by asking questions that each player answers within the group.

In 2010, Leslie started developing a new project. It’s an interactive card game that helps soldiers returning from war better integrate into society. Leslie has invested a lot of her income and time into the development of the new card game, Warrior Spirit Game. She now has a large order for the Warrior Spirit Game and needs to stock up inventory for upcoming events where she will be selling the product.

With this loan, Leslie will pay for the production of the game in order to increase inventory.

Check out the new Warrior Spirit Game here:
http://www.missionhomefront.com

loans.use: To pay for the production of her new game.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is 24 years old and married. He runs a grocery store which mainly sells fruit. He started the business in 2002. His business environment is very busy, hence he gets many customers. He has benefited from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management. This has helped him to improve his business. Frank hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit for his stall.

loans.use: to buy fruit for his store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 33-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has been running a pub in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.
Grace requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase sugar and fish for sale. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, beer and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Irene Mumbi

texts.en: Irene Mumbi is 29 years old, married, and has two daughters. She is a tailor. She makes clothes and school uniforms and sells them to schools, both to new and frequent customers. The business faces high demand from her clients. This make it difficult for her to be able to meet her customer's needs, since she has limited materials for making clothes. She wants a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more materials and a sewing machine. Irene describes herself as optimistic and confident.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mme Awa est une jeune couturière de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le domaine depuis tout juste un an. Elle a fait ses débuts dans le commerce et continue à  l’allier  avec la couture : confection-vente.
Avec l’argent du prêt Awa aimerai acheter une machine cornière  et une Vi pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande.
Avec les bénéfices, elle améliore petit à petit la qualité de son service.
texts.en:
Awa is a 36 years old and married. She is a seamstress and has been sewing for a year. She is just starting in business and plans to use her sewing skills to build a business manufacturing and selling clothes.

Awa will use the loan to buy an embroidery sewing machine so that she can better satisfy customer demand. She is using the profits from her business to gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mulwanda B Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Mulwanda B group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and send her children to school.

In 2012, the members of Mulwanda B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica nacida en el municipio del torno, la Sra. Verónica esta  separada de su pareja, vive en la localidad de San Luis, ella tiene 1 hijo de 5 años que según la señora Verónica es su razón de  superarse día a día. La Sra. Verónica se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza a domicilio y ambulando por distintos lugares visita también oficinas. El destino del crédito es para la ampliar el negocio comprando mercaderías por mayor de sus productos de belleza. Por lo tanto ella esta agradecida con la institución por su primer préstamo, ya que le esta dando una oportunidad de iniciar y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Verónica was born in the municipality of El Torno.  She’s separated from her spouse and living in San Luis.  She has a five-year-old son who according to Verónica is her reason for being better every day.  Verónica sells beauty products door to door and also wandering through various places; she also visits offices.  The loan is to expand the business buying beauty product merchandise at wholesale.  She is grateful to the institution for this, her first loan, because it’s giving her an opportunity to start out and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 29-year-old lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Areej is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration to improve her family life conditions and increase their standards.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina has requested a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es:
El deseo de Adriana es estudiar en campo alto  porque  quiere superarse más, ya que debido a que no ha estudiado se le han cerrado muchas puertas a nivel laboral.
