Para ella es muy importante estudiar a esta edad  porque quiere demostrarles  a sus hijos y amigos que nunca es tarde para aprender y que el estudio es la base para una vida mejor.
Adriana tiene muchas expectativas  al estudiar para Auxiliar judicial porque le gusta mucho el tema y le apasiona, y aunque no es una carrera profesional, se ha dado cuenta que los técnicos también son valorados a nivel empresarial. Solo espera poder aprender al máximo y poder ejercer laboralmente en esta área.
Básicamente no ha podido estudiar por cuestiones económicas y esta oportunidad que le están ofreciendo de acceder a un descuento adicional por parte del convenio Kiva le ha hecho tomar la decisión de no dejar pasar las oportunidades que la vida me da en este momento.
texts.en:
Adriana's wish is to study at CampoAlto because she wants to exceed. Since she has not studied, many doors in the labour field have been closed to her. It is very important for her to study at this age because she wants to show her children and friends that it is never late to learn and that studying is the base for a life better.

Adriana has high expectations studying for Judicial Assistant because she likes the subject very much and she is passionate about it. And although it is not a professional course she has realized that the technicians also are valued at a business level. She hopes to learn the most and to be able to work in this area.

Basically, she hasn't been able to study because of financial reasons and this opportunity that is being offered to her, to gain admission at an additional discount on behalf of the Kiva agreement, has made her make the decision of not passing on the opportunity that life is giving me now.

loans.use: to study at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten members of the women’s tontine Ayidjidjo, represented by Madeleine D..  Based in the village of Oussouye on the banks of the Casamance River in southern Senegal, the Ayidjidjo group engages in long-distance trade, transporting goods produced in Oussouye to distant markets where the demand for them is high and returning with products that are in short supply in Oussouye.  Typical products of Oussouye exported by the members of Ayidjidjo include:

  
  • Brooms made from palm fronds
  • Palm oil (used in traditional cooking throughout West Africa)
  • Millet oil (used by traditional healers to treat bone fractures)
  • Soap made from crushed oil palm nuts

Madeleine and her associates have requested a loan to scale up their inter-regional trade activities by purchasing greater quantities of locally produced goods and investing in their transportation to the markets of other regions. 

  

Background

 Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Long-distance trade: wholesale purchase and transport to market of local village products

loans.name: Farman

texts.en: Farman a low-income person, is originally from the Agsu district. He started his cafe in 2004. In 2005 he borrowed $300 from Normicro, Agsu branch and used it to buy equipment for his business. Now he wants to borrow another 300$ to repair his shop.

loans.use: to repair the shop

loans.name: Patosina

texts.en: Patosina is a farmer who has survived and developed her family’s status in life and financially by working six days a week on their family plantation. The plantation provides income to accommodate her growing family. She sells her crops to neighbors and caters to near by villages.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, stings and seeds

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 38-year-old married mother of an 11-year-old daughter. Her husband is a public employee and contributes to household expenses. Her daughter is taking elementary classes and is also studying at a dance institute. Maria sees her daughter as a source of inspiration; she wishes she keeps studying and becomes a professional and able to have the opportunities that Maria couldn't.

Maria says that she has worked from a very early age. Her parents were very poor, and what they earned was not enough to proviD. for the family. She could not finish he studies, only making it to sixth graD.. Her mother was her principal teacher. She was dressmaker, and taught Maria the traD.. Today, Maria makes all types of garments, chiefly uniforms for schoolchildren and office workers, with distinct types of fabrics. She works out of her home where, along with her tailing shop, she runs a haberdashery, selling crafts, toys, party supplies and gift items. Maria wants to acquire cloth in large quantities, since she has received several orders from schools for uniforms in the spring, which she should already start working on. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase the necessary fabric, needles and buttons.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora María tiene 39 años es casada con una hija D. 11 años. Su cónyuge es empleado público y aporta con los ingresos D. la casa. Su hija esta cursando sus estudios básicos y también estudia danza en un instituto D. baile; su hija es su fuente D. inspiración, ella desea que siga estudiando para llegar a ser una profesional y tener las oportunidades que ella no tuvo. María nos cuenta que desD. muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar; sus padres eran muy pobres y con lo que ellos ganaban no alcanzaba para el sustento D. la familia. Ella no culminó sus estudios, solo llego hasta el 6to. Año D. la escuela primaria; su madre fue su principal maestra, ella era modista y le enseño el oficio D. la costura y la confección. Hoy día María cose todo tipo D. prendas, con distintos tipos D. telas, desD. buzos, uniformes para alumnos, docentes y para oficinistas. Ella trabaja en su casa donD. aparte D. su taller D. costura también tiene una mercería donD. se dedica a la venta D. aretesanías, juguetes, cotillón y artículos para regalo. María desea adquirir telas livianas en gran cantidad, pues ha recibido propuestas D. diferentes colegios que solicitan que se les confeccione los uniformes para la temporada D. primavera, para lo cual ya debe empezar a trabajar; por eso, ella solicita un crédito D. $ 200 con los que podrá adquirir las telas, hilos y botones que necesita para su labor.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale, needles and buttons

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old and lives with Eugenio, a furniture refinisher, with whom she has four children, ages 26, 22, 16 and 11. The two oldest are married and the two youngest still live at home and attend school. She went to work as a maid to help her mother when she was 16 years old and never finished school, having many obligations and no time for studying.

For the past two years she has been running a small grocery stand from her home. With her partner's unconditional support, she has been able to make ends meet and provide for her children what she was unable to pursue herself - a college education.

She belongs to a group called Solidarity Women's Committee, along with 20 other women who support each other and serve as guarantors' for each other's loans.

Julia is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her small grocery stand with items like noodles, yerba (similar to green tea), sugar, rice, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene 46 años, está en pareja con Eugenio que se dedica a lustrar muebles y con quien tiene 4 hijos de 26, 22 , 16 y 11 años respectivamente. Los dos hijos mayores ya están casados mientras que los dos menores viven con ella y aún siguen estudiando. Empezó a trabajar a los 16 años como empleada doméstica para ayudar a su madre, eso le impidió culminar sus estudios ya que tenía muchas preocupaciones y poco tiempo para dedicarle al estudio. Actualmente tiene un pequeño kiosko que funciona hace 2 años en su domicilio, con la ayuda incondicional que recibe de su pareja consiguió salir adelante y de esta forma brindarle a sus hijos todo lo que la vida le impidió, es decir el poder terminar una carrera universitaria. Ella forma parte de un grupo denominado Comité Mujeres Solidarias integrado por 20 mujeres que responden solidariamente por los créditos a los que acceden a través de dicho comité. Julia necesita de un préstamo de U$S 150 para de esta forma poder surtir su pequeño negocio con mercaderías tales como: fideos, yerba, azúcar, arroz, golosinas,bebidas, etc.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas productos y ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Ghana is the world’s second largest producer of cocoa. While most of the crop is exported to make chocolate, Abena, 45, uses cocoa pod, baking soda, and palm oil to make soap locally. She sells two main types of soap, Alata and Azuma blow. Alata is a Twi word for Nigerian, because the soap originated from Nigeria. Azuma is a famous boxer. Supposedly this soap can combat any laundry stain like Azuma combats his opponents.

Abena has 23 years of experience making soap. Her soap is so popular, that every time she makes it, it sells out in about a week. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more raw materials to make more soap, since people in the market are demanding it.

Other than expanding her store, Abena is using her profits to complete her home. Currently she lives in a half-built house with her husband and seven children. Most of the rooms are incomplete and uninhabitable.

Abena is a leader of the lending group, The Believers. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount

loans.use: To purchase oil, charcoal, baking powder, and cocoa pods.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin is 41 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Khachmaz town with his family. Aydin strated his business (selling foodstuffs) 4 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy foodstuffs to sell in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Yegane

texts.en: Yegane I. buys and sells cows in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She and her husband have been working in this business for the last six years and have already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma Lending Group

texts.en:
Moses N. has been a farmer all his life. He is 47 years old, married with seven children and he cares for three orphans. He grows maize, beans, coffee, and bananas and he has been our client for three years. His children are still in lower classes at school. The loans have really helped him in his crop fields, especially with manpower, enabling him to get enough profits that he uses partly to pay the children’s school dues.

Moses is the leader of the Bwavu Mpologoma Lending group, which will share in this loan.

loans.use: Moses plans to employ workers on his maize, beans, banana and coffee for better yields.

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
M. Olim is 46 years old. Olim has been running his business for the last 17 years. He is a master of fixing vehicles. At the same time he is providing taxi services. Being a very hard-working person, Olim managed to make his business successful, and generates stable profits for his family.

Now, however, Olim wants to improve the quality of his services. He is planning to purchase spare parts required for his auto repair shop. This is why today he requests $600.00 for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Olim, and he wants to ensure everyone supporting him that he shall be able to repay it on time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts required for fixing vehicles.

loans.name: Amanccay Group

texts.en:
“Amanccay” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari Project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Amanccay”, is located at approximately 3,500 meters above sea-level, in the community of Añancusi in the district of Acoria, province of Huancavelica. The name "Amanccay" comes from a local flower. The main activities of the population are the growth of corn, potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes), and at lower altitudes of the Mantaro River tropical fruits. Most of the population also have cows, bulls and sheep, and at the higher altitudes llamas and alpacas. In the small town the population have some shops and proviD. several services, but the main commercial activity is on Tuesday, when there is the local market, where most people do business.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan-cycle with currently 12 female borrowers and a total loan of 4,200 soles (about 1,550 US$). The loans range from 200, 400, and up to 500 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save, except for the initial loan to start. But all agree to save in the future.

One of the members of the community bank is Isabel Ignacia D. L. C. T.. Isabel has a small “cafetin” business where she sells sweets, sandwiches and soft drinks at the local school. Besides her “cafetin” she sells fruits at local markets. With her 200 soles loan, she will buy more things for her business. Sometimes she kills one of the sheep to sell the meat. Like most people she has a small plot of land where the family cultivates a variety of products and has a small stock of cattle. With FINCA Perú she hopes to have her own savings to be able to buy a house in a bigger town, to work more enthusiastically and with more responsibility and to receive trainings. And her dream….. for her son to be a professional!

Another story tells Epifania M. Y., who has her own grocery store. With her 500 soles loan she will buy more groceries to fill up her store again. And like Isabel, she also has a small plot where the family cultivates a variety of products and has a small stock of cattle, but mostly for their own consumption. Her dream for the future is to buy a house in Huancayo, one of the major cities in the central Andes, and for her children to be professionals. With her savings she will able to increase business, buying more merchandise and selling more. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more, to receive trainings and to be respected as a woman.

loans.use: Buy new supplies for business

loans.name: Adjoagan Lucienne

texts.fr:
Born in 1951 in Lomé, Mrs. Adjoagan Lucienne A. is separated from her husband who began taking additional wives twenty years ago. Since then she has been taking care of her children by herself with her small grocery and basic goods business. She is seeking financing to expand the size of her business and to stock food products in bulk to better satisfy her customer demand. This will allow her to increase her income in order to better take care of her children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1951 à Lomé, madame Adjoagan Lucienne A. s’est séparé de son mari qui est devenu polygame il y a de cela 20 ans. Depuis lors elle a pris soin de ses enfants seuls avec son petit commerce produits alimentaires de premières nécessités. Elle sollicite un fonds de financement pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et s’approvisionner en grande quantité en produits alimentaires et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus afin de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.

loans.use: Retail of grocery products

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S., 30, stays at home cooking and caring for the entire family. Her husband, Chi Saroeun, 27, stationed at one of the big hotels in Phnom Penh, has been a motor-taxi driver since 2007. His clients are tourists who he takes to the main attractions in and around Phnom Penh. Chi must now spend over half of his earned revenue on gas and motor repairs, so he is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva to help replace an old unreliable motorbike. A new motorbike will enable him to retain more of his earnings. (Chi is pictured because Mrs. Meas S. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband's  business.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto the Panamericana center is found, to which the association named “Sol Radiante” composed of 17 members belongs. It is a very happy group that together with their credit assistant works with Pro-Mujer with a lot of responsibility and enthusiasm. The majority of the group members are married and with large families. Currently they live in rented rooms which have become small for them with the passage of time and the growth of their children. They have the dream to be able to buy their own homes to be able to offer greater comfort to their children, which is why they work from the early morning making lunches and dinners which they sell in the markets of the city of El Alto. Now they have be able to get contracts in some construction sites, which is why they need the loan to be able to purchase more ingredients and to hire kitchen helpers. This will allow them to double their production and get greater earnings to be able to save for the purchase of a house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Panamericana, a este pertenece la asociación “Sol Radiante ” integrado por 17 miembros. Un grupo muy alegre que junto a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad y entusismo. La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en cuartos que con el paso del tiempo y el crecer de sus hijos les han quedado pequeños, tiene el sueño de poder comprar una casa propia para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos, por lo que trabajan desde muy temprano en la elaboración de almuerzos y cenas , que los venden en mercados de la ciudad de El Alto , ahora lograron conseguir contratos en algunas construcciones de edificios, por lo que necesitan crédito para la compra de mayores insumos y para contratar ayudantes de cocina, esto les permitirá duplicar la producción y conseguir mayores ganancias para poder ahorrar para la compra de su casa en un futuro .

loans.use: They need capital to purchase materials and hire assistants.

loans.name: Nann

texts.en: This the second time of Mrs. Nann T. is asking for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Thmey Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Sreng Sun, is a fisherman in the local lake. Mrs. Nann T. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a scarf sewer while the remaining two are attending school. Although the family members have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to buy lumber to make a wall to protect them from rain. Thus, Mrs. Nann T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy lumber to make a wall to protect them from rain.

loans.name: Maria Nereidith

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Elena, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y de verduras. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Amazonas C-03, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual cancelará en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, y de esa manera poder surtir bien el negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. Quiere aprovechar las fiestas patronales de su distrito. 

Maria Elena tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de salir adelante con su negocio. Su meta es tener su minimarket y construir cuartos en su casa para alquilar
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena, member of the Communal Bank “Las Piedras,” lives in the San Martín region, Lamas province, Tabalosos district. She sells groceries and vegetables. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Amazonas C-03, where her customers, who are primarily her neighbors, gather daily. With this loan for S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy basic needs products such as rice, sack of sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of different sizes, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different brands and sizes of soap and more. In this way she can stock her store well and have what her customers seek. She wants to take advantage of the upcoming national holidays in her district. Maria Elena is 44 years old, she lives with her husband and children who are still dependent on her. She is a hard-working woman, charismatic, and with great desires to be successful in her business. Her goal is to have a minimarket and build rooms in her home to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Thereza K. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 20 and is also responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Thereza has been running a pharmacy business since 2005. Working 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, Thereza currently earns about $150 each month from her business.

She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to buy more medicines including panadol, chestcof, mucolyn, and anti-malarial medication. In the future, Thereza plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines including panadol, chestcof, mucolyn, and anti-malarial medicine.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha C., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Sor, 31, live in a small village off national road two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have two sons, who attend the local school.

Mr. Vutha has been a truck driver for 5 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 4 years. He is a driver for a company about 10 kilometers from his home. He usually goes to work by motor taxi and the cost is a bit high, so he decided to buy one second-hand motorcycle for traveling to work. Vutha requests a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
Moustapha is a 33 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car body repairman for 10 years. Moustapha requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase items for his household. Moustapha has been a micro credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. 
Moustapha has a good business because he only deals with car dealers. He repairs new cars, for example cars that have been in an accident. Moustapha plans to buy a house in the future.

loans.use: Moustapha needs the loan to purchase items for his household.

loans.name: Ngwe

texts.en:
P. is happily married, and she has been blessed with five children, two of whom are below 15 years of age. P. is living with her entire family in a house with four sleeping rooms and one sitting room. P. has faced many challenges in life—such as the death of a child, school dropouts, and family problems. These problems made life unpleasant for P.. But in 2006, P. became a member of GHAPE, and obtained her first loan, which was for 20,000 FRS. In 2008, she obtained a loan of 150,000 FRS. She repaid both loans promptly.
	
Now P. is requesting a loan of 300,000 FRS so she can buy yams, plantains, cocoyams, pineapples, carrots, and bananas.
           
P. greatly believes her business will succeed because of the experience she has had in the business and because her goods are in high demand. With this  business, P. will help her community by supplying food to them locally and reducing the distance they have to go to buy their food. She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay for her children’s school fees and to feed and cloth her children. Her repayments will commence at the fourth month from the day of disbursement.
	
She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing loans and the follow up GHAPE  provides after the loan is disbursed.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Teymas

texts.en:
Mrs. Teymas S., 50, and her husband, Mr. Ly Sen, 58, married during the Pol Pot regime and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other two children are in school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Teymas built a water storage tower and has connected it to houses in the neighborhood. She runs a private water utility service. Her husband has been building boats to sell for 15 years, a skill he learned from his father. Teymas is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase wood materials for her husband to use to build boats to sell.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials for her husband to build boats to sell

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy N. is a villager in Pong Toek Choeurng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kheim Nat, is a laborer who earns only a little income to support his household.

In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Navy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 28-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para la compra de telas y venderlos al por mayor.

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Melania tiene 58 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida y refrescos que desde hace varios años inicio con ayuda que sus hijos dieron. Reside en Villa reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, sus hijos son mayores de edad, su negocio se ha incrementado con los fondos de crédito que Afodenic ha otorgado este es su séptimo crédito el cual va comprar materiales para reparar el sistema eléctrico de sus casa ya que le esta dando problema y quiere evitar que su casa se le queme. Su planes es poder seguir creciendo en venta, seguir mejorando el local de venta y poder dar siempre un mejor servivicio.
texts.en:
Melania is 58 years old. She has been selling food and refreshments for a number of years. She started her business with her children's help. She lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. Her children are now adults and her business has grown thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic. This is her seventh loan, which she will use to repair the electrical wiring of her home as it is giving her problems and she wants to avoid having her house burn down. Her goals are to continue growing her sales, improving her business locale and always give better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical components in order to change the electrical system of her home.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama T. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their four children. Currently the youngest child is breastfeeding and the older children are attending school in the community. Ama lives in the mining community called Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who cooks and serves rice with stew and banku. She sells at the community center and also sells at the field where they do mining. Banku is prepares from milled grains and is taking with either pepper or soup. She prepares her food well which has attracted many customers to buy from her stand. Ama has been in this food business for the last eight years. But currently she has been hit by inadequate funds to buy stock. She is asking for a loan to buy grain like maize and rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc. She believes her only help now would come from no one else apart from you. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literally means God’s family.

loans.use: To buy grains like maize and rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en:
Korkor O. is fifty years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children. She trades in salt in the neighborhood of Abeka, a suburb of Accra, where she lives with her family. Korkor obtains her supply of salt from the surrounding villages of Ada and retails them to her customers for income to support her family. Through this trade, she has supported two of children in completing senior high school.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of salt with which to serve her customers. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She is a member of a loan group called Mawulawe Trust Group, which means "God will do it." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk supply of salt.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and drinks to make a living. Maureen is requesting the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more stock to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair products and wigs in bulk

loans.name: Komitse Edem

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de totsi, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de ciments, il exerce cette activité dans sa propre boutique. Son stock actuel de ciments a baissé et ne lui permet de servir tous ses clients, voulant se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un autre crédit pour acheter 10 paquets de ciments et un pousse-pousse.
Etant célibataire c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient à ses charges
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Totsi district. He earns an income from commerce in cement. He operates this business in his own shop. His current inventory is diminished, and it doesn’t allow him to serve all his customers. Wanting to stock up again, he is requesting another loan from WAGES to buy ten packets of cement and a push cart. Unmarried, he provides for himself through this work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and a push cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of soap

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам 1958 года рождения, женат, имеет одного ребенка. Его жена помогает по хозяйству. Уктам занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота. У него в хозяйстве есть большой огород где растут растение для корма скота. Поэтому он хочет получить займ на увеличение поголовье скота. Он благодарен за поддержку кредиторов в осуществление его плана.

loans.use: На покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Caren Akinyi

texts.en:
Caren Akinyi is 37 years old, married to Patrick and they have five children. Her animal feed business is located at Racecourse in Langas Estate in Eldoret Town. She has been in the animal feed business for the past eight years now.

Caren was introduced to KADET by an existing client and with the loan she has applied for she intends to add more stock, which includes wheat, maize and cotton cake.

In the future she intends to open a wholesale business of selling animal feed and to be able to educate her children at higher institutions of learning.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add animal feed stock.

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet S. was born in 1972 and lives in Rokar village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on a piece of land she owns.  Her husband, Mr. Chhay Bunna, is a fisherman.  Mrs. Ngaet S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, hire laborers to work on the field, and to purchase nets for her husband’s fishing business. She has four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and two others who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, hire laborers to work on the field, and to purchase nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia Noemí, pertenece al banco comunal, TAMBOPATA DE TIPON; ubicado en el distrito de Oropeza, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende desayunos y dulces en el kiosco pequeño que instalo en el colegio de Oropeza. Nuestra socia solicitó el préstamo para comprar mas productos y venderlos, ella obtendrá con esto mayor ganancia, en la elaboración de algunos sándwich y comprar dulces, también en hacer los desayunos según requieran los alumnos y profesores del plantel.

Nuestra socia agradece l préstamo y el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is 28 years old and she is single without a child.She sells sarongs of various colours.She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita S. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental.  She is 61 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julita has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre soltera D. 27 años, tienen dos hijos, con lo que vive en su casa propia.
Hace dos años se viene dedicando a L. venta D. golosinas en su casa, prefiere vender estos productos porque son D. menor inversión y obtiene mayores ganancias en comparación con los abarrotes.
Durante este tiempo ha venido captando clienteL., y hoy en día su negocio es muy concurrido, especialmente por los jóvenes. María atienD., D. preferencia, desD. las 3 D. L. tarD. hasta 9 D. L. noche, por ser las horas D. mayor demanda, y por las mañanas aprovecha D. trabajar en sus cultivos D. plátanos. 
Gracias a estas actividades, obtiene los recursos necesarios y no tiene que solicitarle dinero al padre D. sus hijos. Para el futuro quiere crecer en su negocio logrando que sea más granD. y pueda ofrecer diversidad D. golosinas y dulces.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donD. reitera su compromiso D. puntualidad en sus pagos D. cada mes. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una variedad D. galletas y otras golosinas; también adquirirá fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María is a 27 year old single mother with two children. She lives in her own home.

María has been selling candy from her house for 2 years. She prefers these products because they require less investment and the profits are higher in comparison to selling groceries. Throughout this time she has been attracting customers, and now her business is very popular, especially among teenagers. María operates her business from 3pm in the afternoon until 9pm at night since these are the hours when she experiences the most demand. In the mornings, she tends to her banana crops.

Through these activities, María obtains sufficient income and has not had to seek support from the father of her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business by offering a variety of candies and sweets.

This is her second loan with MFP. María renews her commitment to making her payments on time each month. The money she requested will be used to purchase a variety of cookies and other sweets. She will also buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets to sell & fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou S. is the group leader of six members who all live in Ampov Prey Pir village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now she wants to breed pigs to earn an income. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets, fertilizer, and a battery for her household.  Her husband, Mr. Ty Chantha, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chanthou S. is 33 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer and a battery for her household.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 38, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their child. Mohammad has been working as a taxi driver since 1999. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan. Mohammad is special in his work because of his punctuality. His clients can be anyone. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work and improve his income. 

In the future, he plans on improving by purchasing a van for school transportation.

loans.use: Maintenance on his taxi car

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 30 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. Shola owns a medicine store where she sells medicines to make a living. she hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase medicines to sell. She is happy with her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.She hopes to expand her business in the future.She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 28 años, siempre ha trabajado muy duro por mejorar su vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo, Elías de 8 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
En la comodidad de su hogar Rebeca pasa sus días tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc. Sus tejidos los vende en el puesto que tiene en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahí son comprados rápidamente, ya que las prendas que elabora son muy coloridas y llamativas. Rebeca tiene gran demanda de sus prendas, por eso trabaja mucho para satisfacerla, ya que sabe que es un muy buen ingreso para su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que teje, pues deber ser muy detallista.
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus tejidos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rebeca con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 28, has always worked very hard to improve her life. She lives in her own house with her small son, eight year old Elías. He is the motivation for all of her efforts. In the comfort of her home, Rebeca spends her days knitting sweaters, scarves, and gloves, etc. She sells what she knits in a stand that she has in one of the most important markets in the city of Juliaca. They are bought rapidly there because the items she makes are very colorful and eye-catching. There is great demand for Rebeca’s items, and she works a lot to satisfy the demand. She knows that it is very good income for her business. What she likes most about her work is knitting, and she does it with great ability. She has been doing this for one year. The most difficult part is making the finishings on the items that she knits; you need to be very detailed. In time, she hopes to have a clothing store where she can sell her knitted items more comfortably. This is Rebeca’s second loan with MFP. She is saving to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She is very happy in her communal bank. She will use the 300 PEN she requested to buy more wool to make new handmade articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Jamila has been producing agro products and selling lingerie since 2005. She produces different types of jams, spices and more. Regarding her lingerie sales, she sells underwear and pajamas from her house. Jamila is an active woman who does her best to improve her family’s income. She is a hardworking lady. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for both of her businesses. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time. Jamila is special in her work because she offers good quality and very tasty agro products; she always tries new recipes and health products to sell. As for the lingerie, she offers good quality merchandise. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her businesses, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Jamila decided on doing her businesses because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, especially since she has a big family and she wants to offer them the best she can. She plans to keep on improving her businesses as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is a 35 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Zahi has been working as a motorcycle repairer. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. When he first started, he had to make himself known to the public. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work. Zahi has been a microcredit client for five years and has always paid on time.

His previous loans have allowed him to improve his work and purchase spare parts. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business by selling motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: America Latina Group

texts.es: El grupo “America Latina” esta representada por la señora Angelica y conformada por 12 socios, D. los cuales 10 son mujeres y 2 varones ellos viven en la misma zona por lo que se conocen muy bien y son sociables, amistosas, solidarios y alegres. La presidenta la señora Angélica es casada con  4 hijos su esposo se llama Andrés y se dedica a la peluquería en un salón D. belleza en su domicilio propio, la socia se dedica al comercio D. venta D. ropas en las ferias D. 16 D. julio y en la avenida Tiwanaku D. la ceja D. El Alto y también venD. en el interior D. la ciudad saliendo a las provincias mas lejanas. Las demás socias también se dedican al comercio pero en diferentes actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir para niños, venta D. ropas, D. ladrillo unas D. los socios es transportista siendo propietario D. un taxi con el que trabaja.  El crédito que solicitaron es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y negocios que tienen cada una D. los socios. Las socias tienen mucha experiencia en sus negocios a pesar D. que hay mucha competencia en el mercado, pero los socios se dan sus modos para acomodar o vender su mercadería ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. Los socios tienen créditos tanto en bancos comunales como en individual y trabajan en diferentes instituciones tienen mucha experiencia y están entusiastas D. trabajar con nosotros en su primer ciclo
texts.en:
The “América Latina” (Latin America) group is represented by Angélica and is maD. up of 12 members, who are 10 women and 2 men. They all live in the same neighborhood so they know each other well, are very sociable, friendly, united and cheerful. Angélica is group president; she’s married and has 4 children. Her husband’s name is Andrés and he’s a barber; he has his barbershop in their home. She sells clothes in the 16 D. Julio market on Tiwanaku D. la Ceja avenue in El Alto; she also sells downtown and goes out to the more distant provinces as well. The other members are also merchants but in different activities such as: making children’s clothing, clothing sales, brick making. One of the members provides transportation services in his own taxi. The loan they requested will be used to increase their working capital in each of their businesses. The members have a lot of experience in their work and, despite much competition in the market, the members come up with ways to place or sell their merchandise because the support of their families depends on it. The members have loans as members of the communal bank and as individuals; they collaborate with a variety of institutions and have much experience. They are enthusiastic about working with us in their first loan cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Cuenta con un techo propio y su casa está ubicada en una localidad de la selva central peruana llamada “Palmapampa”.

Cuando notó que sus vecinos obtenías muy buenas ganancias por estos productos, inmediatamente decidió empezar a cultivar cacao y café. En el presente le va muy bien y sus ganancias le brindan seguridad y confianza, además cuenta con personal que la ayudan y facilitan el trabajo de cultivo y cosecha. Generalmente vende sus productos a los centros de acopio a un precio muy bueno, es por ello para el futuro anhela invertir en sus chacras, con las mismas ganas y entusiasmo que cuando empezó, pero también desea mejorar sus técnicas agrícolas para optimizar la calida de sus cosechas.

Este es su primero préstamo con MFP, por lo que le agradece la oportunidad de mejorar en su trabajo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará herramientas e insumos para el cultivo de cacao y café, para así minimizar los costos y tiempo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Florencia is 29 years old. She lives with her partner, the father of her three children. She has her own house, located in a part of the central Peruvian jungle called “Palmapampa.” Florencia decided to start growing cocoa and coffee when she saw that her neighbors were making good money with these crops. Now, the business is going well and her earnings provide her with security and confidence. Also, she has good people helping her with the cultivation and harvesting. Florencia generally sells her products to the markets at a good price. For this reason, she is just as enthusiastic about investing in her farm as she was at the beginning. She also wants to improve her agricultural techniques, to optimize the quality of her products. This is Florencia’s first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this opportunity to improve her business. She commits to making her payments on time. With this loan she will buy tools and supplies for the cultivation of cocoa and coffee. This will minimize costs and labor.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural tools

loans.name: Adjoa Idé

texts.en: Adjoa Idé E. is 35 years-old. She is married to a pastor and has three children. Mrs. E. works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo selling jewelry, fabric, purses, and ready-to-wear clothing. She began this business in 2000 and is now requesting her second loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She will use this loan to resupply her stock of jewelry, fabrics and any other products needed to keep her business running smoothly. With your support, Mrs. E.’s business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase  fabric, jewelry and various other products.

loans.name: Cristina Lomongo Group

texts.en:
Cristina L. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years-old. Cristina is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cristina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cristina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en: Vusale Xanbiyeva is 24 years old and single. She lives in the city of Baku with her family. She has been selling cosmetic products for 4 years. She now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more cosmetic products to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Eddy Arnulfo

texts.es:
El señor Eddy Arnulfo G., es mayor de edad y habita con su mujer en el Barrio Buena Vista, su esposa es comerciante y tiene un taller de madera, realiza muebles mediante órdenes de trabajo, así se ganan el sustento diarios de la familia, fue hace 25 años que con su esfuerzo propio logro la apertura de su propio negocio.

A futuro desea realizar unas mejoras a la infraestructura de su taller, pero primero solicita un préstamo la compra de un mayor inventario de materia prima para la ejecución de muebles que pueda llevar a ofertar a los mercados capitalinos. Un apoyo económico a la familia García aportara a un cambio significativo a la economía de hogar, en el desarrollo de nuevas inversiones que representen  fuentes de ingresos y la estabilidad de las comodidades de la familiares.
texts.en:
Sr. Eddy Arnulfo G. is an older gentleman who lives in the neighborhood of Buena Vista. His wife is a merchant while he operates a woodworking shop where he makes furniture based on orders that he receives. This is how he earns money to meet the daily needs of his family. Eddy has invested 25 years worth of effort into maintaining his business.

In the future, he wants to make improvements to the infrastructure of his workshop. His first loan was used to buy a large inventory of raw materials for making furniture to sell in the capital markets. Subsequent financial support to the G. family will bring about a significant change in their household finances. The development of new investment opportunities represents new sources of income that will help his family become more stable and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase woodworking materials

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen G. is from the village of Southwestern. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Belen owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Belen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feeds. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en: Elmira O. is the leader of this group. She is 45. She works in a boarding school in a rural area, and her husband breeds cattle in order to make money. They have two children; both of them study at school. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 16,000 soms ($347.82), Elmira and her husband bought a cow and since that time her husband has been breeding cattle. Elmira and her husband make 4,800 soms ($104.34) per month selling milk every day, and sometimes cattle when it is necessary. With money received from this loan, Elmira wants to purchase a cow to increase their number of cattle. Ainur R. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41 and a widow. She has raised four children: three sons and a daughter. The sons study at school but the daughter has not started yet. Ainur works as a teacher at school. She also has a part-time job in a pharmacy. A few years ago, Ainur started to breed cattle and now she wants to get a loan to purchase a bull calf to sell after fattening it, to make some money. Burulkan O., age 59, is a widow. She is retired and receives a monthly pension of 7,100 soms ($154.34). She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase kitchen furniture in order to improve her living conditions. Kulbubu B., age 43, is married. She works as a librarian and her husband is a bus driver. They have three children; all of them are students. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms ($434.78) Kulbubu bought a cow and since that time she has been breeding cattle. That cow gives 12 liters of milk daily. By selling that milk, Kulbubu makes 4,800 soms ($104.34) per month. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase a bull calf in order to sell it after fattening it, to make some money. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Isaac Alberto

texts.es:
Isaac Alberto Z. G. tiene56 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 1 hijo, Maruixi (25). 

 Isaac es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Isaac se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en ciclo cortó maíz y cacao.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Mata de Cacao.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz y cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para comprar una finca. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta leer y trabajar.
texts.en:
Isaac Alberto Z. G. is 56 years old, single, and lives in Recinto Delicia in the canton of Chillanes, Bolivar Province. He has one child named Maruixi (age 25).

Isaac is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progreso La Delicia Recinto”, which is in San José del Tambo Parish. The group has 19 members and their community engages in growing cacao and corn.

Issac is a farmer and is currently planting corn and cacao. Every month he purchases products and farming supplies from the agricultural services division of AGRIPAD. He sells his goods at the Mata de Cacao Market.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and cacao and views it as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have better financial income so that he can buy a farm. The greatest challenge that he faces is the lack of financial resources and time.

Isaac enjoys reading and working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing corn & cacao

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old and married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old.  Beatrice is in the business of selling Irish potatoes and this is her second successful year in this business. The business hours are from 7 am to 4 pm every day.

Beatrice, after realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully to satisfy her customers, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With the use of this loan, Beatrice will increase her sales as well as profits.  With these profits, Beatrice will keep reinvesting in her business for better growth until she becomes a wholesaler to the retailers from her environmental area.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Alejandrina se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y secada al sol), producto que es utilizada para la preparación de platos típicos. Sus ventas los realiza a intermediarios que llevan a la costa peruana.
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio y solicita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son comprar un carro para alquilar y comprar un terreno para construir otra casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is married and has 3 children. She makes a living preparing ‘papa seca’ [‘dried potatoes’: the potatoes are parboiled, peeled, chopped, and dried in the sun], a product that is used in preparing traditional Peruvian dishes. She sells her products to middlemen who transport them to the Peruvian coast. Alejandrina is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan of 2500 soles so that she can purchase potatoes. Her dream is to purchase a car that she can rent out and to purchase land where she can build another house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes.

loans.name: Marlon Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Mauricio L. B., en un joven casado habitante de un humilde barrio, de 23 años de edad, con un hijo de 4 añitos, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace mas de 10 años pues fue herencia de sus abuelos quien le enseñaros a ganarse la vida bajo esta actividad, ellos habitan en una humilde casa, pues apenas comienzan a forjarse su futuro, y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a los terrenos y así producir una mejor cosecha, espera se le apoye económicamente a mejorar las condiciones en las que habita su esposa y su pequeño hijo actualmente.
texts.en:
Señor Marlon Mauricio L. B. is married, lives in a poor neighbourhood, is 23 years old, and has a four-year old son. He and his wife have worked as farmers for more than ten years as he inherited land from his grandparents who taught him how to make a living from farming. The family lives in a simple house and has only just begun to make a future for themselves. It is for this reason that Marlon is asking for a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer so he can improve his land and get a better harvest. He hopes that this will help him financially so he can improve the current standard of living of his wife and young son.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer etc

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA

Alcancía comunal con 07 integrantes mujeres, con afan por trabajar y mejorar sus ventas, con los préstamos que recibieron cada uno invertirá en su negocio con objetivos diferentes pero con expectativas de mejorar la economía en sus hogares.

Maria, joven de 26 años, con 2 hijos pequeños, socia de esta Alcancia Comunal,   “El Renacer de Chacrasana” trabaja comercializando productos de belleza, lleva 4 años trabajando como consultora, María se animó a trabajar en esta línea de cosméticos, desde que la visitaron a su domicilio los consultores de este producto, y con otras mas por UNA amiga quien la animó; asi mismo los fines de semana ella trabaja en la discoteca cercana a su vivienda como mesera, nos cuenta que con los incentivos y comisiones que ella recibe por las ventas de productos de belleza, ha logrado comprar artefactos para su sala, cuarto, cocina y comedor; de igual manera ella adquiere algunos productos de ambas líneas que se encuentran en liquidación como shampoo, colonias, perfumes, etc, y los revende a mayor precio, es asi como ella asume los gastos de su casa para darles lo necesario a sus dos niños, además Maria nos comenta que semanalmente juega una Junta ( junta de dinero entre varias personas), y los fines de semana las sortean, con esos ingresos, ella invierte comprando abarrotes, utiles, y alimentos; para sus hijos, el reciente préstamo que se le otorgó, lo invertirà  para comprar mas productos stock de belleza y asi aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Esta contenta de poder participar en este sistema que apoya a los microempresarios como ella.
texts.en:
EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA (Chacrasana’s Rebirth) COMMUNAL BANK A communal bank with 7 female members aiming to work to improve sales. The loans each has received will be invested in their businesses with different objectives but with the expectation to improve their home economy. Maria, 26, is a member of this communal bank. She has two small children. She sells beauty products and has been working for four years as a beauty consultant. She ventured to sell this line of cosmetics ever since she was visited in her home by this brand’s consultants and by others thanks to a girlfriend that encouraged her. On weekends she also works at a discotheque near her home as a waitress. She tells us that the commissions and incentives she gets from the beauty products sales she has bought items for her living room, bedroom, kitchen and dining room. She also gets items that are on sale of both brands like shampoo, cologne, perfume, etc. and then resells them at a higher price. This is how she is able to cover household expenses and provide her two children with what they need. Besides, Maria tells us that every week she participates in a junta (a collection of money among several persons) that is raffled off on the weekend. She uses that income to buy groceries, school supplies and food for her children. The recent loan that she was granted she will use to buy more stock beauty supplies to increase sales and thus profits. She is happy to be able to participate in this system that supports micro businesspeople like her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. T. is from the town of Talibon. She is married and has 2 adult children. She sells spare parts for a living. Her husband, who is an engine mechanic, also helps with their business. Teresita says they have been involved in this kind of business for almost 20 years now. She is thankful to have a source of income because it helps sustain their household. She hopes to serve more customers.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional spare parts to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar M. is a dedicated entrepreneur who is sometimes accused of being a workaholic. Five years ago he started a small business selling groceries. He chose a good location for his business, one that was convenient and fills a market niche, and he has poured his energy into making it successful. Ilqar, a kind, attentive man who tries to take care of his customers, has requested a loan to help open a new sales location and purchase more grocery items to sell. He’d like to continue expanding his business so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Parveen Shokat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Parveen S. A. is 44 years old, married to S. A. and has three sons and a daughter. Her husband has a cycle repair shop in the market which he has been running for over seven years. During this time he has successfully obtained a good reputation among his customers through his quality work. He and Parveen live in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan famous for its dairy industry. Parveen and her husband couldn’t educate their children due to financial constraints. They all now do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially.

Parveen supports her family financially by sewing and selling clothes. She mainly gets sewing orders from her neighborhood clients and sells a variety of her clothes to different clothing shops. She also imports clothes from Faisalabad (famous for its textile industry in Pakistan) at cheap rates, and by selling them to different clothing shops she earns a good profit.

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her clothing business. She will invest the loan in purchasing clothes of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will cut her cost of travelling and also minimize the purchase price. She is experienced in her business and is confident that after investment, her business will improve and she will easily pay back her loan installments.

Parveen is a regular Asasah borrower. This is her fourth loan application. In previous loan periods, she proved herself a responsible client who never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time.

In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther G. is currently in the business of selling sugar, onions, rice and beans  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and sugar to sell.  Esther is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a boda-boda. She has 5 children and her children all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Carmelita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 46 years old. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of five and ten. Two of his children go to school except the youngest. His wife works with him in the business. Albert sells various products such as kids clothes, shoes, cooking oil and rice; he has been in this business for three years. 

Albert would like to use this loan to make his business grow and add more items for sale such as shoes, sugar and rice. With the profits from this business he will build a house. He says that his business allows him to get the basic needs for his family and he dreams of having a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more kids clothes, shoes and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy all the necessities for the wedding party

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 100% Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 7 años el mismo que estudia en escuela, en la actualidad está embarazada de su segundo hijo. El marido es chofer de cooperativa de transporte interprovincial. Ella es nacida en El Carmen pero hace años se vino a Charapoto.

Se dedica al comercio vende productos para el hogar como planchas, colchones, camas, licuadoras entre otras, también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en una  distribuidora. En estos momentos quiere comenzar con venta de zapatos por catalogo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos ya que espera vender estos productos para incrementar su negocio. Está en el  Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
The "100% Charapote" Communal Bank meets in the city of Charapoto every two weeks.  This place is known for its traditional culture.   It is also known for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente, in the province.

This is where we find Ana.  She is 27 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has a seven year old child who goes to school.  She is now pregnant with her second child.  Her husband is a driver for an interprovincial transportation cooperative.  She was born in El Carmen, but she came to Charapoto years ago.

She sells products for the home.  She sells things like irons, mattresses, beds, and blenders, among others.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects each week or every two weeks according to what her customers want.  She gets her products from a distributor.  She now wants to start selling shoes by catalog.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and shoes.  She plans to sell these products in order to increase her business.  She has been in the communal bank from the beginning.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.  

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 37 years old and he is still married with one child who is four years old. He makes a living by selling a variety of goods and food in his shop including biscuits, toilet paper, water, sugar, soap and soft drinks. Emmanuel has been in this business for about five years and the hours of his business are from 6am to 7pm every day.

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc. With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Emmanuel hopes that the number of customers will increase as well as his profits.
