Uno de sus principales objetivos es la edificación de su propia vivienda, pero uno de los obstáculos que ha tenido en su carrera como agricultora, ha sido el robo de las cosechas que afecta de sobremanera sus ingresos. Fue con el apoyo económico y moral de su padre, que se inicio en este negocio, ahora ella solicita  de un préstamo para la diversificación de siembras que se consumen en masa, ya sea en la capital o sectores aledaños, con el crédito realizará las compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, que aporten a este fin , y le permitan a futuro la planificación de la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is a young person that is 27 years old, single and without children. Despite her young age, she has worked for fifteen years in agriculture. One of her main goals is to have a home. One of the obstacles she faces, that she has experienced in her agricultural career, is the way the theft of crops greatly affects earnings. It is with the economic support of her parents, who began this agricultural business, that she is requesting this loan. The loan will be used to provide a greater variety of plants that are generally utilized in the capital city or the outskirts. With this loan she will buy supplies, plants, fertilizers and pesticide, which will help her reach her goals. This will allow her to plan the construction of her house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy pesticides, fertilizers and growing supplies

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza O. is from the village of Caluya. She is 50 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business selling of own-made "nipa" native roofs. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase to pawned a parcel of nipa plantation. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Liza from PMPC.
 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pawned a parcel of nipa plantation

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for K. Peninah from Kafunga, Ibanda.

Having had a big family of six children and one dependent with a careless husband who does no productive work, Peninah worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda. She is so fond of her business and she is able to earn 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings as profits monthly.

This loan is to help Peninah do the mulching, buy stake poles for her plantation and pesticides. Further more, the expansion of her banana plantation project into a large-scale operation is her main motive for this loan. This will help her improve her production and sales revenue to enable her take care of her family.

loans.use: To expand her plantation project and buy mulches, stake poles and pesticides for increased production

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis Eduardo tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de electrodoméstico. Pues inicio desde muy joven, pues el inicio como aprendiz ya que con el tiempo fue aprendiendo poco a poco además le gustaba mucho relacionarse con sus clientes, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día su actividad, es por eso que se siente muy contento con este financiamiento que solicito para realizar las compras de su herramientas que son necesarias. el sueño de él es tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo, 46, services home appliances. He started very young, beginning as an apprentice and learning bit by bit, and very much enjoying interacting with his clients. He is always thinking how to improve his business every day, and therefore is very pleased with this loan he is requesting in order to complete the purchase of necessary tools. His dream is to have his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his truck.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola N. is 19 years-old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Viola has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Viola hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food and clothes for her children.  In the future, Viola hopes to enlarge her business

Note to lenders:   BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future.  The program targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Silvia Elizabeth Mejía S., Casada, guatemalteca, de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos la cual lo inicio con pequeño capital que habia ahorrado hace 3 años, ahora es un negocio muy rentable para ella ya que con esto ha sufragado sus necesidades básicas como alimentación y educación  para sus hijos, por lo cual necesita ampliar su capita de trabajo y asi poder invertirlo, para esto acudió a la oficina de la Asociación Asdir para la solicitud de un préstamo, y con esto poder comprar mas aves y  aumentar sus ganancias, solo así mejorará sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia Elizabeth Mejía S. is a 24 year old married Guatemalan woman who raises and sells chickens. She started this business with little working capital that she had saved for three years. Now it’s a very profitable business and she has been able to pay for her basic needs, such as food, and education for her children. She needs to increase her working capital so that she can invest into her business. She has approached the office of Asociación Asdir to request this loan, so that she can use the money to buy more birds and increase her earnings. Only this way will she be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 55 years old. Editha is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Editha is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Муродов Фуркат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Furkat M. lives in Hamadoni. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than twelve years. He fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
el señor Jose Balbino R. C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Denia Elizabeth Colindres tienen cinco hijos.
Jose y su familia viven en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 1 año y se dedican a la elaboracion y venta de ladrillos y tejas, dicho producto se elabora con tierra, barro  para luego ser quemado en un horno a base de fuego con leña.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima y continuar elaborando ladrillos y tejas para lograr tener mas utilidades y por ende darles una mejor calidad vida a su familia.
su meta es comprarse un mejor vehiculo para transportar el producto.
texts.en:
Mr. José Balbino R. C. is 34 years old and married to Mrs. Denia Elizabeth Colindres. They have five children. José and his family have lived in Altos de la Cruz for a year and work making and selling bricks and tiles. They make these products with dirt and clay and then bake them in a wood-burning stove.

He will use the loan to buy materials to keep making brick and tile to have more profits and give his family a better quality of life. His goal is to buy a vehicle to transport his products.

loans.use: Fo buy firewood, dirt, and clay

loans.name: Sokhann

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhann P. and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Sat (pictured with her husband), live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of them work with their parents and the other two attend school.

Sokhann and his wife are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower, cucumbers and other crops. Sokhann has asked for a MAXIMA loan once before. He hopes to continue increasing his productivity, so he has decided to request a second loan of 1,200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides and pay for plowing to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Peter Gitimu

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old and divorced with one son. He owns a rice farm in Embu and has been in the business for 29 years. He earns an income of 15,000 KES a month.

He is taking his 3rd loan with Kadet. He wants to use the loan to lease an extra half acre, buy fertilizer, fungicides, and pay for labour.  He hopes to make his son happy and help him attain his goals in the future. He also hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To lease an extra half acre, buy fertilizer, fungicides, and pay for labour.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn D. R. is a rice farmer from the town of Santo Niño. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children ages 12, 10 and 2. She wants her children to be able to finish their studies.

Roselyn owns and tills her own land. She plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She wants her service to their community to be better so she aims for quality rice. Roselyn's rice farm needs additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She likes its services, especially that it comes with a microinsurance program. She is hopeful that her loan will be very useful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo Y. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 61 years old. Zosimo is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Zosimo owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Zosimo is just starting this business.

Zosimo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosimo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Zosimo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. sells roasted maize mixed with groundnuts, cloth and cassava in Abura. Ekua has received a junior-high education. She is divorced and has two children. She has been in this trade for seven years. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cloth to expand her business. She sees to the well-being of the family. The profits that will be acquired as a result of the loan will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: The loan she is requesting  will be used to buy cloth to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build up the business by increasing the stock

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over thirty years, she has operated a water point-selling business from home, selling to her neighbours. In addition, she also sells food items, which brings in another source of income. Saida faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the demand for water is minimal. She hopes to operate a retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of potatoes, wheat flour, oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase stock of potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Deysi Janet

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 30 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el caserio Cruce D. Vega ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícoL. que se encuentra situada en L. provincia D. Piura, en L. región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

ElL. cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda, allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos diversas golosinas. Adicionalmente comercializa productos D. belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda, actividad que realiza hace seis años. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias a L. buena atención que Deysi ofrece. Esta actividad le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Deysi desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más productos, ya que desea en esta temporada aumentar sus ventas diarias. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Deysi is 30 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their four children in the small village of Cruce D. Vega, which is located in the TambogranD. district. This is an agricultural zone in the Piura province, which is in the region with the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.
She runs a small business from her home. From here, she sells candies to her neighbors and other customers. She also sells beauty products from a catalog to the customers who come to her store. She has been doing this for 6 years. The business has been very well received thanks to the good service that Deysi provides. This business makes her feel active, and the income that she makes helps her family to move forward in life.
Deysi wants to grow her business and buy more products - this season she wants to increase her daily sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $275 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Amé Mawulawoé

texts.fr: Dame  Mawulawoè   habite Djidjolé. Elle  a 44 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants à charge.   Pour participer  au  ménage, elle fait la restauration.  Elle achète les ingrédients de restauration  au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle revend à côté  de  la  pharmacie Djidjolé  après  préparation.  Elle a commencé  en 2009 cette  activité  et  a employé 2 personnes.  Elle sollicite de  WAGES un prêt  pour acheter  5 sacs de maïs  et  5  sacs  de riz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawulawoè lives in Djidjolé. She's 44 years old, married, and has two children to support. To provide for her household, she runs a food serving business. She buys ingredients at the Grand Market in Lomé, and sells the prepared meals next to the pharmacy in Djidjolé.

She started this business in 2009, and used to employ two persons. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice for her food serving business

loans.name: Astria

texts.es: Astria tiene 44 años, nacida en el distrito de San Francisco; esta casada con Severino de 44 años de edad y tienen 09 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicado en la avenida Tupac Amaru del distrito de Kimbiri. Astria y su esposo son el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Astria es campesina y cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y plantas de piña, frutos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 22 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y frutos de piña. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de piña ya que cuenta con 02 hectareas de terreno no cultivado. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Astria is 44 years old and was born in the District of San Francisco.  She is married to Severino, age 44, and they have nine children.  They have their own home located along Tupac Amaru Avenue in the District of Kimbiri.  Astria and her husband are the breadwinners of their family.  When Astria was a young girl, her parents taught her how to work on a farm.  She is now a farmer and has five hectares of land on which she plants coffee and pineapples, tropical fruits grown in the Apurimac River Valley.  Astria has worked on her land for 22 years, and during the harvest season she has the help of her children and the labor of workers who can pick the fruit with great speed.  She considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products from the farm to the distribution centers in the city of San Francisco, the place that offers the best prices for grain and pineapples.  Her difficulty is when she lacks sufficient income to pay her workers in advance since they provide assistance during the harvest.  For this reason, she has taken out loans with institutions such as MFP.  Now her highest priority is to plant more pineapples since she has two hectares of land that have not been cultivated.  

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  Astria feels the support has helped her greatly in making progress in her work.  In her Communal Bank, she is well-respected by the other members.  The loan of 2000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.use: To hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es: Yovana de 26 años, natural de la comunidad la Libertad anexo del distrito de Quimbiri; esta casada con Alfredo de 30 años de edad y tienen 02 hijas Rosalía de 09 y  Gressy de 07 meses de nacida y juntos viven en su propio lote a medio construir situado en el distrito de Quimbiri. Yovana, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Yovana es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri. La bodega de Yovana es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias en verduras y depender de dos ingresos a la vez  por lo cual ella se esmera cada día por lograr ese propósito. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, y a su vez agradece a la Institución  por concederle el préstamo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yovana is 26 years old and from La Libertad community, a small village in Quimbiri district.  She is married to 30 year-old Alfredo and they have two daughters, 9 year-old Rosalía and 7 month-old Gressy.  They live together on their own half-built lot which is located in Quimbiri district.

Yovana is a very industrious woman who works hard and does her best to excel even when faced with the adversities that fate sometimes provides.  Yovana is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Quimbiri district market.  Yovana's store is the first to open each day.  She opens her business at 6.00am and is ready to receive her first customers who know that she sells a good variety of merchandise in her store and so do not hesitate to buy from her.  They know that they will find the products they need.  What Yovana most likes about her work is chatting to her customers as, in this way, she is always up to date with what is going on around her.  She has been in this business for 4 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stand up almost all day long.

Yovana will use the loan she has requested to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock her store with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to invest her profits in buying vegetables.  In this way, she will have two incomes.  She does her best every day to make sure she achieves this goal.

This is Yovana's third loan from MFP.  She feels that this loan will really help her to make progress in her business and she is grateful to the institution for granting her the loan.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 3 Group

texts.en:
Kirsy is married with three children. She lives in a simple structure in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Kirsy is in the business of selling all kinds of clothes and different home-decoration items like bedding sets, curtains and others. She went into business about a year ago with her husband's help. When she is not working, she enjoys watching television. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her house.

Kirsy is the coordinator of her group Caminando Con Jesus 3 (Walking with Jesus 3). She began with Esperanza International Dominican Republic because she wanted to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

Kirsy is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save for future investments.

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses, shirts, etc. to resell

loans.name: Jaiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Jaiko Porave Rekavo se conformó el 24 de setiembre del 2010, se encuentran en el 2º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos, principalmente el de trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Petrona B., quien se dedica a ser macatera, vendedora ambulante, nos comenta que solicita el crédito para mejorar su actividad y su administración; su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Ella comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee también una pequeña pensión de su marido que es parapléjico para poder solventar los gastos.
Según la Sra. Petrona las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importante ya que mediante ellas pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo y autoestima.
texts.en:
The Women's Committee known as Jaiko Porave Rekavo was formed on September 24, 2010. They are now in their second cycle, and are together and unified in the program. 

Aside from the independent work that each one does, they also do activities together to raise money to create capital within the group. They also help each other out to meet their objectives, especially that of working to support their families economically.

One very moving story is that of Mrs. Petrona Benitez, who is a street vendor. She tells us that she asked for a loan to improve her business and administration; her quality of life and income. She says that through this business her family's economic situation improved substantially and that she now also receives a small pension for her husband who is a paraplegic, which helps cover the family's costs. 

According to Petrona, the activities that she does with the Fundacion Paraguaya are very important since they allowed her to develop her work capacity and self-esteem.

loans.use: to buy shirts and blouses made with ao poi [Paraguayan embroidery]

loans.name: Nonignon Group

texts.fr: NONIGNON est un groupement constitué de dix sept personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Sylvie. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier à Womey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.Née le 16 Mars 1959 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé, Sylvie vit depuis douze ans à Womey avec sa famille. Sylvie est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Paulin et a quatre enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Sylvie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sylvie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs trois ans, Sylvie vend des condiments de sauce, des boissons et des tissus de façon secondaire dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Sylvie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Sylvie et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: NONIGNON is a group made up of seventeen people, whose president is called Sylvie (she has her hand raised in the photograph). The group members live in the same quarter of Womey in the Abomey Calavi area. In order to boost their working capital, this group is seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Sylvie was born on the 16th March 1959 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé region, and has lived in Womey with her family for twelve years. She is married to a mechanic called Paulin with whom she has four children who all attend school. Sylvie and her husband see to their family's needs together. Sylvie left school after second grade. For the past three years, she has sold sauces, condiments, drinks and fabric from her shop situated at her home. This business enables her to generate revenues which help her to see to her family's needs. She buys her products from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. This loan will enable Sylvie and her group to boost their business and grow their customer base and revenue.

loans.use: to purchase cans of drinks and condiments

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To become economically stable is the main goal of Evelyn. This is why she is working so hard in her general store business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional revolving capital to buy new products to offer like vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and a lot of food ingredients.   

Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is now 44 years old and has been managing a general store for two years. She is earning around PHP 6,000 monthly doing this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es:
Este  tiene su domicilio en la ciudad de Managua, siendo  persona  trabajadora  padre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y en brindarles
Una mejora calidad de vida.
 El señor Wilmer Alberto   visito  nuestras oficinas con  el fin  objetivo de conseguir crédito para realizar una mejora en su hogar como es acondicionar un cuarto para sus  hijos con este crédito comprar laminas de zic  y perlìnes   para el techo  y para el pago de la mano de obra  y así  ofrecerle  un hogar digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer Alberto lives in his own home, in the city of Managua.  He is a hard-working father who looks after his family's well-being and would like to provide them with a better quality of life.

Wilmer Alberto visited our offices in order to request a loan with which he could improve his home, fitting out a bedroom for his children.   He will use the loan to buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams for his roof and to pay labor costs.  This will enable him to offer his family a decent home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, buying building supplies

loans.name: Agneter

texts.en:
Agneter is a married woman with 2 children. One attends school while the other is still too young.  She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is hospital bills.

For the past year, Agneter has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a goat-meat business which contributes an additional source of income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Agneter dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase goats and cattle to sell as meat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats and cattle to sell as meat.

loans.name: Djaria

texts.fr: Mariée à un commerçant et maman de 02 enfants, Djaria a 29ans et elle réside à Agoé avec son conjoint.  En 2009, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz, huile végétale). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier  prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Djaria is married to a merchant and the mother of two children. She is 29 years old and lives in Agoé with her spouse. In 2009, she opened a store in her home where she sells basic products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil). She wants to see her children grow up with a stable family background. This is her first loan; it will help her to buy some inventory and meet the demand of her many customers. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: San Isidro 11 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "San Isidro 11" porque L. comunidad en L. cual habitan son muy devotas al santo “San Isidro”. Esta ubicado en el estado D. México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es L. primera vez que solcita un prestamo. MariC. es tesorera del grupo. Tiene 23 años, estudio hasta L. preparatoria. ElL.  
cuida a sus papas pues son personas D. edad avanzada a quienes quiere mucho. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, negocio que inicio hace 1 año aproximadamente. Solicita este prestamo para comprar productos como fragancias, cremas y cosmeticos. Lo que elL. espera con este prestamo es que al final pueda tener sus productos a L. mano para que los exiba en un pequeño local que piensa construir para que cuando lo requieran sus clientes los tenga sin ningun inconveniente. Al momento solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente feliz porque pueD. surtir su negocio. Tambien quiere apoyar a sus papas en los gastos D. L. familia y brindarles una mejor vida para su vejez.
texts.en: The name of this group is "San Isidro 11" and it is named as such because the community in which they live is very devout to the saint "San Isidro". It is located in the state of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 11 members and it is the first time they request a loan. MariC. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 years old and she has a high school education. She takes care of her parents who are advanced in age and whom she loves very much. She sells beauty products, a business she started approximately 1 year ago. She requests a loan to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics. What she hopes with this loan is to finally have the products that she needs in hand and to display from a small store she's thinking about having built. So when clients require a product they will not be inconvenienced. When she requested the loan she felt very happy because she will be able to add inventory to her business. She also wants to support her parents with the family's expenses, and to proviD. them with a better life in their old age.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Toeuy

texts.en: Aged only 16, Mrs. Toeuy is married to a husband who stays in the village like she does. Her husband is 27 years old. At present both of them are farmers. They can earn about $4 per day to support themselves. They don't have any children at present. Living with her husband from day to day, Mrs. Toeuy wishes to expand her farming business and make it better than before. She would like to borrow the amount of $300  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Javier Rodolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Javier es casado,  tiene una hija de 15  años, va todavía  al colegio. El Sr. Javier se dedica  al servicio de taxista en un auto alquilado desde hace 10 años y  gana aproximadamente 200 soles semanales.  Sus metas que tiene  es tener su propio auto para así aumentar sus ganancias. Su desafío  es que a veces no hay pasajeros y él tiene q dar más vueltas que sus  demás compañeros.  El crédito se va invertir en renovar la licencia de conducir que ya caduca el próximo mes. El Sr. Javier está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier is married and has a 15-year-old daughter in high school. He provides taxi services using a rented automobile. Javier has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns approximately 200 PEN each month. His goals are to have his own vehicle and to increase his earnings. His challenge is whenever there are no passengers available and he wants to make more trips than his co-workers.

Javier will invest this loan in the renewal of his driver’s license, which will expire next month. He is very grateful for the loan being granted to him.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Daniel. He is married and has four children who are 6, 8, 12, and 14 years old. In 2001, Daniel established his spare parts and lubricants business. This business has helped Daniel to provide a livelihood for his family for the past years. My family and I depend only on this business, said Daniel.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Daniel plans to establish a vehicle/motorcycle trade, build a house and support his children's education. He travels to Freetown twice a month by public transport to buy his business stock.  He serves riders and drivers in the township of Makeni City. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Santo Domingo que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Eugenio es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra caña de azúcar, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  También vende aguardiente (bebida que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), luego la vende a los pobladores de la misma zona y así obtiene otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y de aguardiente para seguir comercializandolo a los pobladores, con la finalidad de tener una buena ganancia y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Eugenio es una persona que se preocupa por que su negocio crezca para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos diarios.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 46, and lives with his wife and children in their own home, which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural area of the Santo Domingo district, which is part of Cajamarca department. This area is known for farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Eugenio is a farmer.  He has his own land, where he grows sugar cane, a product that is consumed every day.  Once he harvests his crop, he sells it at the different markets in the area where he lives; in this way he can earn income to cover his family's expenses.  He also sells aguardiente (a drink extracted from sugar cane), to people in the same area, and so earns other income for his household. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles through the Capital Semilla (Seed Money) program, in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and aguardiente to keep selling to local people.  His aim is to earn a good profit, and thereby improve his quality of life. Eugenio is a person who is concerned about making his business grow, so that he can have a few home comforts and keep supporting his family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve his land, and aguardiente (drink made from sugar cane) to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Eva has a shop that makes & sells hypo or cleansing agent by the liter. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old, married and has eight adult children. Her spouse worked as a farmer in the village of Lapas, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

She enjoys the daily activities in her hog-raising business. She devotes herself full time to maintaining her business, which is the only source of income she has for her family. After taking care of the pigs for four months, she sells them, earning PHP 4,000 per head.

Carmelita wants to buy baby livestock but she has insufficient capital. That’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and at least one additional pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy one pig and feed.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Victor Manuel es padre de familia que siempre ve por el bienestar y comodidad, para poder sostener los gastos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida trabaja como chofer de transporte colectivo desde hace 8 años. El cuenta con su propio automóvil que utiliza para taxi  que circula en toda la ciudad para ofrecer a sus clientes amplio servicio.
En este momento necesita de un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, lo que necesita es comprar algunas partes y aceite para que este en buenas condiciones. De esta manera ofrecerá mejor servicio y a sus clientes una mejor seguridad.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is a father who is always looking after his family’s comfort and wellbeing.  To be able to meet household expenses and offer them a better quality of life he’s been working as a collective taxi driver for 8 years.  He owns his car that he uses as a taxi circulating throughout the city to offer his customers wide service.

Presently, he needs a loan to service his work tool.  He needs to buy a few replacement parts and oil so that it will be in good operating condition so that he will be able to offer better service and increased safety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old and married to Naleng'oyo. They are blessed with two children. She is a livestock trader in the area of the Mlolongo Kitengela slaughter house, Kajiando and other surrounding markets where she supplies livestock. She has  been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET staff member. She has good credit history in KADET, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more livestock.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business and become a K.M.C. meat supplier. Hellen hopes to become a K.M.C meat supplier within the next two years. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Linda is a 53-year-old lady who is married and has five children aged 32, 30, 28, 25, and 23 year. They have five other dependents who stay with them. 

She operates from home and has been in business for eight years. She buys some of her products from Harare and Zambia. She does not have any employees. She faces a challenge of high competition in the market and inadequate packaging material for floor polish. In the next five years, she would like to own her own shop as well as a factory to make floor polish. This loan would improve life for her family as she would be able to generate more income to sustain the extended family

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sanitary pads, and raw materials to make floor polish.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single mother. She has one child, who is in school. She lives in her family’s house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanakombo has operated as a tailor for the past three years; her potential clients are local women. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With her loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more fabrics and also buy some vegetables for her new grocery business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and to buy vegetables for her new grocery business.

loans.name: Leunidah

texts.en: Leunidah is a hardworking business woman. She is 48 years old, married and blessed with three children who are in school. She runs a grocery business to support her family. She has been in business for the last 16 years. Leunidah also rents houses to supplement her family's income. The major challenge she faces is competition. Leunidah is requesting a loan of 20,000 shillings to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Martin, âgé de 41 ans  célibataire et père de 4 enfants  a récemment investi dans la vente de denrées alimentaires et  d’habits.
Il veut acquérir un prêt pour acheter des habits adaptés au froid et préparer  les fêtes de Noel et de fin d’années.
Avec  les revenus de son commerce il arrive à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et veut élargir son activité car il a l’intention de vendre aussi de la boisson.
texts.en:
Martin is 41 years old, single and the father of 4 children. He has recently started a business selling food and clothing. He is requesting a loan so that he can stock up on cold weather clothing and products to sell during the Christmas and New Year celebrations.

Martin uses his earnings to pay for his children´s education and also plans to reinvest some into his business, as he would like to expand his activities and start selling drinks.

loans.use: to buy food and clothes to resell during the end of year festivities.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Teresa, es una humilde agricultora del zona de Ticuantepe, ella habita junto a su familia, durante muchos años se dedica al cultivo de piña, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el financiamiento anterior logro darle mantenimiento a una manzana de Piña , ahora ella quiere establecer  media manzana mas , pero no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar la inversión , ya que si logrará establecerlo mejoraría sus condiciones de vida , ya que la agricultura es su gran fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva para lograr sus planes hacia su cultivo.
texts.en: Teresa is a humble farmer from the area of Ticuantepe.  She lives with her family.  She has grown pineapples for a living for many years.  Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions.  With her previous loan she was able to maintain a field of pineapple; now she wants to plant half a field more, but she doesn't have the capital to make the investment.  If she is able to set this up, it will improve her living conditions since agriculture is her main source of income for supporting her family.  She is thankful for the help she has received from AFODENIC through Kiva to achieve her goals for her  crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged 7 and 8; both go to school. He and his wife work together in the same restaurant. He has been running the restaurant for the past two years. He is requesting the loan to add more equipment as well as different types of food to serve in the restaurant. He plans to use the profits to build a house. In the future, he wants to see his business prospering.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from the simple village of Dioyo, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age, married and blessed with three adult children. Her husband is working as farmer.

Gemma used her last loan to purchase raw materials needed to make furniture for sale like beds, sala sets and cabinets for tourists and local community members. Her business is successful, and she has discovered that it's better to also engage in a different line of business to double her return. So now she is taking a new loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store, locally known as a sari-sari store. 

She has been this business for around six months. With her general store, she has been able to earn 2,300 PHP a month. This business has been quite a great benefit to the family of Gemma. 
 
In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business and make it bigger.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
La señora Silviana  es soltera vive en un pueblo  en la que celebran la fiesta del santo domingo el  veinticinco de  abril.

    Ella solicito  el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrote en donde lleva trabajando  diez años   en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado muchos sus ingresos.
  
     Ella inicio   por sus propios   meritos ya que   también quiere apoyar a sus   padres con los ingresos de la casa en donde comenta  que  le va  bien ya que con ello a cubierto algunas deudas.
 
   Lo que ella desea es que con sus ingresos y el préstamo que solicito  siga  aumentado su pequeño negocio.

         Las personas quienes integran en el grupo son: María del Rosario invertirá el préstamo en  antojitos,   invertirá en  compra y ventas de ropas,  Javier invertirá bonetería y mercería, Faustina invertirá en antojitos,  Martha  Leticia venta de catálogos  de zapatos de la marca terra.
texts.en:
Silviana is single and lives in a town that celebrates the feast day of Santo Domingo on April 25th.  She requested the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store that she’s had for ten years and that she comments she does well in because her income has improved very much.

She started out on her own initiative because she also wants to help her parents with household income and she states that she’s also done well here in that she’s been able to take care of some debts.  What she wants is that with income and the loan she requested her small business will continue growing.

The group members are: María del Rosario who will invest the loan in fast food and will buy clothes to sell; Javier who will invest in notions and bonnet supplies; Faustina who will invest in fast food and Martha Leticia in catalogue sales of Terra brand shoes.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Christine Elise

texts.fr: Christine Elise est une dame âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. tous ces enfants vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente de vêtements et sacs dans  un quartier de la ville depuis 2 an seulement. elle exporte les fruits vers l'europe et reçoit en retour des sacs, chaussures, parfums qu'elle commercialise sur place. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits en grande quantités pour augmenter  ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui sera en partie reversée dan son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine Elise is a 42-year-old lady, married and the mother of five children, all of whom go to school. She has been running a business selling clothes and bags in one of the city's neighborhoods since only two years. 

She exports fruit to Europe and in return receives bags, shoes, and perfumes she sells locally. She wants to use this loan to buy products in large quantities to increase her sales and earnings.

Profits will be partly reinvested in her activity so it can be expanded, and the rest will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: increase her stock of products

loans.name: Sovanara

texts.en:
E. Sovanara came to the CREDIT office with his mother, Ngen Sophan. He was requesting a $1,000 loan to invest in his food sales business and she came as his guarantor. Sophan must trust her son to guarantee such a loan. She is confident because Sovanara has successfully completed his first two loan cycle and was able to improve his house and to start the business.

Sovanara and his wife can make around $5 per day in cooking and selling food to the factory workers. Sometimes Sovanara is also earning some extra money as a moto-taxi. They have never been late in their repayment schedule because they save on a daily basis.

With his 3rd loan, he decided to buy a second motorbike. He will spend $800 in a strong second-hand motorbike and will keep the old one in case of emergency. Sovanara will use the remaining $200 to buy spices but also to cover the delayed payments he is granting to some of his clients.

In the future, the family has a plan to start another business. They would like to buy a cow and raise it for its calves.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike and invest in fod business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is a person with very good ideas. She decided to open a grocery store in her home, in order to provide food to her neighbors. The business has gone well but she needs to increase her product line, for which she is requesting a loan of $1200, which she plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Consuelo es una persona con muy buenas ideas por lo que decidio abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, para poder proveer de alimento a sus vecinos, el negocio a marchado bien pero necesita incremebtar sus productos por lo que solicita un credito de $1200.00 los cuales piensa pagar en un lapso de 12 meses

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Roine

texts.en:
Roine L. is a young mother of two, and she lives with her husband in the small Samoan village of Siuniu Falealili.

She believes in her and her husband’s farming abilities, and they manage a 10-acre taro plantation together.

Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet, and so when Roine takes their crop to market twice a week, she is usually able to sell her full supply for about ST 300 (approximately USD 120).

She is anxious to invest further in their farming enterprise, and so she has applied for a loan to buy some fertilizer to improve their crop yield. Roine also wants to use part of the loan funds to repair the damaged floor of her house.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and make home improvements

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Y. is 31 and has 3 children, aged 1 to 8. They live on the outskirts of Do Luong, a small town in the central province Nghe An. Together with her husband, Mrs. Y. farms a small rice field, but the rice is not enough for the couple's main business of making glass noodles. Mrs. Y. therefore joined  TYM Fund and applied for a loan of US$250, hoping to increase the production of noodles by 50%.

loans.use: Purchase of rice for making noodles

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabitri M., 27, lives in Thecho, Nepal, with her husband and a daughter. Her husband, Dharma lal M., works in Nepal Telecom as a field worker, and her daughter is studying in higher secondary school in grade 9.

Mrs. M. opened a wood shop 4 years ago. She is a very hard-working woman and does all her work perfectly. She is a wood dealer and supplies wood to a local carpentry shop which makes windows, doors and other items. Now she needs $225 to purchase more wood to fulfill the demand of the local markets.

Mrs. M. wants to save money for the future and also wants to be able to afford further study for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther sells crayfish; she is 48 years old, married to Mr. U., has 6 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She has 14 years 'experience in this business and has been a leader in her union for the past 8 years. According to her, if the loan amount of $475 is given to her she will be able to buy more crayfish and dry fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish & dry fish for sale

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Mrs. Gita M., a 37-year-old lady, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband, a son and two daughters.
Her husband, Mr. Man Bhakta M., is a carpenter. Her son is in school. Her older daughter is studying in grade 5 and younger daughter is in primary school.
Mrs. M. opened her poultry farm a few years ago. She sells chickens and eggs in her farm. Now she is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000 to buy chickens to expand her business. She wants to spend her income in providing a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buys chickens

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto S. is 40 years old. He is a native of the Barrio Virgen de Fátima de Carapeguá. He is single and has his own home. His neighbors know him as an upright, hardworking person. He is a street vendor who sells handicrafts on weekends and works as a contractor during the week.

Mr. S. states that he recently endured a difficult experience. His mother suffered a heart attack and was hospitalized for a long period of time. Since Mr. S. is an only child, he suffered many hardships alone. His mother has since recuperated and he is happy because he was able to cover all medical expenses with the money he was able to save these past few years.

With this loan, he will buy more handmade bedspreads, which will increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sixto S. tiene 40 años es oriundo del Barrio Virgen de Fátima de Carapeguá es soltero tiene casa propia es conocido por sus vecinos por ser una persona muy trabajadora y honrada , se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía los fines de semana y los demás días trabaja como contratista de obras.

Comentó el Señor Sixto que hace poco paso por una experiencia muy difícil, su madre había sufrido un infarto y estuvo hospitalizada por mucho tiempo y como el es hijo único paso por muchas necesidades solo. Hoy día su madre esta recuperada y el se siente feliz ya que con los ahorros que junto durante estos años pudo correr con los gastos del tratamiento.

Con el préstamo obtenido comprará más sobrecamas artesanales ya que la venta de estos productos le genera bastante ganancia

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Doña Ysabel is a member of the community bank “Las Candelarias II”. She is dedicated to the production and sale of ice cream. Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan of S/.800.00,($275) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 10 bags of sugar, 3 bags of flavoring, and 3 bags of essences.

Ysabel is 50 years old, married, her husband is a government employee and both have been successful in raising their 3 children who are now independent.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ysabel pertenece al banco comunal Las Candelarias II. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados. El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 10 bolsas de azúcar, 3 bolsas de saborizantes y 3 bolsas de esencias.

Ysabel tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es empleado público y ambos han logrado educar a sus tres hijos que ahora son independientes.

loans.use: Purshase supplies for the production of ice cream.

loans.name: Vahida

texts.en: Vahida is 60-year-old women from Nemila, a small suburb of Zenica. She is married and she and her husband receive a pension of 400KM. Vahida knits and that is the way she can earn some extra money. She enjoys in it and she wants to use this loan in the amount of 1000KM for buying wool in order to spend her time in a better way.

loans.use: Buying wool.

loans.name: Shahzadi's Group

texts.en: Shahzadi P. is from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  She has been married for 20 years  and has four sons. While Shahzadi is not educated, she strongly believes in education and has therefore enrolled all her children in school. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. This will be the second time she has borrowed in a group from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. This time, she needs a loan for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw. The other group members are: Razia B., who embroiders clothes; Suriya B., who is a widow and is borrowing for her family’s bed mattresses business; Arshad B., who also embroiders clothes; and Atia B., whose husband is a blacksmith.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,075.00.

loans.use: Fix our rickshaw

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun Y. E. is a 35 year-old farmer who lives in in Kampong Cham provence in Cambodia. She has run a farm since 1990 and earns around $2 a day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes $3 a day. Together, they work very hard to support their two children.

Chuun Y. E. has applied for a loan of $500 in buy tools and materials for the construction businesses she runs with her husband. Eventually, they would like to use these tools to build a pen in which they could start a new business raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy tools for a construction business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina started her business out of financial necessity since she is a single mother who had to raise her son on her own. In 2005, she met some people from Guadalajara who were silver jewelry distributors. She then started to sell jewelry to her friends. Since she realized that it was profitable, she continued with her sales. Her business has so far been prosperous.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and keep her business running. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina inició en las ventas por las necesidades economicas, ya que es madre soltera, y tuvo que sacar adelante a su hijo sola. En el año 2005, conocio a unas personas de Guadalajara que se dedican a distribuir bisuteria de plata y empezó a venderla entre sus amistades, como vio que era redituable siguio con las ventas de esto, y actualmente le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio, con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add some chic pants and blouses to her inventory in order to attract new clients.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Paloma Village Bank.

Luz is a separated, forty-two-year-old mother of four children. Luz works at a regional hospital in the city of Ayacucho as a nurse technician. Luz also has a small store in her home, located on Cumana St. in the Nazareno District, where she sells home supplies, fruit, sausages, etc with the help of her son. She opens her store from six in the morning until nine at night. In addition, Luz rents rooms in her house.

Luz needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and gelatin.

Luz’s dream is to stock more products in her store, to have another business, and that her children study in the city of Lima.

loans.use: Luz needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and gelatin.

loans.name: Željka

texts.en:
Željka lives in the town of Doboj with her husband and child. Her husband works in construction and earns 600 KM per month. Željka works as a cleaner in a medical centre. During her free time, she works in agriculture.

Željka is asking for a loan of 500 KM to buy chickens to breed during the winter. She will fatten the chickens and sell them for additional household income during the winter. This business will keep her family solvent until she can begin her agricultural practice again in the spring.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 40-year-old Grace M. from Dar es Salaam She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 15 and 22. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan.

Grace M. has been running a shop since 2004. This SELFINA client's business is buying lengths of African print cloth for making women's clothes from wholesalers and re-selling it retail. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Grace M. currently earns about US$ 100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional cloth and to open another shop. In the future, she plans to expand her shop further. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for women's clothes and to open another sales point

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary V. lives with her husband and their one child in the Phteah Rung Village of Pursat Province in Cambodia. She and her husband have been in the farming business since 2000. More specifically, they grow rice, and they currently earn approximately 10,000 Riel (US$2.50) per day.

Sary and her husband work extremely hard every day to generate income for the family's daily living expenses. For another source of income, Sary is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Riel (US$250) to purchase piglets to breed. In this way, she is hoping that the loan will enable her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed as an additional source of income

loans.name: Safouratou

texts.fr: Née en 1938, Madame B. Safouratou est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. C’est grâce aux revenus de ses activités (vente de produits alimentaires et de légumes) qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Souvent confronté à de fréquentes ruptures de stock, elle sollicite un financement pour faire un stock consistant des produits alimentaires et agrandir son étalage. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et de surcroît son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1938, Ms. Safouratou B. is married and the mother of five. Thanks to the income from her business (selling grocery items and vegetables), she manages to help cover household expenses. Often confronted with frequent inventory shortages, she is requesting financing to create a sizable stock of food items and to expand her display of goods. This will enable her to increase her buying power and ability to earn extra income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is 49 years old. She is married and has five kids. Currently three of them are in school. Through hard work, Veronica has provided support for two kids to complete senior high school. She is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past ten years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. As a part of her business expansion, Veronica has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. When asked, she said most of her customers requested the rice so she saw it as an opportunity. She hopes to raise more income to support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called Boldness Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith N. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children. Her two eldest children just graduated from the University of Benin. She owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. 

She needs a loan of N30000 to purchase more food and drinks to cook and sell. She says "thank you" to everyone who has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks to cook and sell

loans.name: Aychi

texts.en: Ayshi is a 44-year-old woman, living in Kamed Al Lawz in the Bekaa Valley. She has worked for three years as a sales woman specializing in cosmetics. Over the years she managed to attract an increasing number of clients. Today, Aysha wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy more inventory to satisfy her clients' needs.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake N. is 42-years old and she is married with four children. Folake N. sells plantains in her shop. She travels to markets in villages like Okada and Ugboghui in Edo state to purchase plantains to sell in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains to sell so she can increase the number of customers she serves. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Simón Bolívar Nº Cdra. 07, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 55 años y es madre de 5 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio, con S/. 200.00 por iniciativa propia, decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo verduras picadas. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes;  y cuenta con dos locales, uno que se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Pumahuasi y el otro en su propia casa.

Con el prestamo de S/ 1,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, golosinas de toda variedad  para mantener contenta y satisfecha a su clientela a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Ruth, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ruth M. R. belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank and she lives in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood of the Pillory District, Department of San Martin. She is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of 5 children, one of whom still depends on her. She started her business with $65 of her own funds, undertaking the sale of chopped vegetables. She currently sells groceries and has two sites, one located in the Pumahuasi District and the other at her house. The loan of $475 will be paid in 6 months, and she will invest it to buy more products to stock her business. These include rice and sugar in bags, packaged toilet paper, milk and preserved fish in boxes, personal hygiene products, and cleaning supplies for the home. She will also sell a variety of sweets and delicacies to maintain happy and satisfied customers. She makes the decisions regarding the business profits. On a personal level, she says she is more sociable, more confident, and will be responsible for the payment of her loan. Ruth is grateful to Manuela Ramos allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, preserves, sweets, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 38-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their one child. He has worked as a car repairer and painter for the last fifteen years. Abass has applied for a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his garage. He has been a microcredit client for the last eight years and has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him improve his garage and his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and car dealers. When Abass started his business, things went smoothly because of his experience in this trade. In the future, he plans to expand his business by trading in cars.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
SONIA R. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Puerto Maldonado Nº 287, cerca de la I.E. Fray Martín, en el distrito de Callería, tiene 42 años de edad, trabaja en la panadería Rosita, ubicada en su domicilio, su esposo trabaja como panadero y tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales 1 estudia una carrera técnica, 1 está en la secundaria y un bebé de 1 año, motivo por el cual trabaja arduamente en la “Panadería Rosita”.

 Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar insumos para elaborar panes y vender al público en general y a bodegas del barrio “El Arenal”. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700. Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para elaborar los agradables panes y biscochos que ofrece panadería “Rosita” creada hace 42 años.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque sin tanto trámite puede obtener un crédito y mantener su negocio, logrando conservar el legado histórico del negocio
texts.en:
Sonia R. L. belongs to the “Madres Coraje” community bank. She lives at the Jr. Puerto Maldonado Nº 287, near the I.E. Fray Martín, in the Callería district. She works in the Rosita bakery, which is located in her home. Her husband is a baker. They have 3 children. One is studying for a technical career, one is in high school, and they have a 1 year old baby. This is why she works so hard in the Rosita bakery. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy ingredients to make her bread. She sells to the general public and to stores in the El Arenal neighborhood. With a loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy ingredients to make her pleasing breads and desserts that are for sale in the Rosita bakery, which was founded 42 years ago. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because she can get a loan to maintain her business without so much paperwork. She has been able to conserve the historical legacy of her business

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy  supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra.TEODORA; vive en el barrio D. suncco, en el distrito D. San Jerónimo, está situado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años D. edad es casada y tiene 7 hijos, el menor tiene 17 años y aún vive con ella, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y el comercio D. verduras y semillas, nuestra socia trabaja las tierras que por herencia sus padres le dejaron aún en vida, ella viene sembrando y cosechando cada año, y estás mismas las lleva a vender al mercado D. San Jerónimo, ella ahora solicita el préstamo para poder comprar e implementar un puesto en el mercado y comprar más semillas para trabajar sus tierras.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete
texts.en:
Teodora lives in the Suncco neighborhood of San Jerónimo, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 49 years old and the mother of 7 children. The youngest is 17 and still lives with her at home.

In addition to maintaining her home, Teodora is involved in agriculture and the sale of vegetables and seeds. She works the land that her parents have given to her, planting and harvesting every year. She then goes on to sell them herself in the market of San Jerónimo.

Teodora is requesting this loan in order to run her stand in the market and to buy more seeds to plant. She sends her gratituD. and is committed to its repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run her stand and buy more seeds

loans.name: Jose Toribio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. JOSE, el es natural de Pilcopata, situada en el distrito de kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo, correspondiente al departamento del Cusco, correspondiendo a la entrada al parque nacional del Manu, a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.
