El socio tiene 58 años de edad el es viudo y tiene 6 hijos los últimos tienen 19 y 15 años, el alterna sus actividades de agricultor, lleva a las diferentes ciudades donde no hay producción de frutas, sus diferentes frutas (pacay, guanábana, aguaje, plátanos diversas variedades, naranjas, piñas, limas, duraznos, melones, masa zamba, chirimoyas), y al volver trae artículos de limpieza y ropa, el trae de la capital del Perú ropa al por mayor de verano para poder vender en su población, para lo cuál requiere el préstamo para transportar y traer de vuelta su mercadería.

El socio es un señor muy amable y agradece y valora el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The member Jose is from Pilcopata, located in the district of Kosñipata, in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, which is near the entrance to the Manu National Park, 8 hours from the city of Cusco. Jose is 58 years old, widowed, and has 6 children, the last of which are 19 and 15; he alternates his agricultural activities, takes his goods to the different cities where there isn’t fruit production (he grows are: pacay, soursop, aguaje, various plantains, oranges, pineapples, limes, peaches, melons, masa zamba, and custard apples), and upon his return he brings back cleaning supplies and clothing. He brings wholesale summer clothing to sell to his community from the capital of Peru, for which he requires a loan to be able to transport and bring back his merchandise. Jose is a very amiable man, and is thankful and values the support that has been granted to him through this means, in that same manner he promises to pay back his loan in total in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothing to sell.

loans.name: Amewossina

texts.fr: Amewossina A. est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est commerçante de fruits et légumes à Lomé. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce. Son ambition est d’aller payer les marchandises auprès des agriculteurs et de venir les revendre aux détaillants en ville.
texts.en:
Amewossina A. is a 50-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four. She is a merchant of fruit and vegetables in Lomé. She would like to use this loan to expand her commerce. Her ambition is to go and buy merchandise from growers and to come back and resell them to retailers in town.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetrables for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria H. is a baker and also runs a grocery store selling food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a tabletop in front of her store. Victoria buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and treks to markets in the nearby towns. She has been in business for 20 years.

Victoria is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her first four children have completed university and are all working. The last child is waiting to enter the university. Victoria lives with her family in the community of Bawaleshie, a suburb of Accra. She wants more working capital to buy goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save her the problem of frequent trips.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy O. sells roasted beef (called 'poomo' in Nigeria). Roasted beef is used in the preparation of Nigerian soup. Lucy is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to roast and sell to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to roast and sell

loans.name: Mariama Diouldé

texts.fr: Mariama diouldé est une femme de 63 ans. Elle est veuve et vit avec ses deux (2) petits enfants dont elle a charge. Elle achète sa marchandise soit, à bord champs auprès des producteurs, soit dans les lieux de collecte d'arachide. Pour la commercialisation, elle va dans les marchés hebdomadaires vendre son produit à des marchandes qui l'acheminent dans d'autres localités du pays. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de six (6) ans et les profits qu'elle génère lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux et assurer la scolarité de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
Mariama Diouldé is a 63-year-old woman.  She is a widow and lives with her two children whom she supports. She buys her merchandise from producers, be it at the edge of their fields or at places where peanuts are gathered.  To market the merchandise, she goes to weekly marketplaces to sell to merchants, who take it to other towns in the nation.  She has been running this business for over six years, and the profits she generates enable her to meet family needs and to ensure her young children are educated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock large amounts of peanuts and to sell them to retailers at the weekly markets

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA PATRICIA A. A. , tiene 38años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores, es profesora de ciencias naturales (primaria), tiene  un hijo de 2 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
SANDRA   se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: cremas, talcos, colonias, perfumes, etc
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de útiles escolares que vendía en la tienda de su casa, pero debido a la bajas ventas cerró su local y se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos de belleza que venderá a sus amistades, vecinos, familiares y también en la tienda de su casa. 
Sandra sueña con tener una tienda de productos alimenticios para obtener mayor dinero y educar a su hijo ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre.
texts.en:
Mrs SANDRA PATRICIA A. A. is 38 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, a province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru.She belongs to the communal bank CIELO II.

A businesswoman with tertiary studies, Sandra is a primary school teacher of natural science. She has a two year old child who is economically dependent on her.Sandra sells beauty products such as creams, talcs, colognes, perfumes, etc.

She invested her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the purchase of school stationery, however due to low sales she closed her store and concentrated on selling beauty products. She will utilise this loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy more beauty products that she will sell to friends, neighbours and relatives, as well as through home sales. Sandra dreams of having a grocery store to increase her income and educate her child as she no longer has the economic support of her child's father.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 22 years old.

Christina has owned a crops business for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Christina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize and beans.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Christina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Sophia is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her shop business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Yulya

texts.en:
Yulya is married with a 4-year-old daughter Margarita. She is an entrepreneur from Stryi where she runs a business selling flowers and accessories in a small floral store. She launched this small enterprise about 2 years ago because she loves plants and seeks to make this world a more beautiful place. Currently, she gets about 20,000 Grivnyas in gross income each month. 

Yulya is requesting a loan of 14,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and sales as a result. She is hoping to buy a batch of handmade cards and additional vases to sell them as retail items in her little store along with a variety of flowers. Yulya is hoping to make some savings and eventually go on a tour to Prague, Czech Republic which has been her dream for a long time.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  “Espíritu Santo” esta representado por la señora Karim y conformado por 12 miembros del mismo barrio y con el mismo entusiasmo para salir adelante. Los socios cuentan con diferentes actividades económicas entre las que podemos mencionar a propietarias D. farmacias, vendedoras D. productos como ser comida, abarrotes en  tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, elaboración D. muebles D. madera y al servio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. Sus negocios se encuentran en diferentes lugares como también son ambulantes, por lo que sus negocios les son muy rentables y la competencia es escasa. Una mayoría D. los socios destinará el crédito en la inversión D. sus puestos D. venta  en agrandar sus negocios con la compra D. más mercadería o insumos para agrandar su venta D. comida para ello necesitaran dedicarse más al negocio y establecerse mejor generando mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios van

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles S., 57 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Phatimas Sos, 52, were married in 1970 and have 10 children: 7 sons and 3 daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other two are in school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sles and his wife are fishermen. They fish from the Mekong river and sell to wholesalers, who then take them to sell in other markets. But sometimes their fishing materials break, which upsets their business. So Sles is requesting his first loan in the amount of $500 in order to purchase nets and to repair his fishing materials. With this loan, the couple will be able to continue their business.

loans.use: To purchase nets and to repair fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma B. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Elma owns and operates a business buying and selling specialty food products like longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Elma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sengthai

texts.en:
Mr. Sengthai S., 27 years old, (shown in the picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Yun, 22 years old, have been married since 2006 and just have a two-year-old daughter. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sengthai has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. His wife has been selling second-hand clothes for two years. She buys clothes from Phnom Penh market for resale at Korki market about three kilometers from her house. 

By the way, Sengthai hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi and he will be able to generate more income as well. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a trailer to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi. He also will use a part of his loan to help his wife to buy additional second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 24 years old, married with 2 children, aged 2 and 5. Solange and her family live in Gasabo, a district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Solange has been selling clothes for the past 5 years, and the hours of her business are from 8 AM till late in the evening hours every day except Sunday. She employs 4 people in her business as helpers.

Solange is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital so that she can purchase additional styles of young people's clothing which are in demand. With this additional business, Solange hopes to sell at better prices in order to attract new customers and earn more profit.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Solange will to continue her life as a self-employed businesswoman with a successful enterprise and build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Femi

texts.en:
Femi is 30 years old and is married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes and they both contribute to supporting the family.

Femi sells clothes, shoes and bags. He wishes to expand and meet the needs of his customers during this festive period as the demand for clothing is very high. He is requesting the loan of N60,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring accessories in bulk

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Jamil has been selling used cars and spare parts since 2005. Jamil requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Jamil has requested a loan. 

Jamil is special because he knows how to treat his clients well. Before selling the used parts, he repairs and fixes them. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jamil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 35 years old and she is married with a child. Her child is 16 years old and attends school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She is hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She sells gari (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers. Gari is a staple food in Nigeria and the demand for it is high. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more gari to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gari (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Guadalupe” esta representados por la señora Carmen y conformada por 17 miembros que son padres y madres D. familia, que trabajan  fuerte, para  poder sacar adelante a su familia como es el ejemplo D. la socias destacada la señora Carmen Silvia que se dedica al servicio D. limpieza ya que debe sacar adelante a sus dos hijas sin el apoyo D. un esposo debiendo trabajar desD. las 6 D. la mañana para empresas D. limpieza y en las tardes se dedica a el lavando ropa en casa particulares y en las noches se dedica a la educación D. sus hijas porque su mayor anhelo es poder ver a sus hijas profesionales , pero viendo D. que no logra ahorrar para el futuro D. sus hijas desea realizar una actividad con la venta D. emparedados y hamburguesas los fines D. semana en un parque cercano a su calle y el reto D. los día en la puerta del domicilio donD. resiD. que actualmente es en anticrítico. 

Por otra parte la presidenta que es la señora Carmen se dedica hace 24 años al comercio en general vendidendo todo tipo D. artículos D. acuerdo a la necesidades del mercado, el préstamo ella lo utilizará para adquirir mayor mercadería ya que así se pueden abaratar costos. 

El resto D. los socios se dedica a la venta D. comida, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. pan, venta D. cosméticos y promotoras D. productos D. belleza;  la actividad D. algunos varones del grupo es que son empleados, albañil, moto taxistas y distintas actividades que realizan para poder progresar y cumplir con sus  obligaciones. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y un sacrificio, para obtener un ingreso capaz D. sustentar a sus familias. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe group is represented by Carmen and maD. up of 17 members, fathers and mothers who work hard to help their families get ahead in life. For example, Carmen Silvia provides cleaning services, and is responsible for supporting her two daughters, since she doesn’t have any help from a husband. She starts working for the cleaning services at 6am each day. In the afternoons, she washes clothing at private homes. In the evenings, she teaches her daughters, because her greatest dream is for them to grow up to be working professionals. However, she has realized that she is unable to save money for her daughters’ future and so has decided to start selling hamburgers and sandwiches on the weekends in a park near the street where she lives. During the week, she will sell hamburgers from the door of her rental home. Carmen, the group's president, has been working in commerce for the past 24 years, and sells different items according to market demand. She will use this loan to acquire to buy bulk merchandise in order to keep her costs down. The other group members sell food, basic grocery items, bread, cosmetics and beauty products. Some of the male group members work as employees, carpenters, motorcycle taxi drivers, and carry out other activities in order to make progress in life and fulfill their obligations. There is a lot of competition within their respective fields, and all of these men and women are self-sacrificing and work hard in order to earn the income they need to support their families. The loan will be used to buy a variety of products for their businesses and improve the services they offer to their customers so that their businesses will generate more income and an improve their respective economic situations. Since this is a new group, they have received a training session and are content and satisfied to be Agrocapital clients. Some of the group members already have experience taking out similar loans from other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer trabajadora que alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de artesanía de forma ambulatoria, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar desayuno para sus hijos y alistarlos para mandarlos al colegio,  ella vende sus productos ofreciendo a los turistas en las puertas de los hoteles de cuatro y cinco estrellas y también vende en el centro histórico. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. Judith usará el préstamo para comprar joyas y platería. Judith es una mujer responsable que forma parte del banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que forma parte del banco comunal. El anhelo de Judith es tener una tienda propia y exportar tejidos al extranjero. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Judith is a hard-working woman who balances her time between the sale of artesanal goods as a street vendor and taking care of her home. She rises early in the morning to prepare breakfast for her children and prepare to send them to school. She sells her wares to tourists in the doors of four and five star hotels as well as the historic center of the city. Judith has been in this line of business for quite a few years and things have gone well thanks to the commitment she puts into her job. Judith will use this loan to purchase jewelery and silver. Judith is a responsible woman and has been a member of the village bank "Sacsayhuaman" at Asociación Arariwa for a few years. Her dream is to have her own store and export woven textiles abroad. Judith is grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and because of that pledges to pay back the loan according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Judith will use the loan to buy jewelery and silver

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está compuesto or cuatro socios, Rosemary (venta D. artóculos D. consumo diario, bananos y platanos), Walter (venta D. artículos D. consumo diario), Edgar (vetna D. artículos D. consumo diario), e Izabel (Venta D. fruta y comida). La mayoría D. los socios venden artículos D. consumo diario y todos viven en Bárcenas, Villa Nueva.

Rosemary tiene 15 años trabajando en su tienda D. consumo diario también tiene una venta D. plátanos y bananos el cual le genera ingresos para sostener a su familia, las otras socias también tienen su propio negocio D. consumo diario.

El sueño D. doña Rosemary y D. los demás socios es poder crecer como empresarios y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que ellos puedan ser personas D. bien, también esperan tener más clientes.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Group consists of four members: Rosemary (who sells daily consumer products, bananas, and plantains), Walter (who sells daily consumer products), Edgar (who sells daily consumer products), and Izabel (who sells fruit and food). The members all live in Bárcenas, Villa Nueva.

Rosemary has been working 15 years in her store where she sells daily consumer products. She also sells bananas and plantains to generate income to support her family. The other members also have their own businesses.

Doña Rosemary and the other members dream of growing as entrepreneurs. This will allow them to proviD. a better future for their children so that they can develop into good people. They also hope to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. N. used to be employed as a supermarket attendant. She quit this job and opted into the charcoal business. This was back in 1998. Currently, she buys her 20 sacks of charcoal three times a month from Busia or Bungoma town.

Josephine would like a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings which she will use to expand her business by increasing the number of sacks she buys to 30 sacks. Josephine is married and the mother of 16 children, who she still takes care of. Her main plan for the future is to ensure the education of all her children, irrespective of their gender.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lucialinda

texts.en:
Lucialinda D. is from the village of Mitimos. She is 64 years old, married, and has no children. To make a living, Lucialinda owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector planting assorted crops. The main source of income for the business comes from selling her harvested crops in the local community. Lucialinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Lucialinda joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lucialinda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa M. is from the village of Zamora. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a hog raising business raising pigs for sale in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from this activity. Elsa joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien T. P. was born in 1967, has two children (a son and a daughter), and works with her husband on a farm. They have a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Lien is applying for her first loan, which she will use to raise livestock. She is very committed to making repayments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to raise livestock

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina H. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 41 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She grows hogs to fatten and sell. She also manages a farm where she plants rice. The farm and hogs have been her family's source of income for more than 12 years now. 

Merlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed, vitamins and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Lucrecia Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Lucrecia M. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad, y su gente que es cálida y amable.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y uno soltero pero todos viven de manera independiente, su esposo es comerciante de zapatos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Lucrecia es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos y se ha decidido a venir a vivir a esta ciudad por su familia, es comerciante de ropa y  ha logrado tener un puesto en el mercado de la Feria Libre, labora 3 días a la semana y tiene este negocio hace unos 6 años.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como: chaquetas, pantalones, etc. Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio y llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia M. is a member of the Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is renowned for its beautiful landscapes, its churches, the 4 rivers that surround the city and its people, which are warm and friendly. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. Three of them are married and one is single, and they all live on their own. Her husband is a shoe salesman. She does not have a house of her own, so she rents. Lurecia is a native of the province of los Ríos and she decided to come to live in this city for her family. She is a clothing saleswoman and had managed to obtain a stall in the Feria Libre market. She works 3 days a week and has had this business for the last 6 years. She has been a member of the communal bank for the last 5 years and has a very good friendship with all of the other members. Her new loan will be invested in merchandise such as jackets, pants etc. Her goal is to continue growing her business and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, jackets, blouses

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 25 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. She owns a retail store where she sells household items. She prides herself on having an accurate scale for weighing products. With her business profits, Marceline has been able to afford healthcare for herself. She is taking out a loan to buy more household items for her store. Eventually, she hopes to be able to buy larger quantities of goods and become a wholesale store, selling to local retail shops.

loans.use: To buy household items for her store

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub M. has been engaged in the farming business for more than 15 years. He breeds calves in the small village of Imishli. He sells cattle to the local butchers and cafes. His monthly income is about 250-300 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN).

Teyyub needs a loan of 900 AZN to buy more cattle and increase the number of animals he has. Teyyub has four children and he hopes to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Noel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Noel de Jesus G. V., tiene la edad de 33 años vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino es casado y su esposa es comerciante de frutas y verduras y apoya a los gastos que como familia incurren mensualmente, ellos tienen 2 hijas pequeñas y por las cuales quisieran mejorar sus condiciones económicas para el bienestar de sus hijas, él señor trabaja en una gasolinera de Ticuantepe, un municipio de la ciudad de Managua, sus condiciones laborales han venido en mejora, puesto que años atrás laboraba como cobrador de buses urbanos, ganando un ingreso variable, puesto que ahora goza de una mejor estabilidad económica. Y ambiciona con la posibilidad de inaugurar un autolavado express, y es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como espuma, cera, aspiradoras, mangueras, etc. Materiales con los cuales iniciar su propio negocio, espera se le brinde una apoyo económico para realizar una mejora a largo plazo de las comodidades a las cuales se enfrentan hoy en día, y favorecer  las condiciones socio-económicas a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Noel de Jesús G. V., 33, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. He’s married and his wife is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She contributes to the household expenses they have each month. They have two small daughters whose economic conditions and wellbeing they’d like to improve. He works at a gas station in Ticuantepe, a municipality in the city of Managua. His working conditions are improving because years back he worked as a fare collector on urban buses and his income was never stable; now he enjoys better economic stability. He is hoping to be able to open an express carwash and needs funds to buy supplies like: foam, wax, vacuums, hoses, etc. which will make it possible for him to start his own business. He hopes that he will be granted financial help that will lead to long-range improvements in the levels of comfort they currently enjoy as well as to improved socio-economic conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a carwash.

loans.name: Julie-Ann

texts.en:
Julie-Ann A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Julie-Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julie-Ann has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Julie-Ann joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie-Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julie-Ann is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Martha es una D. L. miembros del Grupo La buena union  1 y 3, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad D. Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais.  Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia el deseo D. invertir en su negocio y le hacia falta capital. Es madre soltera con 3 hijos, D. L. cuales 2 aun viven con ella, por L. que se esfuerza y se dedica a trabajar. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil ha sido criar a sus hijos, pero que a la ve disfruta cuidarle y tambien asistir a la iglesia.

Martha está muy emocionada D. recibir su Tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 2 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. Shampoo, Acondicionador, y otros cosmeticos.  Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ir construyendo su casa ya que su sueño es poder vivir tranquila y en una buena casa junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1 y 2” (The Good Union 1 & 2) communal bank.  They are micro entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc.  Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she wanted to invest in her business and she lacked capital.  She’s a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her and for whom she strives to work hard.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children although she enjoys caring for them and attending church.

Martha is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’s growth.  She has had her business for about 2 years; she started it with her first Esperanza loan.

She will use this new loan to buy shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics and will use profits to gradually build her house since her dream is to live in peace with her children in a good house.

loans.use: For shampoo, conditioner and others.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra lives with her family in a two-room brick house in an area named Basti Hamid Shah in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. A housewife who stays at home to discharge her responsibilities, she has a two-year-old daughter who needs her mother’s full attention.

For over 10 years Bushra's husband, M. H., has been involved in a laundry business, offering washing and clothes-pressing services to his customers to earn an income for their family. He is a very hardworking person who works for nine hours on a daily basis.

Bushra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business so that he can purchase an iron and washing machine to provide better and more timely services to his customers. She is sure that her husband will gain positive results in his business by making this loan investment.

A regular borrower from Asasah, this is Bushra's fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she proved to be a responsible client, attending all meetings and paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy an iron & sewing machine for laundry business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Even at her older age of 41 years old, Gemma never feels tired of doing things to make money for her everyday living. Although her husband sometimes gives her some money from his income as a construction worker (laborer), Fe does not stop there.  She wants to help her family especially her two dependent children, who are still in school. That’s why she decided to join Kiva field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI).  She wants to get a loan to buy inventory such as frozen foods, silver accessories, and other supplies. 

Now that her business is up and running, Gemma need additional funds for the expansion of her business. She wants to increase her stock of goods that she sells in her house. This will make her business grow.

Gemma has a simple dream, making sure her family does not experience hardship, which will make her happy.  That’s why she will never get tired of helping them even in little ways. If these dreams will happen, Gemma also hopes to extend her helping hand to others, most especially her relatives who also need support.

Fe is very glad for the motivation and support, which give her strength to continue dreaming of the best in life.  Gemma is praying that, with ASHI and Kiva’s support, there is a big opportunity for them to reach their dreams.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of frozen foods, silver accessories and other supplies.

loans.name: 030322-Trung Hai -Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Phang D. T. is a 56 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Phang is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 030322-Trung Hai -Hoang Thanh.


Phang is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phang owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for saL..  Phang has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,400,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Phang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Nep is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Chung is a 51 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Ha is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phang D. T. (44) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Phang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030322-Trung Hai -Hoang Thanh (030322-Trung Hai -Hoang Thanh).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Phang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phang kiếm được khoảng 1,400,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Phang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phang đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Nep (37) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Chung (15) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Ha (40) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Janepher Khakasa

texts.en:
Janepher Khakasa M. is 39 years old. She is married to Stephen Wafula and a mother of five beautiful children. Janepher lives in Maili Saba in Kitale town, where her business is. She buys clothing materials, makes clothes and later sells the clothes to her customers. Janepher gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings and has been in this business for eight years now. She also has a grocery shop on the side. 

This will be Janepher's second loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine worth fifteen thousand shillings and will use the balance to buy more materials for making clothes. She plans to invest the income she is going to get back into her business so that she can earn more income.

In the future, Janepher hopes to purchase a plot of land, build rental houses, educate her children to the highest level and also raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. prepares kenkey (sourdough dumplings) at Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a famer, and she assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional capital.

Adjoa at the time of visit had not processed the maize into dough to be used, and she is showing the soaked maize she would be using for the kenkey.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare more kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Sunya

texts.en:
Sunya A. R. (pictured above in FATEN's office) is a young woman from Tulkarem in northern Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sunya wants to help him by having a second source of income, as well as becoming independent and securing a stable income.

With the help of her husband and a $2,000 loan from FATEN, Sunya wants to open a coffee roasting house.

loans.use: To open a coffee roasting house

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending business.  Her husband, 50-year-old Gerardo D., earns a living as a construction worker. They have 4 children who are between 18 and 26 years old. 

Anita  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her recent loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future, the education of her children, some savings for her family and house repairs. Anita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means “Honorable”). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining our team.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: For the past four years, Ekua K. has been selling raw rice and sugar in various quantities in Abura, Cape Coast.  A mother of three children, she is married to a driver whom she assists in taking care of the home. Ekua will use her loan to buy extra bags of rice and sugar for sale, and hopes to use any additional business profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating six business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, dry goods, mineral water refill, buying & selling wood, electronic re-loading and room-for-rent businesses.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her six businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 27,000.  Luciana is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her business operations. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Luciana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Clara Karina

texts.es:
Clara Karina V. S. tiene 22 años, vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.
	
Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, caco, naranja y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Clara Karina V. S., 22, lives in a common law relationship with her spouse and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has two children.

The “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” (We Progress Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which belongs to Chillanes canton.  It has 12 members who are primarily short cycle farmers of corn, rice and small amounts of passion fruit and raise animals like pigs and chickens.

Clara is a corn, cocoa bean, orange and rice farmer.  She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

She is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice and to buy farming supplies.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like infestations, diseases and weather variations.  

Her dream is to provide an education for her children.  She enjoys playing sports with her children.

loans.use: To plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana forma parte del banco comunal “Arco Iris” perteneciente a la ciudad de Osorno.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, Eliana atiende un minimarket desde hace 2 años, su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, por lo que compra al por mayor, resultando más conveniente económicamente.  Su horario laboral es de 9ºº de la mañana a 10ºº de la noche, de lunes a sábado. 
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar artículos escolares y surtido de carnes y verduras.
Eliana vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 28, 22 y 13 años. La hija mayor del matrimonio éste año se gradúa de Médico veterinario.
Respecto a las metas de su negocio, ella desea que su negocio crezca, para esto se propuso realizarlo en un plazo de un año. El sueño de Eliana a nivel personal es que sus 2 hijas menores continúen estudios superiores. Es por esto que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son obtener mayores ganancias, para poder brindarles un mejor bienestar a sus hijas y costear sus estudios. 
Eliana está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, además disfruta y aprende mucho de las reuniones y capacitaciones realizadas.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Eliana is part of the "Arco Iris" ("Rainbow") community bank, located in the city of Osorno. She works in retail. She has had a small convenience store for the last 2 years. She buys her merchandise in bulk from distributors, which is more convenient price wise. She works from 9 in the morning to 10 in the evening, Monday to Saturday. With this loan she plans to buy school supplies and an assortment of meats and vegetables. 

Eliana lives with her ​​husband and three daughters aged 28, 22 and 13 years old. Her eldest daughter is graduating this year from vet school. With regards to her business goals, she wants her bushiness to grow in the coming year. Eliana's personal goal is for her two younger daughters to achieve higher education. That's why her motivation in continuing the business is to obtain higher profits, so as to provide her children with a better education and pay for their studies.

Eliana is very grateful for the credit granted by Fondo Esperanza. She also enjoys the meetings and has learned a great deal in the trainings conducted. 

Osorno is city in southern Chile, in the lakes region. It is an important agricultural centre known in Chile as "the homeland of milk and land of meat". The most important activities in the region are wheat and oat farming, livestock for meat processing and dairy production and the manufacture of agricultural equipment. Osorno is also known for having the only roofed football stadium in Chile, the Estadio Municipal Rubén Marcos.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and an assortment of meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Doris Emelina

texts.es:
Doña Doris, resiD. en Ozatlan, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 40 años D. edad, tiene casa propia donD. vive con sus hijos D. 18 y 17 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. mariscos, negocio que desarrolla hace un año y medio, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Santiago D. María, atendiéndolo D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra D. pescado fresco, puches, jaibas, olominas, pescado seco y ostiones, estos son los productos que ella venD. diariamente, y este préstamo significa darle fuerzas al negocio y contar con capital para el progreso del comercio D. pescado.
Ella quiere fortalecer el negocio, espera que después D. esta inversión sea más competente y pueda ayudar a sus hijos a formarse profesionalmente  D. una manera más solvente.
texts.en:
40-year old Doña Doris and her children aged 18 and 17 live in Ozatlan in the department of Usulután in their own house. Doris sells seafood, a business she started a year and a half ago. It is located in the municipal market of Santiago D. María, and she works there from 6am to 5pm.

Doris is seeking a loan to buy seafood such as puches, crab, olominas, dried fish, and oysters--all products that she sells on a daily basis. The loan would put fresh life into her business. 

Doris wishes to put the business on a stronger footing, and she hopes that this money will enable her to do that, and at the same time allow her to help her children financially while they are in school.

loans.use: to buy seafood such as puches, crab, olominas, dried fish, and oysters

loans.name: Carolina Del Fatima

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y  reside junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos en una zona urbana marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Carolina se dedica a brindar servicio de enfermería para una Clínica de la ciudad de Chiclayo, esta actividad la realiza hace 1 año, cuenta con estudios superiores en la Universidad Santo Toribio de Mogrovejo. Gracias a esta actividad ella solventa los gastos económicos personales y le ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.

Ella  desea dar inicio a los trámites de colegiatura, los cuales son requeridos por la clínica donde labora. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles. Carolina es una persona bastante trabajadora  y  responsable, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carolina is 25 years old, single, and resides with her parents and 3 brothers in a marginal urban zone of Chiclayo city. This is a highly commercialized region located in the north of Peru.

Carolina has worked as a nurse for a clinic in the city of Chiclayo for about a year. She also studies at the University of Santo Toribio de Mogrovejo. Thanks to her job, she is able to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with household expenses.

Carolina wants to pay her tuition, as required by the clinic where she works. To do this, she has found it convenient to request, for the 1st time, a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 700 new sols. Carolina is a hard-working and responsible person, with a strong desire to get ahead, improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Juan Carlos, el socio 31 años de edad; el socio es soltero, el socio trabaja desde hace 4 años atrás confeccionando muebles en melanina, el socio es carpintero y su especialidad es trabajar con melanina realizando diferentes muebles a pedido, el socio tiene su stand en la plaza Tupac Amaru y los días de feria que son los sábados y domingos el socio expone su trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para elaborar sus muebles.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called RENACER (To Be Reborn) and is located in Huanchac District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

The member is Juan Carlos, 31.  He’s single and has worked making melamine furniture for the last four years.  He’s a carpenter and his specialty is working with melamine making furniture to order.  He has a stand in the Tupac Amaru Square and on market days, Saturday and Sunday, he displays his work.  He is asking for the loan to buy work tools to make his furniture.

He is grateful and wishes to express that he will repay in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy furniture making tools.

loans.name: Unidas De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
En la zona denominada Saguazu, ciudad de Yaguarón a 23 Km. de la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reúnen un grupo de mujeres con el fín de mejorar sus ingresos sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, es así que realizan la reunión, la cual les ha resultado una  interesante oportunidad por lo que deciden conformar el comité.
El comité lleva por nombre Unidas de Saguazu por estar integrada por mujeres que siempre han trabajado unidas para todas las actividades, manteniéndose juntas  bajo un marco de respeto mutuo entre todas, actualmente se encuentran en el 8vo ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17 mujeres valientes quienes invierten sus créditos en sus actividades diarias.
La Sra. Emiliana necesita de este préstamo para la compra de alimentos de sus cerdos, ya que esto le permitirá comercializar luego y obtener así un ingreso que le ayude a solventar los gastos diarios. Ella es una mujer que lucha cada día para progresar de entre la pobreza en la que se encuentra.
texts.en:
In the Saguazu zone in Yaguarón city, 23 km from the city of Paraguarí, there is a group of women who hope to improve their lives through the microfinance program offered by Fundación Paraguaya. The group meets in Saguazu, and all the members agree that the program is a unique opportunity for each of them.

The group is called Unidas de Saguazu ('United Women of Saguazu'), to represent the 17 remarkable women members who invest their loans in their businesses and come together in the spirit of mutual respect for one another. They are currently in their 8th loan cycle with an excellent credit history. 

Emiliana needs a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She raises the pigs and later sells them, using the sales profit to meet daily household expenses. She struggles every day to keep her family out of poverty through her hard work.

loans.use: To buy a feed-weighing scale for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria, es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad. María tiene un restaurante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc., para la preparación de alimentos y la otra parte en la compra de servicios como: platos, tazas, cucharas, etc.
Maria Magdalena antes trabajaba como cocinera en un restaurante junto su capital y decidió abrir su propio negocio. Le gusta FINCA Perú, porque le ayudan con los préstamos y se puede ahorrar, aprende en la capacitaciones los valores, sobre la familia, los hijos y sobre todo a ser puntual.
texts.en:
Maria, is a member of the Carnation Community Bank. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18. Mary has a restaurant. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries like; rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc., for the preparation of food.  The other other part of the loan she will buy service items such as; plates, cups, spoons, etc. 
 Maria Magdalena previously worked as a cook in a restaurant near the capital and decided to open her own business. She likes FINCA Peru because of their help with loans and allows her to save. She learns training skills for her family, children and on top of that, to be punctual [with loan repayments].

loans.use: to by rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a market entrepreneur. Her family of four lives in the town of Pavlograd. Nataliya sells sportswear and athletic-clothing merchandise for hiking and active living. She owns two vending facilities in the central marketplace of her home town. Nataliya has been in the market for five years. She has about 55,000 Ukrainian grivnyas (UAH) in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to 8,000 grivnyas.  

Nataliya is seeking a 13,000-grivnya loan to purchase wholesale seasonal athletic merchandise for retail sale in her kiosks. She is planning to re-stock her merchandise with summer tops, T-shirts, and polos, as well as capris and skirts for ladies. Nataliya is very energetic. She likes to stay fit and active. Her pro-health approach to life has determined her preferences, and she enjoys working in this business niche.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal sportswear wholesale

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Ее сын находится в России. Сама Арзигул занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи и сеет рис для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in Jilikul. She is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. Her son is in Russia. Arzigul farms.  She basically grows vegetables and rice for sale. She has been doing this for 25 years. SHe is taking out a loan to buy seed and mineral fertilizer to plant and receive a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lucia Birmania

texts.es:
Lucia Birmania tiene 51 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.


Lucia Birmania se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es  construir la casa para vivir con la familia.

Le gusta caminar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia Birmania, 51, is a member of the “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank which is located in El Progreso belonging to Chillanes Canton.

The members of the El Progreso communal bank are located fifteen minutes from the Chillanes office.  The communal bank has 13 members and this is their third loan request to the cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans, corn, bananas, soya and manioc.

Lucia Birmania farms cocoa beans, corn, bananas, soya and manioc.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and in San Pablo and her sales take place in the Chillanes Sunday market.

The loan will help her buy supplies, fertilizer and manure.  The loan has helped her in that she’s increased crop yields.  She has faced challenges like illness among her laborers and infestations and illnesses in the crops.  Her dream is to build a house to live in with her family.

She enjoys going for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 43-year-old married woman with 9 children. The oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is only 3 years old.

Letecia and her husband are both farmers. They own and till a land in Trinidad, Bohol. They basically grow rice crops to sell. Letecia works hard to support her family. She said it is not very easy since they have a big family.

Letecia requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Letecia hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 33 years old, married with one child. She lives in Ozamis City. Anelyn sells copra (dried coconut) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 15000 the business. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to purchase more coconut fruits for her copra business .

Anelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut fruits for her copra business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for palm oil - 5 drums @ SLL700,000 and garri - 30 bags @ SLL50,000.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To hire an excavator.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 
Marina has a shop that buys & sells fish like tulingan & tamban (or sardines). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish to sell.
Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Sunahvar

texts.ru: Сунахвар проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 41 год. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее дочь учится в Вузе а сын учится в средней школе. Сама Сунахвар занимается торговлей. Она у себя дома открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области она 16 лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения продуктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара.
texts.en: Sunahvar lives in the Dangara region. She is 41 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Her daughter is now studying in the university and her son is going to a secondary school. Sunahvar is in retail business. She has opened a food market in her home. She has been in this business for sixteen years. She is taking out the loan to purchase food products to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory works hard to support her family. Glory is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Glory requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and other spices for her business.

Glory has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Glory would like to save money to extend her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients and other spices

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 30 years old and is married with two children between one month and nine years old. He owns a business of transporting people. This is his tenth successful years in this business and is open from 6 am until 11 pm every day.

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase material (tires)to help him in the business. Jean Pierre hopes to earn more profits. With this profits, he will be able to build a secure future and he will be able to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase another tires to help him in this business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 41 years old and single. To earn a living, he does photography. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable. This is because he has improved his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Patrick hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to rent a business premise.

loans.use: To rent a business premise.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old. He is a married father of one child, aged 2 months. He lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He is the only income earner in the family, and hence the responsibility of providing for the family rests on him. 

For the past three years he has been operating a produce business, which he started with 30,000 shillings in capital. Now he has 1,000,000 shillings in capital. He faces challenges of poor roads and inadequate capital. John needs a loan to buy rice, groundnuts, and sorghum to sell. He hopes to move his business to Hoima Town in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1  filho ainda bebé. Fez o nivel Secundario e frequentou no curso de enfermagem. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Zavala para Maputo em missão de estudos.É enfermeira ha mais de 4 anos e tem um salario de 5.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 15.000.00mt, para o seu negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Albertina was born in the district of Zavala, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has one son, who is still a baby. She finished high school and did a nursing course. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She left Zavala for Maputo to pursue her studies. She's been a nurse for more than 4 years and earns 5,600 meticals a month. She uses her salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to build her house. Her first loan was in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she invested in her business. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Talé Hortance

texts.fr:
Talé est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 1 enfant. 
Talé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1997. Elle vend des friperies pour tous clients de façon  ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Hedzranawoe. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Talé a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Talé voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Talé is 38 years old. She is a widow and has one child.

Talé has been a vendor since 1997. She sells second-hand clothing to all her customers on foot.

She buys her products in Hedzranawoe. She works by herself. For the time being, she is not having any problems. 

Talé has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy second-hand clothes. She would like to reinvest in her business. 

Over the next few years, she'd like to grow her business. She says she will take care of her family with her profits.

loans.use: to buy dozens of dresses, pants, and knit items.

loans.name: Bernarda Lila

texts.es: La señora Bernarda, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, ella es muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atravez de los fondos Kiva , ya que con el primer préstamo logro mejorar el techo de su humilde vivienda, ahora sus planes es poder realizar una caseta donde esta ubicado el lavandero y los barriles de agua , por q el actual está muy deteriorado y en  tiempos de lluvia no puede realizar la actividades de aseo en su casa porque toda la lluvia le cae .  Ya que ella no cuanta con los recursos económicos para poder realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de necesita para dicha obra, como bloques, cemento, arena, perlines, entre otros.
texts.en: Bernarda lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family.  She is very happy with the help she has received from AFODENIC through Kiva's funding since with her first loan she managed to improve the roof of her humble home. Her current plan is to rebuild a shed for the laundry machine and to store water barrels. In its current state, the shed is very deteriorated and when it rains she can't do her chores because water is everywhere. She doesn't have the economic resources to buy the materials necessary for the project, such as cinderblock, cement, sand, beams, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 37 years old and married with two children between 1 and 6 years old. He owns a business selling second hand clothing This is his seventh years in this business and he works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Damascene has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena is 37 years old and lives in La, Esperanza Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband find earnings for the family.

Glena is in the agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and excellently, the return is good. Monthly, she earns in the amount of 2,200 PHP doing this type of business.

Recently, she joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase rice farm fertilizer for good growth and nourishment.
