She plans in the near future that a portion of the income generated is put back into the business for the expansion.

loans.use: purchase rice farm fertilizer

location.town: La, Esperanza Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Phalla is 30 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

This is the first loan for Phalla’s group of two members with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a very young lady aged 20 years and has 2 children. Grace is hard working and very active in her church where she is a choir member and Women’s Guild. She sells used and new clothes at Kagumoini Shopping Centre. She has also a small piece of land where she grows onions and vegetables. She sells most of the vegetables but grows some for home consumption. For clothes to be sold there should always be something new to attract customers thus, the need for a loan to ensure that customers are maintained by stocking new materials.

loans.use: Grace wants to buy a bale of 1st class used clothes and new materials

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is a supplier of fruits and vegetables including coconut, pumpkins, pineapples, pawpaw, bananas, and spices. Her market is located at Siumu near tourist attractions like surfing and diving resorts. Her business is vibrant since she sells to a large group of people. Elenoa is very hard-working young lady, who wishes to expand her business, not only in supplying the locals, but aiming to establish an overseas market in the future.  Her existing customers are mostly village people and tourists visiting their village. One thing she’ll never forget in her life is that when the famous actor “The Rock” Dwayne Johnson visited Samoa, he actually stopped by her flea market and bought a coconut to drink.

loans.use: Buy seeds, organic fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Oloniu

texts.en: Oloniu is the secretary of Aleisa C and one of the active members in the Aleisa Center. Oloniu’s business is weaving fine mats, and she also runs a shop at the front of her house. These fine mats are used for faalavelave and for many of Samoan special occasions such as funerals and weddings. The mats (Ie Sina or Ie Toga) in the Samoan way of life (faasamoa) are one of the treasured goods of the Samoan people, and they are expensive in price. Oloniu's weaving business is the substitute for the shop in case cash flow is slow. Oloniu is looking at ways of marketing her fine mats overseas, and she is confident that the money from her business will be worthwhile.

loans.use: To buy feathers, paint, and weaving equipments

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
My name is Ana Lilian, I’m a merchant, I have a small local store called "ANA" in downtown. It generates an income to help with my family’s expenses. Thanks to this business I’ve been able to help in education of my children, I have a son in school and my daughter graduated last year. The most important is that I can run the business and take care of my family. I also have the support of my children during their time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ana Lilian, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en el centro de mi comunidad, llamada Pulperia "ANA" La que me genera ingresos contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio he colaborado para que mis hijos estudien, tengo hijo en el colegio y año pasado se me graduo una muchacha, y lo mas importante es que puedo atender el negocio y mi familia, tambien cuento con la colaboración de ellos en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, corn flour, soap, toilet paper, etc

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita A. and Zoraida Machao belong to a village bank called “Muchuy Warakaq”, which is a quechua (native language) word that means “Fight against poverty”. As part of the village bank, they receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment rests on both of them. They are asking for a total of US$ 1000; the loan will be divided between them.

In the local market in Ayacucho, Peru, past the flowers, raw meat, and dry goods, Margarita can be found chatting with customers and coworkers. Seven days a week, she sells live chickens and “cuy,” guinea pigs. The latter is a delicacy in Peru, prepared and eaten on special occasions. Because of the high altitude, grass is difficult to grow so raising cattle is almost impossible. This makes poultry and small animals the most practical source of protein.

Margarita says guinea pigs are the most popular item, and she has over 70 in cages in the market. She purchases all of her animals once a week at a livestock fair on the outskirts of town. She sells live animals, and also chickens and guinea pigs ready to cook. Guinea pigs are sold for US$ 2-3, depending on their size.

Margarita A. and her friend Zoraida Machao, who also works in the market, hope to expand their micro-businesses and increase their profit with this loan of US$ 1,000.

loans.use: to buy more live animals to sell in the market

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience A., a LAPO client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loasn and the poor in Nigeria. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in LAPO for 2 years and has been in this business since 1993. According to her she learnt this business from her aunty that brought her up and she needs the loan amount of $400 to buy a refrigerator, drinks and food items. This, she said, will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator, drinks and food items

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo is not married and lives with her parents. She has been engaged in trade for over 4 years. Her business is to sell towels and tablecloths. Her stall is located in J.Rasulov in the district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She has a good turnover of her working capital, and her assets are increasing every month. She bought her goods from suppliers from China. In the future she wants to go China herself to choose a different assortment of goods. From the Kiva program, she is requesting $800US to purchase the next batch of goods. She hopes to see a profitable month of holiday trade.

loans.use: Purchase a big batch of goods.

loans.name: Ma Eugenia

texts.es:
When María Eugenia got married, her husband covered all of their home's expenses. When she started to have their children, the money he made didn't go as far. The moment came when they didn't have enough to pay for their children's education. Eugenia didn't want her kids not to have an education, so she started to buy and resell clothing and shoes among her family members and friends. With the little money she made, she restocked her business.

Right now, they want to grow their business more to make more profits since what they are earning still doesn't cover their expenses. This is why Eugenia is requesting a credit of $850 that she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, she will buy more merchandise to be able to make more income so her children can study and be honorable people with more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María Eugenia se casó y todos los gastos del hogar los cubría su esposo, sin embargo cuando comenzaron a nacer sus hijos fue cuando el dinero comenzó a rendirles menos. Y llegó un momento en que no les alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Pero Eugenia no quiere que sus hijos no tengan educación y por eso que comenzó a comprar y revender ropa y zapatos entre sus familiares y amigos, con lo poco que juntaba resurtía su negocio.

Sin embargo actualmente desean crecer más su negocio para poder obtener más ganancias puesto que lo que están ganando los dos ya no les alcanza para poder pagar los gastos. Es por eso que Eugenia está solicitando un crédito de US $850 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero comprar más mercancía para poder así sacar más ingresos para que sus hijos estudien y sena unas personas de bien con más oportunidades.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir A. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. He owns and operates a small market. He sells clothes, home products, etc. at his market. Tahir needs a loan in the amount of $1075 to increase the variety of his products.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: Rosaline sells rice and palm oil in the market of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before the loan, she had two bags of rice and 20 gallons of palm oil as her stock. With the loans she increased her stock to 5 bags of rice and 20 gallons of palm oil and was able to pay her loan installments on time.  36-year-old Rosaline would like to increase her stock and income, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525. She is married with 3 children.

loans.use: Rosaline needs a loan to increase her stock of food items so that she can generate additional profits.

loans.name: Faga 1 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 7 women of Faga on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The women of Faga will use their loans for the following purposes:

Elise Faatu S. (56, married, 5 children) and Eve Eleni T. (47, married, 4 children) will both purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, 2 knives, filings, a planting stick and axes to cultivate and sell taro, yams, tuamu and bananas.

Filiga T. (56, married, 8 children) will purchase a fishing boat, fishing net and flashlight to catch fish and seashells.

Laulelei A. (67, married, 10 children) will purchase 4 bundles of wire, chemicals and a knife to support her taro and banana business.

Lita F. (42, married, 3 children) will purchase a sewing machine, a weed-killing sprayer, knives and filings for both her sewing and vegetable businesses.

Patouli T. (49, married, 5 children) will purchase fertilizer, a spade, chemicals and bananas for both her vegetable (bananas, etc) and pancake businesses.

Silaulelei F. (53, married, 4 children) will purchase thread, scissors and other materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, etc…

loans.name: Wajjala Ibrahim, Bugolo Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim W. is proud of his job. The moment you ask, he does not hesitate to tell you, "I am a boat transporter." He owns an engine boat that completes four routes a day from Jinja to Kikondo landing site on the Nile River waters. He has been running his business for 25 years.

Ibrahim is a member of the Bugolo Lending Group in Lugazi and loans have enabled him to grow his business. He says that before the loans he had no engine and this made transportation much slower and more difficult. Once given the group loan, he would like to buy another engine so that he can hire another person while he concentrates on his own. He is a 42 year old married man with two wives and 11 children, the first-born is 17 and the last is 2 years old. His business is really good and he has been able to finance his loans promptly.

loans.use: Ibrahim would buy an engine for his new boat as part of this group loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials and beauty products for her small beauty salon

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep M., 51, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. She owns a plot of land where she grows rice, eventually making around $3 each day. Her husband, Pum Serei, 46, earns on average about $4, from carpentry. This couple has three children, two of whom are students.

Now, Tep would like a loan from Kiva to purchase rice seed and fertilizers. The leftover will be used to buy carpentry tools. (Mrs. Tep is pictured with her husband at home.)

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel is a young man who just got married, and therefore has begun to assume new tasks and responsibilities. His wife is pregnant, and he wants to give his firstborn everything he needs. Gabriel just started a business selling seeds, which he transports from his town to the city of Arequipa (which is a route that takes more than 18 hours by land). He meets people who sell seeds, make the purchase, transports the merchandise, and thanks to the motorcycle that he bought, he can transport the seeds to far away towns. He began this business with a great desire to prosper, and now he has the opportunity to buy a greater quantity of seeds. For this he needs your financial support, and he presents himself in this manner, and waits for a positive response to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Gabriel es un joven que acaba de contraer matrimonio, por ende, empieza a asumir nuevas tareas y responsabilidades, puesto que su esposa está embarazada, entonces desea brindar lo necesario a su primogénito. Acaba de iniciar un negocio de venta de semillas, que traslada desde su pueblo hasta la ciudad de Arequipa (que es una ruta de más de 18 horas por tierra). Él se contacta con personas que vendan semillas, realizar la compra y traslada la mercadería, gracias a que adquirió una moto puede trasladarse a los pueblos alejados para conseguir las semillas. Este es el negocio que Gabriel ha iniciado con muchas ganas de prosperar, ahora desea tener la posibilidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, para ello requiere su apoyo económico, y se presenta en este medio esperando una respuesta positiva a su pedido.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy more seeds

loans.name: Mwajuma's Mnyonge Hamini Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, ages 2, 4 and 3. She also takes care of two other children, ages 6 and 8. She began selling food in 2004 and works from 8AM to 6PM each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Mwajuma has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She is requesting a new loan to increase her food inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Subira, who has a tailoring and bite sales business.

loans.use: To buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Elisabete Jacinto

texts.pt:
elisabete tem 37 anos nasceu em inhambane. E solteira e mae de 3 filhos com idades compriendidas entre 14anos a 3anos, os dois mais velhos encontram-se a estudar na escola primaria e a mais nova no centro infantil. Elisabete  muda-se para namaacha  uma vila na froneira com swazilandia  onde vivia o seu tio este que se encontrava no centro social da namaacha.

Elisabete estudou ate 5 classe teve que parar na altura devido a guerra,mas chegado a namaacha, estuda e comeca a trabalhar na OTM(organizacao dos trabalhadores de mocambique) como servente durante 2 anos, e auferia por mês 150mt. mas porque o salario não satisfazia as necessidades da casa pois ela já vivia sozinha numa casa de aluguer, aranja um novo emprego no centro de formacao de professores primarios da namaacha (CFPPN) actual instituto de formacao de professores primario da namaacha(IFPPN) que se encontra a trabalhar ate entao, trabalhando das 6:30 as 14;30h auferindo um valor de 1.800.00mt mensalmente. Com a ajuda do seu marido comeca a contruir a sua propria casa e acha que nos meados do proximo ano vai se mudar para sua nova casa. 

Este e o 2 emprestimo de elisabete com hluvuku o o primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 10.500.00mt foram usados na compra de material de contrucao e este segundo de 10.500.00mt serao usados para o mesmo fim. Pretende futuramente pedir outros emprestimos para pintar a sua casa e mobilar.
texts.en:
Elisabete was born in Inhambane and is 37 years old. She has three children between the ages of 3 and 14 years old, the two oldest are in school and the youngest is in daycare. Elisabete moved to Namaacha - a village on the border of Swazilandia where her uncle lives. Elisabete went to school through 5th grade when she had to drop out due to the war, but after moving to Namaancha she is able to continue her studies and started working at OTM (Mocambique's Workers Organization) as a janitor, making 150MT per month. Since her income wasn't sufficient to pay for her living expenses and rent, she found another job at the Namaacha's Graduating Center of School Teachers (CFPPN), today's Granduating Institute of School Teachers (IFPPN), where she still works from 6:30AM until 2:30PM earning 1,800MT per month. With the help of her husband she began building her house and believes that she will be able to move in by mid-next year. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan she took in the amount of 10,500MT was used to buy construction materials and this second loan in the amount of 10,500MT will be used for the same purpose. In the future she hopes to take out additional loans to help her paint and furnish her new house.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila Vasconcelos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constructions materials

loans.name: Mawoulé

texts.fr: Né à Agbétsiko en Juillet 1976, Monsieur M. Mawoulé vit aujourd’hui avec sa femme et ses deux enfants à Afagnan. Enseignant de profession, il a décidé d’associer le travail de cafétéria très tôt les matins et les soirs pour soutenir son revenu. Un financement lui permettra de se ravitailler afin d’être à la hauteur des demandes de sa clientèle. Des bénéfices, il parviendra à étendre son cadre d’activité et à bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agbétsiko in July 1976, Mr. Mawoulé M. now lives with his wife and his two children in Afagnan. A teacher by profession, he decided, on the side, to open a cafeteria very early mornings and evenings to supplement his earnings. A loan will allow him to build up his inventory of foodstuffs so as not to disappoint his clientele. From the profit, he will be able to expand this business and take good care of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking his cafeteria

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de Yulisa de 17, Ana Gabriel de 4 y Gabriel Omar de 2. Se dedica a la venta de pijamas de forma ambulatoria, negocio con el que viene trabajando durante un año, ya que está acostumbrada a realizar todo tipo de oficios.

Al tener que mantener a tres hijos, Julia trabaja incansablemente para lograr cubrir los gastos que requieren sus pequeños, lo bueno de su trabajo es que le permite ganar para solventar estos gastos, lo más difícil es el tener que viajar para traer las prendas a otras ciudades, pero Julia, en su afán de progresar, ve estos inconvenientes como cosas mínimas, impulsándola a seguir adelante.

Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma.El dinero que solicita será invertido en adquirir mayor cantidad de pijamas de bonitos diseños y mejor calidad para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old and is a single mother of 17 year old Yusila, 4 year old Ana Gabriel, and 2 year old Gabriel Omar. She sells pajamas as a traveling saleswoman, a business which she has been doing for a year, although she is already accustomed to working in all types of business.

Having to care for 3 children, Julia works tirelessly to be able to cover the costs her little ones require. The good thing about her work is that it allows her to earn enough to cover these costs. The hardest part is that she has to travel to take her garments to other cities. But Julia, in her eagerness to progress, sees these inconveniences as minimal, driving her to move forward.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The money that she requests will be invested in acquiring a large quantity of pajamas with pretty designs and better quality to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of pajamas to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 27 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros y una vez que esté lista su casa se mudarán. Cuando era pequeña se dedicaba a pastar el ganado de su madre, después de más joven decidió sembrar papa y arvejas para sus propios ingresos, luego conoció a su pareja e inició su familia. Desde entonces ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, y tienen metas de sembrar no solo en la sierra, sino también en la costa, debido a que ha notado que a sus familiares que siembran en otros lugares les va bien. Erika considera que la agricultura siempre es un riego, se puede perder o ganar, debido al clima, a los precios del mercado, etc., por ello quiere sembrar en varios lugares, y ella nos dice que sin dinero no se puede sembrar nada. Es su 7mo  préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es muy puntual en sus pagos. Esta vez, con el dinero solicitado, va a comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes para abonar su chacra, calcula que este préstamo cubrirá toda esa inversión, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Erika is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her husband’s parents and when their house is ready they will move into it. When she was little she took care of her mother’s livestock. While still young she decided to grow potatoes and peas to generate her own income. Then she met her husband and started a family. Since then she and her husband have been farmers, and they have goals of growing not only in the mountains, but also on the coast, as she has noted that her friends who grow crops in both locations do very well. Erika believes that farming is always is risk, you can lose or win, depending on the weather, the market prices, etc. so she wants to grow crops in various locations and she tell us that without money she will not be able to plant anything. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual in her payments. With the money she is going to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer for her farm, and she calculates that this loan will cover this investment. She is very grateful for this opportunity provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Patricia Juana

texts.es:
Patricia pertenece al Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro
Ella es casada tiene 28 años  dos hijos  de 9 años y él ultima de 10 meses, el mayor va al colegio 
Empezó con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza desde hace cinco meses, vende junto a una amiga, ella trabaja todos los días,  sus clientas son sus amigas, familiares, entre otras 
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, que será  invertido  en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que esta en Finca su negocio ha mejorado, tiene mas capital ha puesto más productos en venta, tiene un buen stock, compra a un menor precio y gana algo más, del 25%.
Ella sueña con construir su casa, y  tener una pequeña tienda, bien implementada con  vitrinas para exhibir sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Patricia belongs to the Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro. She is 28 years old and is married with three children. Her two youngest children are ages 9 and 10 months. Her oldest child is a high school student.

She began selling beauty products five months ago. She runs her business with a friend and works everyday. Her customers include her friends and family members.

Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of beauty products via catalog. Since joining FINCA, her business has improved. She has more capital, has offered more products for sale, has a good stock and is able to purchase her products at a lower price. She is now earning 25% more profits.

She dreams of building her own home and owning a small shop, with glass cases to display her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy beauty products via catalog

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta A. operates an electrical shop in her neighborhood. She started her operation three years ago. She is a 30-year-old mother of two kids who are currently in school. She lives with her family in Bawjiase, a suburb of Accra, the capital city of Ghana, in a family house. Alberta loves commerce, the business through which she earns bread for her family. She buys and sells electrical appliances such as cables, wires, switches, screws, etc. Through her business, she has been very resourceful for her family. She needs additional working capital in the form of a loan to enable her to increase her inventory.

With the loan, she wants to purchase and include more electrical gadgets such as blenders, irons, electric cookers, etc. She also hopes to increase her savings to provide her kids with quality education. She would appreciate it very much if you decide to offer her that assistance. She is a member of the community group called "Special Solidarity" Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical gadgets such as blenders, irons, electric cookers, etc

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells food and groceries. Philomena opens her shop daily from 7am to 10pm. Philomena is 30 years old and is married with 4 children. She is enthusiastic and optimistic about the future of her business and that of her family. Philomena hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more food and groceries to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila H. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Misuyo, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo invertir en mercadería adicional (05 quintales azúcar) para venderlo en la feria de Tacna.  
Ella, actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con ello, podrá adquirir más mercaderías (azúcar, arroz, aceite, etc.) para surtir su negocio. Su anhelo es convertir su negocio en una bodega de distribución al por mayor; asimismo desea comprarse un auto (camioneta) para poder trasladar mercadería a distintas ferias de la región y a Tacna.
texts.en:
Domitila H. S. is a member of Corazones Unidos Communal Bank, in the neighborhood Misuyo, district Esaguadero, province Chucuito, department Puno, Peru; she is thirty-one years old, has a partner, three children, and completed secondary school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a feminist organization, for five years. She sells groceries. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase additional merchandise (five quintales* of sugar) to sell at the market in Tacna. Now she is requesting a loan for S/. 1000.00, which she will repay in four monthly installments. The loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise (sugar, rice, oil, etc.) to stock her business. She dreams of her business one day becoming a whole sale grocery store. She would also like to have a car (a station wagon) to transport merchandise to the markets that are far from her, and to Tacna. *One quintal is equal to 100kg.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, and oil, and to stock her business.

loans.name: Grace Bosede

texts.en: Grace Bosede A. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells plastics such as bowls, spoons, plates, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Ablavi Emma

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle fait face présentement à une rupture de stock. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et demande à WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 05 sachets de bonbons, 05 cartons de tomate en bois, 04 cartons de détergents OMO, 06 cartons de couscous et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in Kégué, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. To earn an income, she does commerce in grocery items. She is presently coping with inventory shortages. She wants to resupply herself and is asking WAGES for her first loan, which will enable her to buy five bags of candy, five boxes of canned tomatoes, four boxes of OMO detergent, six boxes of couscous, and various other items. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Chester Misael

texts.es: El señor Chester Misael Ríos , tiene la edad de 31 años , habita en el barrio la porcina , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen su cargo dos hijos , uno de diez que actualmente estudia y una niña de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para poder darle un mejor bienestar , don Chester desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los cual le afectado enormemente ya que su cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesaR. lo cual provoca un cultivo con pocas fuerzas. Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder obtener mejores resultados y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Chester Misael Ríos is 31-years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Porcina (The Pig), located in Ticuantepe municipality, along with his wife, who works as a merchant to help him with household expenses. They are responsible for their two children, a 10-year old boy who is in school and a 3-year old little girl. His plan for his family is to improve the family's living conditions to provide better well-being. Chester has worked in agriculture for 10 years; his greatest difficulty is the lack of financing which affects him immensely. His farm already lacks fertilizer and other necessary supplies, causing weak yields. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizer to obtain better crops which he can sell for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a member of the Immaculada Concepción Village Bank and lives in the small Peruvian jungle town of Pilcopata, about eight hours from the city of Cusco. She is 53 years old and married with three children, one of whom still lives at home. Maxima brings rice and fruit (pineapples, bananas, papayas, oranges, mandarins and yuccas) from her town to the city of Huancarani (several hours away) to sell. She has been selling fruit for the past three years. She travels from Pilcopata to Huancarani each Sunday with her boxes of fruit and bags of rice, which she sells from a kiosk she owns in the Huancarani market. 

Maxima is requesting a loan of 3000 soles. She plans to use most of the money to buy pineapples. She will sell each pineapple for 3.50 to 4 soles, depending on the size. Maxima has been a member of her village bank for the past three years, and has always been a very responsible client. She has pledged to repay this loan in full and on time. 

Maxima recently achieved an important goal she had set for herself! She just finished building her own home.

loans.use: Buy pineapples

loans.name: Bedzrah

texts.fr: Bedzrah K. est un jeune homme de 27 ans, marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est tailleur depuis 3 ans à Lomé. Bedzrah souhaite avec ce crédit améliorer les ses prestations pour mieux servir sa clientèle. Elle désire acheter deux machine à coudre ; en plus il souhaite exercer le commerce des tissus ce qui permettra à ses clients la facilité dans le choix des tissus à confectionner.
texts.en:
Bedzrah K. is a young man of 27, married and the father of a little boy. He has been a tailor for three years in Lomé. Bedzrah hopes to use this loan to improve his services so that he can better satisfy his clientele. He wants to buy two sewing machines. Moreover, he wants to go into selling cloth which will make it easier for his clients to choose the fabrics they want to have made up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 2 sewing machines and cloth for resale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is fifty-six years old. She is married with six children. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers.

Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Oisha

texts.en:
For the past 3 years, Oisha has had her own business selling traditional dresses for women in the market. She has been a tailor for many years and together with the help of her daughter (pictured), Oisha sews and then sells the traditional women's dresses in the market. She started her own business because she knew it would bring in good returns. Not only does it help meet the needs of herself and her husband, but she is also able to help her parents and her grandchildren financially. Oisha is requesting a loan to help purchase new inventory in order to fill all her orders from her buyers.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  new traditional dresses for women

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Doña Sandra Maria Guzmán, es una mujer trabajadora que  desde muy joven ha ayudado a su mama a trabajar,  para salir adelante en la alimentación,  su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno, anteriormente planchaba y lavaba ajeno. Tiene 40 años de edad, reside en Lomas del Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo ayuda en los gastos y su hija también la apoya ya que ella trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa. Con este préstamo va  a comprar materiales de construcción para  construir el porche de su casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones con su familia ya que todos nos esforzamos por lograr las mejoras. Da las gracias  a la institución por el apoyo a travéz de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a working woman. From the time she was little, she has helped her mother with her work so that they could have sufficient food. Her business is selling baked goods. Before this she ironed and took in laundry. She is 40 years old and lives in “Lomas del Memorial Sandino” in the capital of Managua. Her husband helps with the expenses and her daughter does also. Her daughter works in a private home as a housekeeper. Her goal is to finish building her house. With this loan she will buy construction materials to be used to build a porch so that her family can live in better conditions. All of us work to better our lives. She is thankful to the institution for their support in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch.

loans.name: Genoveva Soledad

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Genoveva es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 1 hija, Genoveva tiene una cebicheria en su casa actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener un puesto y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Las Golondrinas ("The Swallows") Community Bank. She cohabits, is 44 years old and has 1 daughter. She has a cevicheria in her house, a responsibility that she dedicates herself to every morning. Genoveva needs a loan of $225 which will be invested in the purchase of plates. Her dreams are to have a street stand and improve her health.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of plates

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
A man with strong determination.  This is the phrase that best describes Arnel B. of Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  He is now 30 years old, single and a graduate of a vocational course. He works as a vendor and aims to improve his business in order to help his parents and uplift their living condition.  

To fulfill his dream for his parents, he would like to borrow a loan of 5,000 PHP from KIVA lenders.  This amount will be of great help in maintaining his street food vending.  Some of his product includes pork, chicken legs, chicken intestines and frozen chicken blood. He is hoping that the Kiva lenders will support his business because he really wants to improve it and become profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for street food vending.

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chocolate proviene del centro de la ciudad Masaya, formado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y de origen muy humilde que trabajan a diario para la mejora de las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Cecilia del Carmen M. L. de 39 años de edad trabaja en la compra y venta de artesanías como lo son: Marimbas, Sombreros y juguetes hechos artesanalmente. 

Compra los juguetes en Monimbó (ciudad destacada por su cultura artesanal) y los vende según la temporada y la demanda de estos. Su metaes construir una bodega para tener donde guardar sus productos ya que tiene que alquilar un local.

Luz P. vende lencería en la zona franca, y en su casa vende confites y galletas a los niños; Ángela O. hace dulces típicos y boquita (Crispetas churritos, palomitas, platanitos) que vende al por mayor a vendedores ambulantes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Chocolate” comes from the central area of the city of Masaya. The group consists of three women entrepreneurs of humble origins who work every day to improve the lives of their families.

Cecilia del Carmen M. L. is 39 years old. She buys and sells crafts such as marimbas, hats, and handmade toys. She buys the toys in Monimbó (a city known for its artisan culture) and sells them according to the season and the level of demand. Her goal is to build a store where she can sell her products instead of having to rent a vending space.

Luz P. sells lingerie in “La Zona Franca” (a designated area where merchandise is sold free of import duties or taxes). She also makes candy and cookies at home and sells them to the neighborhood children. Ángela O. makes traditional candy and snacks (fried dough, popcorn, and plantain chips) that she sells wholesale to street vendors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah B. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Hannah is a fishmonger. She goes to the sea, buys fish, smokes them, and then sells them at Elmina near Eselem.  This has been her business since 1984. Her husband is a fisherman.  Hannah uses her income to help pay the bills and the children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to process by smoking and then resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase to more fish to sell.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Tudela, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a business, selling gasoline in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $57 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Richel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Richel is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B. works in someone else's sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She is 40 years old, widowed and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. Narcisa has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Narcisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita A. is 56 years old and lives in Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is a widow who has been blessed with four children, all of them are graduated from college. All of her children are married and three are working abroad as factory workers.

Estelita is very proud to have responsible and hardworking children who have finished their studies and become successful, even though we are experiencing economic crisis. She is also proud of the many sacrifices she was made for her children.

Estelita has been managing a small business of peanut butter manufacturing and selling for almost 35 years. She wanted to improve her business to be able to gain more income. She is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy ingredients for her peanut butter business, as well as feeds and medicines for her hog raising business. Securing the loan will be a great help in meeting her daily needs and goals in life.

loans.use: additional capital to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her two children. Sahar has owned a grocery store since 2007. She sells canned food, candies, beverages and also fruits and vegetables. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Sahar has requested a loan. 

Sahar is special in her work because she does her best to suit her customers' needs. Her customers are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Sahar decided on doing her business because she needed to work after her divorce in order to be financially independent. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old, married and mother of three children who are in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Grace is a rice trader. She supplies rice to food vendors in her community.  Grace also treks to nearby towns to supply rice.  She buys bags of rice from nearby towns and has been in business for six years.  Grace wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so she can supply more customers.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Miguel Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Roberto G. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior préstamo el cual pudo comprar el equipo de cocer y rentar un lugar donde poner el negocio.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para invertir en telas y material para la elaboración de trajes y de vestidos de noche para damas. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Solicita su cooperación para poder compara la tela que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Roberto G. is grateful for the help obtained through his previous loan, which he used to buy sewing equipment and to rent a place for his business. He is asking for new funding to buy fabric and materials needed to make suits and ladies' evening gowns. However, at present, he lacks funds to do so. He is asking for help to buy fabric that he is being offered at a very good price but he does not want to decapitalize his business to buy it. He plans to repay the loan with part of his profits from his business, which is his family's sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius A. A. is thirty seven years old, is married and has four children. His business is located at Khayega, a busy market in Kakamega. He engages in selling fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for the last two years.

Julius’ major challenge has been that at times there is an excess supply which reducing demand and prices for his goods. However he is determined to expand his business and he is using his Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruits, onions and vegetables to sell.

Julius actually wants to become the biggest vegetable supplier in Khayega and also has a dream of building his own shop. He is a very hardworking and determined person who never gives up.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Meylin Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Meylin tiene el negocio de pulpería ella solicito el crédito para invertirlo en el negocio y así tener mas productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes esto para tener una mayor ganancia e ingresos para su familia, el negocio lo empezó con crédito pequeños y a si lo ha ido incrementando antes de tener el negocio la señora Meylin bordaba trajes típicos, es madre de cuatros niños y es por ellos que la señora desde horas muy tempranas esta atendiendo el negocio esto para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Meylin has a local convenience store. She is requesting a loan to invest into her business and be able to expand on her current stock and obtain a higher income for her family. Meylin started her business with few funds but little-by-little has managed to expand the business. Before starting the business of convenience store, Meylin embroidered traditional costumes. She is mother to four children and this is why Meylin gets up very early in the morning to attend to her business and therefore improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and ham.

loans.name: Yohana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El banco comunal Haciendo un mundo mejor está integrado por mujeres luchadoras, con una simpatía y carisma muy grande que al momento de las reuniones nos hacen sentir como en familia, todas viven  en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Yohana V.  vive en la urbe de la ciudad en el sector Don Bosco junto a su hermana compartiendo los gastos de  la casa, es oriunda de la provincia de Manabí  hace cinco años se radicaron en esta hermosa ciudad para estudiar y trabajar, es soltera tiene 23 años y trabaja como distribuidora dependiente de los productos Herbalife (productos naturales) en el que lleva  un año y medio, su horario de labores es de 09h00 a 17h30 nos comenta que le va bien  en su trabajo y se siente contenta por ello,  luego del trabajo va a la Universidad Católica de Cuenca  está cursando el segundo año de periodismo.

Es su primer ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal y se siente con mucho optimismo por el apoyo recibido  con el dinero de su crédito  comprará  vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios, proteínas y más productos  Herbalife para tener un stock variado para sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
The “Haciendo un Mundo Mejor” (Making a Better World) communal bank is made up of tenacious, agreeable and charismatic women who, during meetings, make us all feel as if we were one big family. They are all residents of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. It is situated in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is the third most important city of Ecuador and it is characterized for maintaining the tranquility and beauty of an old city. Its historical city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. Yohana V. lives in greater Cuenca in the Don Bosco sector with her sister; they share household expenses. She is originally from Manabí province but moved to this lovely city five years ago to study and work. She is single, 23 years old, and works as an independent Herbalife (natural products) distributor. She has had this job for a year and a half. Her work day starts at 9am and ends at 5:30pm. She tells us that she does well in her work and feels proud because of that. After work, she goes to classes at Catholic University of Cuenca; she’s in her second year, majoring in Journalism. This is her first loan cycle with her communal bank and she is very optimistic about the help she’s gotten. She will use the funds to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, proteins and other Herbalife products to have varied stock available for her customers. Her greatest dream is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, Herbalife protein.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma B. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Elma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elma operates a business venture doing massage services for local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elma decided to request a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Rene Hilario

texts.es: René Hilario tiene  50 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, Don René inicio este negocio como chofer de un camión de transporte y lo que le pagaban lo conservaba ya que sus intenciones eran las de comprar un carro y lo ocuparía para dar los servicios de taxi ya que este sería el medio de trabajo que utilizaría para mantener a su familia. Es así que lo logra, actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo es para mejorar su carro y ofrecer un mejor servicio. El sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
René Hilario is 50 years old, and has a child in his care. He has been working with the Fundación for quite some time. He has a business providing taxi services. René started this business by working as a truck driver, and he saved from his earnings. He wanted to buy a car to use to provide taxi services, as this line of work would allow him to support his family. In this way he achieved his business. He currently requests a loan for working capital to improve his car and provide better service. His dream is to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for auto maintenance

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 30 years old and married with one child. He sells spare parts in Nairobi to earn a living. He has four years of experience. He was previously in a craftsmanship business before he ventured into this business.

Lawrence joined a group in Faulu Kenya called "Minds together," where he saves part of his profits and the group guarantees loans. He appreciates the training that Faulu Kenya offered him together with his group members because he has learned to minimize running costs. He hopes to buy vehicles for hire and improve his living standard in the future. He has requested for a loan of kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan de l’association Belle étoile est composé de 4 femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI). Les membres du groupe Benkan vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, se sont connues à travers le voisinage et  la  parenté et ont en moyenne 43 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe Benkan ont intégré le programme de Soro Yiriwaso depuis plusieurs années et sont à  leur 8  prêt de groupe. 
Elles font le commerce de tissus, de condiments alimentaires et de  produits cosmétiques tels Agnès C..
Quant à l’utilisation du prêt, Agnès C. qui est une vendeuse de produits cosmétiques au grand marché de San, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter à Bamako et en gros, 25 cartons de parfums de tous genres, 10cartons de mèches, 3cartons de crèmes Caro White, 3 douzaines de déodorants  OE et beaucoup d’autres articles pour la bonne marche de sa boutique. Elle revend en détail, au comptant et souvent  à crédit. 
Tandis que Agnès C. espère réaliser un bénéfice de 45000FCFA par mois les autres membres envisagent obtenir 36 000FCFA. 
Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses familiales et réinvestir dans les entreprises.
texts.en:
The Benkan group of the Beautiful Star association is composed of four married women from the city of San, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members of the Benkan group live in large traditional families and came to know each other through relatives and neighbors. On average, these women are 43 years of age and have six children. The women of the Benkan group have been involved in the Soro Yiriwaso program for many years and are taking out their eighth group loan. They sell fabric, food condiments and cosmetics. Agnès C., who is a cosmetic retailer at the San market, plans to use the loan to purchase at Bamako and in wholesale, 25 boxes of all types of perfumes, 10 boxes of hair extensions, three boxes of Caro White creams, three dozen OE deodorants and many other items to sell at her shop. She sells retail, by cash and often by credit. While Agnès C. expects to receive earnings of 45 000 XOF per month, the other group members expect to receive 36 000 XOF. The earnings will be used to help meet family expenses and reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn D. is from the city of Divisoria, Santiago. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Genalyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Genalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Genalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Self Help Plumkor Group

texts.en:
Ndorbor K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Self Help Plumkor". He is 57 years old, married and has six children who range in age from 19 to 27 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. All of his children are in school and he also cares for three siblings.

For 30 years, Ndorbor K. has been making and selling furniture in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 30,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 106,000 LRD group loan to buy more wood and make more furniture. His dream is to expand his business and, in the future, to be able to export timber to America.

loans.use: To buy more wood and make more furniture

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Bawah G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Help the Poor.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children who range from 5 to 20 years old.  Bawah was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to a lack of financial support. 

For four years, Bawah has been selling tomatoes, oil, rice, onions and pepper in the Plumkor community, Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with 500 LRD and now has 9,000 LRD in working capital!

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 42,000 Liberian dollars group loan to buy more tomatoes, rice, oil, pepper and onions.  She describes herself as an honest person.

Her goal is to improve her business to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more tomatoes, rice, gallons of oil, more pepper and onions.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby O. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns and operates a business buying and selling different vegetables in the local community. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ruby joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Madelin is the coordinator of her group, El Sol sale para Todos 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge right now is improving her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to sew.

Madelin is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 6 years, starting with some savings and Esperanza's loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling goods in her cafeteria: a place where people can have snacks like juices, cookies, sandwiches and groceries. She is also a tailor and makes household items like curtains and blankets. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She wants to have a successful business. 

This Esperanza associate began working with this group because they were looking for a loan and a friend talked about Esperanza. So, the group from this community joined. Madelin's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedding, cookies and food for resale

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar H. has always distinguished himself as a very hard working person, devoted to his family, who are his role models. Ilqar has managed his own business, a grocery store, for the last 10 years.

Thanks to his business, Ilqar has been able to help his family. Today, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 AZN. He needs you, and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his three children.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Ten people are members of this village bank loan. Mrs. Sarim C., born in 1979, was elected as the village bank president by its members located in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sarim C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chy Ros, is a fisherman and also an ice-cream seller in the local village. Between them, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. Sarim C. will use the loan to pay for farm laborers to plow her field and to purchase fishing nets for her husband. The couple has two children, who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To pay for farm laborers to plow her field

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya B. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two children, aged 18 and 20, are students who currently live and study in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband Batsaihan runs a farming business, while Tuya operates a business selling religious items at the local market. They started both businesses in 2007. After years of successful operations, Tuya has managed to increase her working capital of religious items to over 1,000,000 MNT today. For the farming business, they plant various types of vegetables and crops on their own 7 hectares of land. Specifically, they plant wheat on 2 hectares of their land and grass on 5 hectares. They usually harvest 10 tons of variety of vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and beets, and sell these products within 10 to 12 months. For the future, they are planning to hire a new employee for their family business. Tuya is a very hardworking person and says, “All I want is to change my small agriculture business into a big farm." She is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more fuel for a truck that is used as a transportation vehicle for their products.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for agricultural transport

loans.name: Salam

texts.ar: سلام رجل متزوج يبلغ من العمر 32 عاماً اب لولدين، يعمل نجار منذ عشر سنوات. سبق لسلام ان تعامل لمدة عامين مع المجموعة، وكان تاريخه الإقتراضي جيد جداً. بالإضافة إلى ان للقرض كان تأثير جيد على إنتاجية العمل وتحسين الوضع العائلي، وزيادة السيولة النقدية لديه. مصداقيته وضميره في العمل هما ورقته الرابحة امام المنافسين. يتقدم سلام بطلب قرض من المجموعة، وذلك لشراء عدة جديدة وحديثة الطراز لتسهيل عمله، بالإضافة إلى كمبراسور هواء (AIR COMPRESSOR). يامل سلام ذات يوم إنشاء عمل متكامل متطور.
texts.en: Salam is a 32-year-old husband and father of two who has been working as a carpenter for the last ten years. Salam enjoys a very good credit history with A. Majmoua, having previously worked with the institution over a two-year period. The last loan significantly increased the productivity of his work and the liquidity of his assets, overall improving his family situation. It is his credibility and scrupulousness which have given him an edge over his competitors. Salam is now applying for a loan to purchase up-to-date equipment as well as an air compressor to mitigate his workload and to further his goA. of developing a more integrated and advanced work operation.

loans.use: Purchase up-to-date equipment and an air compressor

loans.name: Gloria Sebastian

texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Nanchoc in the region of Cajamarca. Nanchoc is a rural area in the mountains of northern Peru.

Gloria raises animals in order to earn additional income for the family. She purchases animals when they are young and then cares for them until they reach an appropriate size to be sold either for meat or for other purposes on other farms. Gloria has been involved in this business for over 10 years and is well known in the region.

Gloria has taken out loans from Edpyme Alternativa previously. She has a good record of repayment. She plans to use this current loan to continue to expand her business by purchasing additional animals and feed. The loan will be in the amount of S/. 1,000.00.

loans.use: Purchasing additional animals and feed

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy M. is from the town of Banga. He is 42 years old and single. Rudy is a farmer. He tills his land to plant rice and corn crops. Rudy helps his family financially and he is happy he has the farm from which he gets an income. Rudy also raises chickens and ducks. He sells the eggs to the market.

Rudy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Doris Ama

texts.en: Doris Ama D. sells smoked and fried fish at Abura. She is married and has three children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase a shop.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Gustavo Alexander

texts.es: Gustavo Alexander C. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa y un hijo menor de edad.  José es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, quien posee un taller de reparación de bicicletas, así mismo vende repuestos para estos, como también accesorios tales como: focos, espejo y otros más. José tiene 15 años de experiencia y es muy conocido en su lugar de habitación por brindar un excelente servicio. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar: llantas de repuesto, bombas de aire, asientos, rines y accesorios para bicicletas, todo lo que sea necesario para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gustavo Alexander C. is 42 years old.  He lives in Usulután department together with his wife and one dependent child.  Gustavo is a very responsible and hard-working person who owns a bicycle repair shop.  He also sells spare parts for bikes as well as other accessories such as headlights, mirrors, etc.  Gustavo has 15 years of experience and is very well known in his area because he provides an excellent service.

Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy spare tires, air pumps, seats, wheels and other accessories, everything which he needs to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories for bicycles

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
For the past four years, Uktam K. has worked in agriculture, raising cattle. With the income earned from this endeavor, he can cover his household expenses. Uktam's cattle require vaccinations against various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. For Uktam, it is very important to work raising his animals, which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. The additional cattle will help his family generate additional income. Uktam appreciates your support for his project.      

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es:
Aditza es una pequeña comerciante de venta de ropa interior, desde hace varios años, logro invertir en ropa, Ventas que hace ambulante, y que gracias a su empeño y apoyo de la institución ha incrementado la variedad de sus ventas. Trabajo que hace para apoyar  a su familia.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora en servicios de seguridad. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: bóxer de varón y mujer, viquines, blúmer de niña, cosméticos, licras, entre otros productos que ayuden a aumentar sus ganancias.
Hoy en día está contenta porque gracias a los financiamientos, sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Aditza is a small businesswoman who sells underwear.  She has been selling clothes for several years.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and, thanks to her hard work and the support of our institution, she has increased the range of her sales.  She works to support her family.  Aditza has the support of her husband who works in security services.

Aditza will use this new loan to buy men's boxer shorts, women's boy shorts, bikinis, girls' underpants, cosmetics, leggings and other products that will help to increase her profits.

Aditza is happy because, thanks to these loans, her sales levels have risen as she has been able to offer a greater variety of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy a variety of underwear, cosmetics and costume jewelry to improve her sales

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
Eight members are forming this village bank loan. They are located in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. The members of this group selected Mrs. Chhay K., a 36-year-old married woman, as the village bank president.  The members of this group loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different needs. 

Mrs. Chhay K. earns her living by selling grocery in the local village. With this business, she earns a little income to improve her family.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Chum RaT., is 36 years old.  He owns a battery charging machine and offers this service to villagers who have no access to electricity. With both their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their four children: three are attending the local school and the youngest one is 1 year old.

loans.use: To buy more grocery to enlarge business

loans.name: Dana

texts.es: La Sr. Dana Vive en el municipio de la guardia,  es nacida en el departamento del  Beni, capital ganadera de Bolivia, su esposo con el cual tiene un hijo trabaja como guardia de seguridad,  ella hace unos 12 año que se dedica a la venta de ropa, de forma ambulante; el destino del crédito es para terminar de cancelar un lote de terreno, donde mas adelante construirán su domicilio,  ya que este es su deseo ver su casita terminada, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Dana lives in the municipality of La Guardia and was born in the department of Beni, the cattle-raising capital of Bolivia.  Her husband, with whom she has a son, works as a security guard.  Dana has for some 12 years now been dedicated to selling clothes in the streets.

The loan is to finish paying for an urban lot where, later, they will build their home.  It is their desire to see their house finished.  Dana is a very hard-working person and she has agreed with the institution's terms for the help it is offering.
