loans.use: TO PAY OFF AN URBAN LOT ON WHICH TO BUILD THEIR HOME

loans.name: Irean

texts.en:
Irean W. is married and has 2 children. She has been through junior high school. Irean is a teacher and she also sells provisions at Abbrem Agona near Abura, which she has been doing for 8 years. Her husband is a pastor. Irean uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the children.  Irean will use the loan to purchase more provisions to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Irean plans to build a shop. 
In this picture, Irean is holding in her hand some toffees and biscuits.

loans.use: Irean will use the loan to purchase more provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Bwijenje Twetungure Group A- Rukungiri

texts.en: Frigensi K. is the leader of Bwijenje Twetungure Group A- Rukungiri. He is 39 years old and married, with 4 children, aged 10, 9, 7 and 5 years. Frigensi has been selling produce, which includes maize, coffee and millet, from Mushonga Trading Centre for over 10 years.  He works with his wife. He sells most of the coffee to Rukungiri coffee factory.  Hence, he has a ready market and he is able to make an average of 250,000UGX as monthly profits. He is also involved in the sale of alcohol,  and he has a banana plantation from which he sells matooke. Frigensi has been a hard-working farmer for a long time and he hopes to be a model farmer in his area. He needs a loan to be able to buy more maize, millet and coffee for increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more maize, millet and coffee for increased stock.

loans.name: Duo Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
Duo torre Fuerte: Iris del Rosario, es de 20 años de edad tiene un hijo se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario,solicita este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir mas su tienda de productos comestibeles ya que nececita de mas capital para trabajar y asi aumentar mas sus ganancias.
Luz Adelaida,tiene 20 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de usada desde hace 1 años se dedica a ese negocio ella dice que nececita su credito para la compra de una paca de ropa y asi poder surtir mas su negocio para tener mas bariedad en estilos  tanto para dama como para caballero y niños.
texts.en:
Strong Tower Duo

Iris del Rosario is 20 years old and has one child.  She sells everyday food products.  Iris is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to restock her food store.  She needs more operating capital to help increase her earnings.

Luz Adelaida is 20 years old.  She has been selling used clothing for one year.  Luz says she needs a loan to buy one bale of clothing so that she can restock her business and provide a greater variety of styles for women, men, and children.

loans.use: To purchase basic food products to sell.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es:
Edgar Manuel V. R., es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, esta graduado como profesional, se dedica a cortar cabello, tiene ya 10 años con su negocio, nició siendo trabajado para otra barberia, pero actualmente cuneta con su propio negocio. 

Quiere apertura otra barberia, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar
texts.en: Edgar is 26 years old and single.  He graduated from a professional school and works as a barber.  He has been doing this work for 10 years and would now like to open another barber shop.  He is requesting the loan to grow his business.

loans.use: To invest in a second barber shop and grow his business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri; es una mujer alegre y laboriosa convive con Edgar y fruto de esa relación tienen 02 hijas, Luz de 11 años y Britney de 09 años y juntos viven en su propia casa en el distrito de Quimbiri. Rosa estudio cosmetología en la ciudad de lima, su pasión por los cortes lo llevó a tener su propio Salón de belleza en la ciudad de Quimbiri, donde viene prestando servicios al público durante 03 años. Su centro de belleza es muy concurrido, ya que realiza diversos modelos de cortes, peinados, manicure y pedicure; es así que empieza desde las 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche y tiene mayor demanda de su trabajo durante los meses de noviembre y diciembre; por que son fechas donde se realizan fiestas de promoción de distintos centros educativos, razón por la cual ella tiene que  contratar  personal para que le brinden el apoyo con los distintos cortes, peinados y maquillajes. Se siente muy comprometida con su labor; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta de la preferencia por parte de su clientela, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por su servicio prestado. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de implementos y mostradores para su local. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es abrir otra sucursal en el distrito de San Francisco por contar con mayor preferencia por parte del público. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por poner ordenanza al grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará lo necesario para su negocio y a la vez vitrinas donde pueda exhibir cosméticos y otros productos similares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and from the city of Quimbiri.  She is cheerful and hard-working and lives with her partner, Edgar.  They have two daughters, Luz, 11, and Britney, 9, and all live together in their own home in the Quimbiri District.  Rosa studied cosmetology in Lima.  Her passion for cutting hair was the reason for setting up her own beauty salon in Quimbiri, where she has been in business for three years.  Her salon is very popular since she offers different cuts, hairstyles, manicures and pedicures.  She works from 7:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. with the busiest time being during the months of November and December when graduations are taking place at schools.  During these months she has to hire more personnel to help with haircuts, styling and make-up.  

She is very dedicated to her job and, thanks to her hard work, her salon is preferred by many of her customers, which gives her a better income.

The loan is to buy supplies and display cases for her salon.  Her top priority is to open another salon in the San Francisco District so she can become even more popular.  This is her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time because she wants to receive another one in the future.  She is very respected in her communal bank because she is so organized.  With the 2,000 PEN she plans to buy beauty salon supplies and display cases to display cosmetics and other products.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies and display cases

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene su propio negocio, una pulpería con varios años en las ventas, en donde ha logrado la captación de clientes y variar los productos gracias a los préstamos que Afodenic ah otorgado durante varios créditos.
Lo cual para ella ha sido de mucho beneficio ya que ha equilibrado su pequeña pulpería, así como la compra de varios productos en medicamentos, cosméticos, entre otros.
El cuarenta por ciento da al crédito, de quincena a clientes responsables, ya que tiene que cumplir con un plan de pago a si como otros compromisos de pagos en la familia de sus cuatros hijos, e esposo el cual se dedica al comercio también en la venta, de quesos, leche agria, cuajada, cremas que ayudan a mejorar el pan de cada día de las familias nicaragüenses.
Lo que comprara con este préstamo es granos básicos, productos de aseo personal, gaseosas, productos enlatados para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria has her own grocery store which she has been running for several years and achieved a good customer base and wide range of products thanks to several Afodenic loans she has received.

The loans have been very helpful in allowing her to offer all sorts of products, including medicine and cosmetics.

Her income is used to pay off the loan and to give credit to responsible customers.  She also has to make payment on commitments she has with a family of four children.  Her husband sells cheese, sour cream, cottage cheese and cream which help Nicaraguan families put more nutritious food on their tables.

She plans to use the loan to buy basic grains, personal care products, sodas and canned goods for customer satisfaction.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sodas and canned products to offer more to her customers

loans.name: Goya

texts.es:
Goya nació en la comunidad de Vilcabamba del distrito de Caicay de provincia  de la Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años edad y tiene cuatro hijos, actualmente ella vive en la comunidad donde nació. 

Su actividad económica principal Goya es la agricultura y ganadería. Goya tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas de doble pechuga. Goya tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.  Con su próximo préstamo, Goya una parte del crédito lo utilizara para comprar gallinas y para aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda de abarrotes.

Goya pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Goya was born in the community of Vilcabamba in the Caicay district of Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco.  She is 40 years old and has 4 children.  She is now living in the community where she was born.

Goya's main economic activity is farming and livestock.  She has some lands where she cultivates potatoes and corn, and she also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and broiler hens.  Goya also has a grocery store where she sells food such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products.  She will use part of this loan to buy hens and the other part to increase her working capital in her grocery store.  

Goya belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha del Carmen," in the Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank is in its third year of operation, and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy hens and also to increase the working capital in her grocery store business

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 56 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura tiene 10 cuadras de terreno siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 10 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas ganado y tener porterías.

Le gusta hacer deporte, festejar las fiestas de San Pedro y carnaval.
texts.en:
Ángel, 56, is married living with his wife and unmarried children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 7 children.

The “GRUPO PUCARA” communal bank is located in the community of Pucara in Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 15 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  This communal bank has 22 members who are farmers, raise livestock and sell vegetables.

Ángel is a farmer.  Her has 10 “cuadras” (1 cuadra = 275 feet approx.) of farmland where he grows potatoes, wheat and corn.  He also has ten head of cattle.  His purchases take place in the market in Guaranda and sales at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies and animal feed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and variations in the weather.  His dream is to buy more cattle and to have pig sties.

He enjoys playing sports, celebrating the feast day of St. Peter and Carnival.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Misperos Group

texts.es:
El Señor Sixto es casado, tiene 40 años D. edad, cursó los 5 años D. educación primaria. tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, inicio este oficio a traves D. la crianza D. pollos, y al momento cuenta con 10 años D. experiencia. 

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar cerdos y toros para crianza, las demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: crianza D. animales, amarre D. hilo. En el futuro queren ver su negocio mas amplio.
texts.en:
Sixto, 40, is married.  He finished fifth graD..  He has five children one of which is studying.   He raises animals.  He started this occupation raising chickens and he now has ten years experience.

He decided to form a group to request a loan that will be used to buy pigs and bulls to raise.  The other group members are in a variety of occupations: animal raising, weaving.  In the future, they’d like to see their business grow.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Siempre Juntos Group

texts.es: El grupo esta compuesto por 8 personas  de las cuales la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesto de la siguiente manera: la presidenta es la Sra. Laura vive en casa familiar de la madre  en la zona de sacaba vive junto a sus 3 hijos, la mencionada señora es  buena líder y se dedica a la venta ropa y otros ambulando por las distintas zonas de sacaba, y también en los mercados, es una persona muy trabajadora y el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de invierno, como chompas y sacones ya que se esta acercando la época de frio y muchas de sus clientes ya le hacen pedido de estas prendas de vestir, la Sra. Laura esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The group is comprised of eight people. Among them, the board of directors in arranged such that the president is Laura. She lives in her mother's home in the Sacaba zone. She lives with her three children. She is a good leader and does traveling sales of clothes and other items. She goes throughout the Sacaba zone as well as to the markets. She is a very hardworking person, and she will use the money from this loan to purchase winter clothes, such as sweaters and jackets since the cold season is coming and many customers have ordered these items. Laura is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes

loans.name: Yao Eric

texts.fr: Yao a 33ans. Il est chauffeur de profession et répare des voitures. Il est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des outils de travail. Il s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils ont trois enfants .Eric a pour objectif premier d’apporter une meilleure condition de vie sociale  à sa famille.
texts.en: Yao Eric is 33 years old. He is a driver by profession and repairs cars. This is his first loan and he is seeking this sum in order to buy tools for his work. He gets his supplies at the independent port in Lomé. His wife is a retailer and they have three children. Yao Eric's primary objective is to improve the social circumstances of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for vehicle repair

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana Luisa tiene 50 años, es soltera vive sola no tiene hijos, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C DIVINO NIÑO, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, está constituida por 10 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maíz y plátano, además se dedican a la comercialización de granos secos.


Ana Luisa  se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, además se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es llegar a tener dinero.

Le gusta ser una persona trabajadora y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is 50 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in El Progreso, in Chillanes canton.

The 'DIVINO NIÑO' community bank is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  It has ten members and this is the third loan that they have requested from our organization.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cacao, corn and bananas.  They also sell dried grains.

Ana Luisa is a farmer who grows cacao, corn, bananas, soy and cassava.  She also raises birds.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes her sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help Ana Luisa to buy supplies and fertilizers.  Her loans have helped her to increase her crop production.  She has faced challenges such as illnesses amongst her workers, pest infestations and plant diseases.  Her dream is to have money.

Ana Luisa enjoys being a hard-working person and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is in rice farming and hog-raising businesses. She is 45 years old and is a married woman with two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Juvy helps her husband till their land located in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops and vegetables. They also own a "carabao" (water buffalo) that helps in tilling the land. Juvy raises her pigs in their backyard. She sells the pigs at the market.

Juvy is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pigs. She hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children’s college education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en:
Pet, 62 years old, is a grocer. Her husband is a carpenter, and together their income is $15 a day. She has one child who is a construction worker. Every month, she has to spend $79 on food and $20 on other expenses.

Pet is requesting a loan of $700 to buy additional groceries to sell. In the future, she wants to sell gasoline and sugarcane juice in front of her house, so she can make income from three different sources at the same time.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer emprendedora de 33 años, quien está felizmente casada con Johan, su esposo, con quien tiene 4 hermosos hijos, está familia  vive en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Cada viernes desde tempranas horas ella, sitúa su carpa frente a los servicios higiénicos públicos que están ubicados en una zona estratégica de la feria que se desarrolla en su ciudad. En este espacio vende ropas interiores, polos y pantalones a la vez que está encargada de los sanitarios, labor que desarrolla hace tres años con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta es conocer nuevos clientes y recomendar las prendas de acuerdo al tamaño y la edad pero, confiesa que a veces cuando no vende lo que espera se siente decepcionada sin embargo sigue luchando ya que siempre vende algo sin que haya perdido la inversión, por eso considera rentable sus actividades pues vive cómodamente gracias a las utilidades que percibe. Para su futuro desea incrementar la cantidad de mercadería ya que no desea tener una tienda ni un lugar estable porque considera que en las ferias obtiene más beneficios económicos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Gotitas de rocío” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se muestra muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que desempeña, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Lucia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en comprar medias, ropas interiores, shampoo, papel higiénico, jabón, entre otros implementos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia is an enterprising woman who is 33 years of age. She is happily married to her husband Johan and they have four beautiful children. Her family lives in their own home in the city of San Ramón, which is located in the central Peruvian jungle. Every Friday during the early morning hours, she sets up a tent in front of the public toilets that are located in a strategic area of the fair that takes place in her city. In this space, Lucia sells undergarments, polo shirts, and trousers since she is also in charge of sanitation. She has operated this business for three years with the help of her children. What she enjoys most is getting to know new customers and recommending clothes for them according to size and age. However, she admits that sometimes she feels disappointed when she does not sell much. Nonetheless she continues to press forward and is always able to sell something without losing any of her investment. For this reason, she considers her business activities to be profitable since they allow her to live comfortably because of the profits they generate. In the future, she hopes to increase the quantity of merchandise in her inventory because she wants to have a store in a stable place. She considers the fairs to be the most profitable locations.

Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Rocío” (Little Dewdrops) and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very excited about the work that her group has accomplished. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the support she will receive, Lucia plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of socks, undergarments, shampoo, toilet paper, soap, and other items that her customers have requested.

loans.use: to purchase socks, undergarments, shampoo, toilet paper, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Victor; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor del nivel primario, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, yeso y clavos para que termine de construir su casa.
 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qorimancacha communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Víctor, 50, who is married with one child.  He alternates his daily activities with his job as an elementary school teacher, working from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  He supports his child with this job.

Víctor wants to expand and improve his house.  He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, plaster, and nails to finish building his house.

Víctor is happy about the loan and is committed to covering the payments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, plaster, and nails to finish building his house.

loans.name: Zuhriya

texts.en:
Zuhriya is a 41-year-old married woman who has seven sons and seven daughters. She lives in Aneen village, near Jenin city in Palestine. Zuhriya and her family have a grocery store and she wants to purchase more groceries so that she has more stock to sell. In this way, she hopes to improve the family income. The family has another source of income from agriculture. 
Zuhriya has some money, but it is not enough, so she wants to take a loan of $700 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Zuhriya takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more groceries and have a better variety of stock to sell. She will then be able to share in improving the family income and live in better conditions. 
Zuhriya is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is 30 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. Her husband is a police officer. 

Nema has a business of selling simsim (sesame seeds), ground nuts, and sugar in Jigomoni, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Nema is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase more ground nuts and simsim. She will use the profits to buy goats and chickens in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more simsim, ground nuts, and sugar.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina  49 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañero D. vida y su hija la cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. deliciosas tortillas. Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha y espera seguir manteniéndolo activo ya que es su principal fuente D. ingresos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja día con día con mucha dedicación para algún día poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que Guillermina se caracteriza por ser una mujer  trabajadora y responsable, además los clientes están satisfechos con las ricas tortillas que elabora día con día. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. la materia prima necesaria (maíz, agua, gas propano, etc.)  Para la elaboración D. las ricas tortillas. No pierD. las esperanzas D. lograr su sueño D. mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 49 years old and lives in her own home together with her family: her life partner and her daughter who is in school.  Guillermina makes and sells delicious tortillas.  She has been in this business for many years and, thanks to God and her own hard work, she has managed to keep her business running.  She hopes to keep her business active as it is her main source of income.  Guillermina's family are the most important thing in her life and they are why she works hard every day, so that some day she can offer them a better quality of life.  Many people are loyal to her business because she is a hard-working and responsible woman.  In addition, her customers are happy with the delicious tortillas that she makes every day.

Guillermina took the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying the supplies she needs (corn, water, propane gas, etc.) to make her delicious tortillas.  She doesn't lose hope of one day fulfilling her dream of improving her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Marisacal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS MARISCAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Paulina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, tejido de aguayos, tejido de chompas y mantas, venta de coca.

La señora Paulina,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescados que viene trabajando hace seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pescados) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo venderá en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Rosas Mariscal” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Paulina.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have fish sales, multicolored cloth weaving, blanket and sweater weaving and coca leaf sales.

Paulina indicates that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer and that she joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She has been selling fish for the last six years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy fish in the local markets and then sell it in her sales point.  This way of working makes it possible for her to earn resources to support her family since she’s married and has six children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mohamad Hussein

texts.en: M. Hussein is 18 years old and lives at home with his parents and one sibling. Unlike other people his age, he wasn’t able to continue his education because of his parent’s poverty. He is taking responsibility for his life and has started to work on his own. Today, he is the proud owner of a motorcycle repair shop. He is applying for a loan for $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen to buy mechanical supplies for his business so that he can improve his ability to serve his customers. In the future, he plans to continue to expand his business by buying more spare parts.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man with six school-going children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Tsuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of inadequate capital to expand his business. He aspires to become a vegetable supplier in his town.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase vegetables like onions, tomatoes and others for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps low-income earners by giving them loans to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables like onions, tomatoes and others for resale.

loans.name: Furaha B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Furaha B Group in Western Kenya! Francis is the facilitator of the Furaha B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed the family and have additional maize profits to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in business.

 In 2012, the members of Furaha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Francis is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez is 29 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past ten years, Perez has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Perez has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products for resale and will help Perez to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Perez hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch. 

Perez is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Perez who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Faaniniva

texts.en:
Faaniniva is 36 years old and is married with 8 children.

Faaniniva owns and operates a business; raising cattle for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Faaniniva needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in the expansion of her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Faaniniva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faaniniva's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in the expansion of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, diapers, and other personal care products

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Ailene is married and has two adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Ailene owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of foods in the local community. Ailene has been in her business for two years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ailene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. In 2011, Ailene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Ilema Group

texts.fr: Agriculteur de profession, Monsieur samilou vit avec sa femme cultivatrice et leurs 02 enfants à SOKODE. Il est âgé de 28ans. Son premier enfant a 4ans et le dernier 02 mois. C’est en 2009 qu’il est dans ce domaine. Il veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et rendre pérenne son activité c’est pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif. Elle voudrait épargner, assurer la santé  et scolarisation des enfants. Monsieur samilou est le responsable de leur groupement constitué que de femmes et d’hommes tous dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Ils  espèrent avec ce crédit réaliser des bénéfices et voir leurs familles s’épanouir.
texts.en:
A farmer by trade, Samilou lives with this wife, also a farmer, and their two children in Sokode. He is 28 years old. His oldest child is four years old and his youngest is two months old. He started farming in 2009. 

He wants to increase his income to make his farming sustainable. It is for this reason that he asked WAGES for his first loan.

She wants to save money to ensure their children's health and schooling. 

Samilou is responsible for this group of women and men, all who work in farming. They hope with this loan to make profits and see their families grow.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: A resident from Banteay Meanchey province, Nary is a married mother of six children. To secure the need in her family, rice cropping on three hectares of farmland and her paid-working are the main source of income for her business, which generates her about 22,200 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Nary with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan with success and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, in group of two, she is leader. She will spend her entire loan portion in order to buy fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nicolae

texts.en: Nicolae, together with his family of four, grows vegetables for a living. Thanks to a self-constructed greenhouse, he begins seeding tomatoes and cucumbers early in the year for a first harvest in late May. The competitive advantage gained from the timing is supplemented by a convenient location, close to three different regional markets. Some of the seedlings are kept and planted in the fields for a second crop later in the year. Nicolae would like to build two more greenhouses, a large one to be used exclusively for tomatoes, and a smaller one for raising seedlings. For this he needs construction materials, including wood, plastic and accessories.

loans.use: Greenhouse Construction

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is very energetic and is experienced in selling her products. She used to be shopkeeper for one of the supermarkets, and has always dreamed of owning a shop. Her dream came true and she has had a grocery store for 6 years, with her 5th loan of $1,200 that was wisely spent on all her products. She is very happy with her business, and she works hard every day to give the best service to her customers and to keep her store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want. For this year 2007, she is thinking of increasing the variety of products so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Tigaina

texts.en: Tigaina has four children and they are all in school. She is one of the pancake sellers in the S. area. This is Tigaina’s daily job. Whether she makes pancakes in the evening or during the day, her inventory is all sold out.  Tigaina’s husband works and he also assists her when he can. As she explained, the loans from SPBD really helped with her children's school fees and school activities. She is looking for a new experience to start a new business with her next loan.

loans.use: To purchase flour, dripping, pots, baking powder, kitchen wares

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna G. has operated a socks and undergarment sales business in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine for twelve years. Enterprising and hardworking, Inna has succeeded in her business due to experience and a joyful spirit. With the profits of her business, she is supporting her parents and is sending her son, Vladimir, to the university. Inna has a perfect repayment history with Nadiya Ukraine. She is currently seeking a loan for $1000 to enlarge the assortment of her products and repair her car. Both endeavors will help her to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and repair car

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, 30, is married and has 2 children. She makes a type of clothing called "aho poi", a Guarani term for a traditional technique for making clothes. (Guarani is one of the official languages of Paraguay.) Aho poi clothing is much sought-after in the country, especially among tourists.

Like the majority of women, Maria learned the skill from her mother, a skill that has been passed down from generation to generation. There's a huge demand for articles of aho poi clothing and they're sold in shopping centers and even exported. In this way, Maria can help her husband by contributing to family expenses, all the more urgent now that her two children are in school and expenses are going up and up.

She's asking for a loan to buy cloth and colored threads in bulk so that she can get significant disounts and prepare for the increase in demand for her products that the summer season will bring.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la confección de ropa “aho poi”, el aho poi es un término escrito en guaraní (uno de los idiomas oficiales del país) es una técnica típica del Paraguay, que se utiliza para confeccionar ropas y es bastante apreciado, especialmente por turistas que visitan el país.

Al igual que la mayoría de las mujeres, María, aprendió las técnicas de su madre pues va pasando de generación a generación. La misma tiene una gran demanda, pues se venden en los centros de compras y hasta son exportados. De ésta forma y con éste trabajo, María ayuda a su marido aportando dinero para cubrir los gastos propios de la familia, ya que sus dos hijos están en la escuela y los gastos aumentan cada vez.

Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar telas e hilos de colores al por mayor, pues de esta forma consigue importantes descuentos y la demanda de sus productos aumentan en la época de verano que se acerca.

loans.use: Buy supplies in bulk for traditional clothing business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 27 and married with one child. For the past 3 years he has been selling produce which he buys from local farmers. He is very hard working and has large plans for the future. He would like to buy a boda-boda, motorbike, so he can more easily transport the produce he buys and sells. This would also help him to increase his volume of produce. He also would like to sell wholesale produce and distribute to other markets. Every day you can see him on his bike with his produce. He plans to use his loan to buy larger quantities of produce. John dreams of one day building his own home for his family.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of produce to sell.

loans.name: Ashurmahmad

texts.ru:
Ashurmahmad E. is 57 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. Ashurmahmad has almost 20 years of experience in livestock raising which he learned from his father, who still helps him in these difficult times to support his family. Ashurmahmad needs to increase his working capital and will use the loan to purchase livestock to raise.

Ashurmahmad’s clients produce meat and dairy products and sometimes he does not even have to go to the market as his clients come to his house to purchase the animals. They supply their product to local markets. Ashurmahmad will pay the loan back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Эмомов Ашурмахмад, возраст – 57 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Ашурмахмад имеет почти 20 летний опыт в разведение крупного и мелкого рогатого скота, который он ещё перенял у своего отца и который помогает ему сегодня в непростое время содержать свою семью. Кредит клиент хочет использовать на приобретеение крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. У него имется слишком маленькая сумма оборотных средств, что не даёт ему возможность закупить сразу большое количество скота и потом постепенно продавать его. Получив кредит у него появится возможность это сделать. Его поcтоянные клиентами являются люди, которые занимаются производством мясо-молочных изделий и порой он не выгоняет скот на рынок, так как они приходят и покупают его прямо из дома Ашурмахмада. В дальнейшем они поставляют свою продукцию на рынки районов и близлежащих городов Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Livestock

loans.name: Aftandil

texts.en: Aftandil has been in the dairy business for 5 years. He was born in 1987, is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Now he would like to buy one cow for producing more milk.

loans.use: to buy one cow

loans.name: Ifaya

texts.en: Ifaya G. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Her husband owns and operates a chemist shop in the village. (Her husband is pictured). They started their business five years ago. They needs a loan in the amount of $900 to purchase more medicine and expand their business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Elegantes , Group 3

texts.en:
Ystella is a vivacious 32 year old woman who lives in a small Haitian community on the northern coast of Puerto Plata. She lives with her husband and five children (ages 12, 9, 6, 3, 1) in a small, one bedroom house.

Ystella currently sells a variety of items to the people living in her community. She walks around everyday trying to find people to purchase the items that she has on hand. Currently, her biggest problem are customers who buy on credit and never pay her back. With this loan, she hopes to set up a store that her customers can come to and carry a larger inventory of household items. Her husband works in construction and is often out of work for weeks at a time. Having two incomes will greatly benefit their family. Eventually, Ystella would love to be able to build her own home for her family.

On behalf of Ystella, and everyone here at Esperanza International, we sincerely thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy materials to set up a shop and buy inventory of household goods

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng I. is a 52-year-old grocer from Prektahou Village, Kampong Thom Province. Lengky earns about $5 per day. Her husband, Sry Chharn, earns $3 per day as a civil servant. They have three children, two of whom are married. She requests a $300 loan to expand her grocery inventory. She hopes this loan will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory

loans.name: Judith's Tusshiamane Group

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and is widow woman with 4 children, ages 23,18,15 and 12 years old.Judith owns a smallfood vendor store and she is a charcoal seller, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in shop own, vegetable sales and clothes sales

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Chanthu

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthu H. lives in the Khsom Village of Kandal Province, where she is subsistence farmer. She is a 37-year-old married woman with six children: three of her children sell clothes in the Banteay Meanchey Province (which is on the border with Thailand), one attends school, and the others stay at home. Her husband, Mr. Nhork Chhuon (pictured on the left), is a farmer and construction worker. Aside from her farming activities, Mrs. Chanthu H. also generates income from her pump, which she permits villagers to use for a fee.

Recently, Mrs. Chanthu H. has faced mounting financial problems because her field is simply infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Chanthu H. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer, fuel for her pump, and pesticides to kill insects.

loans.use: To improve her field by purchasing additional fertilizer and pesticides, as well as fuel for her pump.

loans.name: Kat

texts.en: Kat T., 29, is a tractor driver who lives in Russey Keo with his wife (pictured above) and two young children. He typically makes $4 every day as a tractor driver, while his wife makes $2.50 as a garment factory worker. Kat T. has asked for a loan of $1000 to purchase a small tractor. The farming industry is very difficult, and farmers do not always have access to a cow or tractor to plow their lands. Kat T. would rent out his tractor to these farmers and make a profit on his purchase. He sees an opportunity in his area for this type of business and believes it can really help his family. In the future, he would like to be able to help his wife open up a grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase small tractor

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a woman who has dedicated herself to agriculture from a young age. She learned to farm at her parent’s side, and today she is the mother of 4 children to whom she tries to teach these ways and they too work the land. Nevertheless, she also wishes that her children acquire a profession, and therefore she works day after day to better her agricultural products, as well as increase the number of chickens that she raises to later sell in the markets. But her priority is growing potatoes. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 500 soles to buy items needed to take care of her land, items like manure and fertilizer. She hopes that you can help her improve her land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es una mujer que desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura, junto a sus padres aprendió las tareas del campo, hoy al ser madre de 4 pequeños trata de enseñarles esas labores para también trabajen la tierra. Sin embargo, ella también desea que sus hijos tengan una profesión, y para ello se dedica día a día a mejorar sus productos agrícolas, como también a incrementar el número de gallinas que cría para luego venderlas en los mercados. Pero su prioridad es el cultivo de la papa.Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para comprar lo necesario para el cuidado de sus terrenos, tales como abonos y fertilizantes. Ella espera que usted pueda ayudarla para la mejora de sus tierras.

loans.use: Buy manure and fertilizer for her farming land

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra lives in Ba Igovci, a small village near the town of ŽIvinice. She is 30 years old and works with her husband in agriculture. Her husband also has a full time job, so it is mostly Azra who spends time in the field. They have two children, aged four and six years old.

This is Azra’s first loan, and she is asking for 1,000 KM to buy compost and to pay the cleaning of her field. She wants to have their land prepared for crops in the spring in order to plant vegetables and crops and after some time to sell it and earn money,

loans.use: To buy compost and prepare her field for spring crops.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina S. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. S. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband is a farmer. He grows seasonal vegetables on their land due to lack of modern technology. Her son is studying in primary school.

Mina S. is engaged in duck farming. She has around 10 ducks now. She sells her ducks in the local market. Now the demand for ducks is increasing in the area because people buy ducks to celebrate the Dashain and Tihar festivals, the main festivals of Nepal. So Mrs. S. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loan to buy more ducks to sell in the local market to meet the increasing demand of the people.

loans.use: To buy ducks

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Husna K. from Mwanza. She is divorced and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18. Husna has been selling charcoal since 2005. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her children. Husna currently earns about $100 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 USD to buy more charcoal. In the future, she plans to increase the stock and also to open new business. Husna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Dame K. Denise est née en 1974 à Zinvié. Elle est mariée à grégoire DANSONHOUN, moniteur d'un centre d'auto école, et est mère de 03 enfants dont Peace la benjamine (04 ans) est en classe de CI. Dame K. Denise a été  à fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1. Elle abandonna les classes pour aider sa mère les jours du marché dans la vente de divers articles et produits vivriers. Ensuite elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide de sa grand-mère qui lui a trouvée un stand au grand marché Dantokpa de Cotonou où elle vendait  de la farine de manioc, du maïs , du haricot et autres produits vivriers.  Elle a jugé apprendre un métier, ainsi elle a suivi une formation en coiffure et tresse. Elle reçut son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage en 1995. Depuis sa libération, elle exerce ce métier et a ajouté à cela la vente des produits cosmétiques, de mèches, de tissages et autres produits de beauté.Ce troisième prêt  de 130000f viendra renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Denise K. was born in 1974 in Zinvié. She's married to Grégoire DANSONHOUN, an instructor in a driving school center. She's the mother of 3 children, out of which Peace, the youngest, attends school. Mrs. Denis K. dropped out school after middle-school, to help her mother in selling various items and food products during market days. She then became self-employed with the help of her grandmother, who found her a stand in the grand market Dantokpa in Cantonou, where she sells tapioca, corn, beans, and other food products. She also learned hairdressing and braiding, and received her diploma in 1995. Since then, she's been a hairdresser, and she also began selling cosmetics, hair extensions and other beauty products. This third loan of XOF 130'000 will help her bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bale of hair extensions and a dozen boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es: Rolin tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y está viviendo en la casa de su hermana mayor. Al igual que su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy niño, porque sus padres sembraban en grandes cantidades, y él está muy contento de ser agricultor, le agrada mucho, siguiendo el ejemplo de su hermana, siembra y luego él mismo o su esposa  llevan sus productos al mercado para comercializarlos, de ese modo, ya no dejan ganar a intermediarios con su esfuerzo. Para Rolin la agricultura le da buenas ganancias, nos dice, que sólo hay que saber atender la siembra en su momento, y estar pendiente de lo que necesita, de acuerdo a ello se le va medicando para tener una buena cosecha. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es un cliente muy responsable en sus pagos. Su inversión, con este dinero que solicita, será para la compra de “Temex” insecticida que sirve para contrarrestar al gusano, cada bolsa de 5 kilos cuesta 250 soles.
texts.en:
Rolin is 26 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He is living in his older sister´s house. Just like his family, he has been a farmer since he was a boy because his parents grew large amounts of crops. He is happy being a farmer, he likes it very much and, following the example of his sister, he plants and later he or his wife take the products to market to sell. This way he does not have to give away any of his efforts to middlemen. Farming gives Rolin good earnings. He tells us that you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. As such, he fertilizes so that he has a good harvest. This is his 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is responsible with his payments. His investment with the money he is requesting will be to buy the insectide "Temex", which will help counteract worms; each 5-kilo bag costs 250 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Felicita es conviviente tiene 47 años  tiene cinco hijos de 27, 25, 21, 14 y 10 los dos últimos estudian en el colegio 
Empezó hace diez años en la feria de cañete imperial viajaba constantemente y decidió poner su negocio  en pista nueva como ambulante de venta de saldos (ropa de segunda mano)

Felicita necesita un crédito de 1600 para la compra de mercadería de calzado de caballero, dama y niño 
Desde que entro en Finca le va mejor económicamente 
El  sueño de Felicita  es tener una tienda para que pueda vender sus productos  de saldos
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the Niño Divino microfinance institute. She is a 47-year-old woman with a live-in partner and five children, ages 27, 25, 21, 14 and 10. The two youngest children attend school.

She started her business ten years ago in the street market of Cañete Imperial. She used to travel constantly, so she decided to take a new course and work as a secondhand clothing street vendor.

Felicita needs a loan of 1,600.00 PEN in order to purchase footwear for men, women and children.

Ever since she joined Finca, her financial situation has improved. She dreams of having her own store so that she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase footwear for men, women and children

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
En L. ciudad D. El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Los Andes, a éste pertenece L. asociación “Rosas Blancas” .Un grupo muy simpático y particular ya que además D. trabajar juntas D. manera muy responsable, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Varias son las actividades del grupo, por ejemplo se dedican a L. venta D. mochilas, venta D. chamarras, venta D. madera, otros miembros D. L. asociación tiene carpinterías.
L. asociación Rosas Blancas  necesita comprar  materia prima para ampliar sus ventas, así sus ingresos mejorarían para el bien D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Los Andes center is located in the city of El Alto. The Rosas Blancas (White Roses) association is a part of this center. They are pleasant and unique members who, asiD. from collaborating responsibly, have also come to form a beautiful friendship with each other. The group members partake in several business activities, such as selling backpacks, jackets and lumber, while other members have their own carpenter’s workshops.

The Rosas Blancas association needs to purchase raw materials in order to boost sales and, consequently, their earnings for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora A. lives in Kanibadam town in the  Sugd region. Her husband works far away from home. Currently he is in Russia. Together they have four children, two of whom are school age. Nigora has to spend a lot of money on their education considering that her husband doesn’t earn enough money. She is responsible for caring for 2 cows and 4 sheep. Now Nigora wants to borrow $700 USD to buy more calves. She hopes that with her loan she will be able to earn more and cover all the expenses of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail E. is only 20 years old and still single. She proves that there is no mind too young to establish and manage a business, as she manages her own business in the city proper of Cauayan City. Business minded by heart, she solely takes charge of all the responsibilities of her business while her sister, who owns the same kind of store, serves as her adviser. Right now she lives in the urban area of San Fermin, Cauayan City, with her parents.

Her monthly income in the business is about PHP5,000. She used her savings to support the needs of her parents and as revolving capital for her business. Abegail wanted to improve her business for its sustainability, so she wanted to borrow the amount of PHP25,000 for business-expansion purposes. She believes that enough capital accompanied by patience and hard work is the best way to become successful in business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicine and provisions. She is requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicine to sell

loans.name: Bety

texts.es: Bety de 36 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios, vive con su esposo, quien es chofer y la apoya mucho. Es propietaria de 3 motocarros, los mismos que compró gracias a su trabajo en su banco comunal, son manejados, uno por su esposo y los otros por chóferes particulares. Con estos vehículos realizan transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás y trabajan desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Bety es quien administra las ganancias diarias de este negocio, pero no sólo se dedica a esto, sino que estudió el arte de las manualidades y confecciona carteras artesanales muy bonitas y bien decoradas. Con ambos negocios está muy contenta, ya que le generan recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Para el futuro le gustaría tener una flota de motocarros para brindar trabajo a jóvenes choferes que lo necesiten. Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque son organizados y se apoyan mucho entre todos. El dinero que viene solicitando es para comprar otro motocarro y aumentar las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Bety is 36 years old. She is the mother of 4 children who are in primary and secondary school. She lives with her husband, who is a driver and who helps her a great deal. She is the owner of 3 motorcars, the same ones that she has bought thanks to her work in the community bank. They are driven, one by her husband and the others by certain drivers. With these vehicles, they have transported passengers for two years, and they work from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Bety is the one who administers the daily profits, but she doesn’t only do this, but rather she studies the art of handicrafts, and she makes artisanal cards that are very pretty and well decorated. With these businesses she is very happy, as they generate sufficient resources to sustain the family expenses. For the future, she would like to have a flotilla of motorcars and to give work to young drivers who need it. With MFP she has had 11 loans and she likes to work with her group because they are organized and they help each other a lot. The money that she is asking for is to buy another motorcar and to increase the profits of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcar

loans.name: Segunda Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Segunda Esperanza tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Segunda se dedica a la venta de artículos al por menor (hilos, sombreros, lentes, lozas y artículos variados).
El crédito de Manuela Ramos le permitió incrementar su negocio, actualmente su mercadería lo distribuye por los mercados la Hermelinda, Policlino, Alto Trujillo (ubicados en la provincia de Trujillo).
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de sombreros.
Con el crédito de 400 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería (gorros). Viajará a Lima (ciudad) para realizar la compra.
Segunda tiene como sueño poner una bodega y comprar una moto para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda Esperanza is 50 years old, and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, Libertad department, Peru. She studied in highschool, and has two children who are economically dependent on her. Segunda sells retail items (yarn, hats, glasses, crockery and other items). Manuela Ramos' loan will help her business grow, she currently distributes merchandise to the markets in Hermelinda, Policlinico and Trujillo Alto (located in the Trujillo province). With the first credit of 300 soles she received from the Village Bank United for a Better Future II, she purchased hats. With the current loan of 400 soles that will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (hats). She will travel to Lima (the city) to make the purchase. Segunda has a dream to have a mini store and to buy a motorcycle, so as to increase their income and improve the quality of life of her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (hats)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Nº 259, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 08 hijos ya mayores D. edad.

Juliana, es una mujer que a su edad, se siente capaz D. seguir a delante y trabajar hasta donD. Dios le D. fuerzas, se siente muy bien con lo que hace, ya que se dedica a la venta D. frutas, venD. en el Mercado Central y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Nos cuenta que se inicio vendiendo verduras en una mesita ubicada en su misma casa, se dio cuenta que no vendía mucho; así que decidió implementar su negocio en el mercado. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos. 

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar donD. cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita, para preparar sus jugos u otras cosas, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos D. naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Juliana, se siente una mujer luchadora, y contenta por haber cumplido algunas metas que tenia trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Juliana belongs to the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. She lives in Jr. Eduardo Peña Nº 259, Juanjui district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 64, married, and has eight grown children. At her age, Juliana feels capable of continuing on with work as long as God gives her the strength. She feels very good about what she does. She sells fruit in the Central Market. Her sales are going very well because she is very well known to her customers. She started selling vegetables from a small table in her own home. She realized that she was not selling much; so she decided to install her business in the market. She continues with the same business, and she is very happy with what she does. She can also count on help from her children. She currently has loyal customers who come to the Market to shop daily. At the Market they can find everything a housewife needs to prepare juices and other thing. She personally waits on them with a smile. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she wants to buy sacks of oranges, mandarins, lemons, grapefruit, golden apples and different varieties of fruit to better serve her customers and makes sure they find what they need. Juliana feels that she is a fighter. She is happy to have met some of the goals that she has had in life. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her establish her business, and also helping the many women who want to grow personally and in business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kamiro

texts.en:
Kamiro C., currently in the business of selling various goods in her shop, is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell.  Thirty-five years old and married to a peasant, she has five children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel and lodge.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell.

loans.name: Kalamarka Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento KALAMARKA, trabaja en nuestra Institución desde el 31 de marzo de 2007, la mayoría de las participantes mujeres se dedica a la venta de frutas y comida, los varones en su mayoría son conductores. Este banco se caracteriza porque desde su fundación siempre tuvieron la participación de varones y actualmente esta conformado por el 50% de varones y 50 % de mujeres, hasta la fecha no han tenido problemas porque los integrantes estan cohesionados y organizados.  
La presidenta del Banco es la Sra. Adela Durán, quien se dedica a la producción y comercialización de frutas, ella tiene un terreno en la localidad de Sapahaqui de donde sus trae sus productos y los comercializa directamente en los mercados de El Tejar y Rodríguez. La Sra. con los préstamos otorgados por la Institución a podido mejorar su producción, en cuanto a injertos y control de plagas, lo que a posibilitado diversificar y aumentar su producción, logrando con esto mayores ingresos y mejorando sus calidad de vida para ella y sus familia.
Moisés C. C. ocupa el cargo de Tesorero, el es chofer-propietario, con los prestamos a podido ahorrar para poder  arreglar su movilidad, con el préstamo otorgado tiene planes de comprar otra movilidad y así poder mejorar la calidad de su familia que esta conformada de 4 miembros.
Lourdes M. H., tiene una familia constituida por 3 personas, se dedica a la venta de comida, con el préstamo otorgado la Sra. comprara algunos insumos por quintales y por cantidad como: arroz, fideo, papa y aceite, esto posibilitara que el aumento en los precios no le afecte de gran manera y ella pueda aumentar sus ganancias en su negocio.
En la fotografia estan 11 personas, el Sr. Luis Fermanando M. M. esta presente con su señora esposa.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank Kalamarka has worked with our institution since March 31, 2007. The majority of the female participants sell fruit and other food; most of the men are drivers. This bank is notable because men have participated in it from the very beginning; the members are currently 50 percent men and 50 percent women. To date, they have not had any problems because the members are united and organized. The president of the bank is Adela Durán, who grows and sells fruit. She owns a piece of land in Sapahaqui, and brings her products to sell them directly in the El Tejar and Rodríguez markets. With the loans provided by the institution, she has been able to improve her production using grafting and pest control, which has enabled her to diversify and increase her production, thus earning more money and improving her family's quality of life. Moisés C. C. is the treasurer. He is a taxi driver who owns his own car, and has been able to use the loans to save up and repair his vehicle. He plans to use this loan to buy another vehicle and improve the quality of life of his family of four. Lourdes M. H. has a small family of three. She sells food. She will use the loan to buy some bulk and wholesale consumables such as rice, pasta, potatoes, and oil. This will protect her from rising prices so she can increase her earnings in her business. There are 11 people in the photograph. Luis Fernando M. M. is present along with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Busulwa East Mary Walusimbi Group

texts.en: Mary W. is forty-years old, married, with eight children, all schooling. Mary sells fried chicken; it is so far eight years for her, doing this type of business. She is using the loan to purchase chicken from the market, charcoal, and cooking oil to fry the chicken for sale to customers. The loan will improve her business because she will be able to fry much more chicken to meet the demand of her customers daily; she is doing well compared to previous days. Her dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: Purchasing chicken from market, charcoal, and cooking oil

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José Velásquez , tiene la edad de 40 años , habita en el barrio , La Borgoña , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Rolando se desempeña como docentes desde hace 10 años , su sueldo no es lo suficiente para poder comprar materiales de construcción , ya que el desde hace seis ciclo viene trabajando con nuestra institución y ha logrado mejorar gran parte de su vivienda . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y comenzar hacer las mejoras. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Señor Rolando José Velásquez is 40 years old and lives in the Borgoña neighborhood with his wife who works and helps with the household activities. They have three children whom they support. Their hope for the future is to improve their quality of life. Don Rolando has been a teacher for 10 years. His income is not sufficient to be able to purchase construction materials. This is his sixth loan with our institution. The previous loans have enabled him to improve a large portion of his dwelling. With the loan he will purchase construction materials and begin the remaining home improvements. He gives thanks to the institution for all the support they have given him.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish construction of his house.

loans.name: Gladys Predesvinda

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene  2 hijos quienes  dependen económicamente D. ella, porque aún se encuentran en el colegio.
Gladys se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir que trae D. Lima.
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra D. ropa y así inició su negocio.
Este crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas ropa D. niños, jóvenes y adultos
Gladys sueña con tener su propio stand en un centro comercial D. Trujillo en donD. pueda vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, La Libertad department - Peru. She is a member of the Banco Comunal SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II. The entrepreneur has a 5-year secondary education. She has two children who depend on her financially because they are still in school. Gladys is involved in the sale of clothing articles that she brings from Lima. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of clothing which is how she began her business. This credit of 1,000 nuevos soles will be used to buy more clothing articles for children, teens and adults. Gladys’ dream is to have her own stand in a commercial center in Trujillo, where she would be able to sell her products and make bigger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children, teens and adults for resale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married to Peter and they were gifted with four children: Petre - 23 years old; Mary Flor – 22 years old; Julius – 19 years old, a college student and Abigail - 18 years old. Their two eldest children are already married. Because of the hardships that she had in life during her younger years, Tessie has the determination to work hard to give her family a better way of living.
The couple is managing an eatery business along the high school building in their place. Her husband also works as a farmer where they can earn seasonal income. Aside from their eatery and farming business, they also maintain a piggery. Sometimes her husband also works as a part time carpenter where he can earn a salary of PHP280 a day.
Tessie wants her eatery or school canteen business to grow. And for this she needed additional capital to pursue her plan. She is now requesting financial assistance from KIVA lenders a loan of PHP20, 000. She is eager to see the progress in her business thus she is working hard and patiently waiting for it to become progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es: Carlos David G. P. reside en Quezaltepeque en el departamento de La Libertad. Carlos vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años llamado igual que su padre Carlos David.
